{{EngvarB|date=August 2014}} {{Use dmy dates|date=August 2014}} {{redirect|Strzelecki}} {{Infobox person | name = Sir Paweł Edmund Strzelecki |image = Paweł Edmund Strzelecki.jpg |image_width = |caption = | birth_date = {{birth date|1797|7|24}} | birth_place = [[Głuszyna, Greater Poland Voivodeship|Głuszyna]], [[Kingdom of Prussia]] | death_date = {{death date and age|1873|10|6|1797|7|24}} | death_place = [[London]], [[United Kingdom]] | alma_mater = [[University of Heidelberg]]{{cite news|url=http://podroze.onet.pl/aktywnie/pawel-edmund-strzelecki/t6264dd |title=Paweł Edmund Strzelecki |access-date=2018-09-08}} | occupation = geographer, geologist, explorer | known for = exploration of [[Australia]] | awards = [[Gold Medal of the Royal Geographical Society]] (1846)
[[Order of the Bath]] (1849)
[[Order of St Michael and St George]] (1869) }} '''Sir Paweł Edmund Strzelecki''' {{post-nominals|country=GBR|KCMG|CB|FRS|FRGS|DCL}} ({{IPA-pl|ˈpavɛw ˈɛdmunt stʂɛˈlɛt͡skʲi}}; 24 June 1797{{spaced ndash}}6 October 1873), also known as '''Paul Edmund de Strzelecki''', was a Polish{{cite book |title=Dzieje nauki polskiej|last= Iłowiecki|first=Maciej|year=1981|publisher=Wydawnictwo Interpress|location= Warszawa|page= 165|isbn=83-223-1876-6}}{{cite book |title=Polacy w cywilizacjach świata do końca wieku XIX |last=Retinger |first=Józef Hieronim |year=1991 |publisher=Krajowa Agencja Wydawnicza |location=Gdańsk |page=191 |isbn=83-03-03362-X}} explorer and geologist{{cite news|url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article26585171|title=He found Gippsland|newspaper=[[The Argus (Melbourne)|The Argus]]|location=Melbourne, Victoria|date=16 January 1954|accessdate=30 April 2012|page=8|publisher=[[National Library of Australia]]}} who in 1845 also became a British subject. He is noted for his contributions to the exploration of [[Australia]], particularly the [[Snowy Mountains]] and [[Tasmania]] as well as climbing and naming the highest mountain on the continent – [[Mount Kosciuszko]] (2,228 m). ==Early years== Strzelecki was born in 1797, in Glausche, [[Kingdom of Prussia]] (today the town is called [[Głuszyna, Greater Poland Voivodeship|Głuszyna]], part of [[Nowe Miasto, Poznań]], [[Poland]]), the third child of Franciszek Strzelecki, a Polish nobleman ([[Szlachta|szlachcic]]) leasing land, and his wife, Anna Raczyńska.{{Dictionary of Australian Biography|First=Sir Paul Edmund de|Last=Strzelecki|shortlink=0-dict-biogSt-Sy.html#strzelecki1}} In Australia, Strzelecki was called a ''Count'', though there is no proof that he actually approved or used such a title himself. Strzelecki served shortly in the [[Prussian Army]] in the 6th Regiment of Thuringischen [[Uhlan]]s, at the time known as Polish Regiment because so many Poles served on the staff. However, the stiff Prussian drill did not agree with his character and he submitted his resignation and returned home. There are some suggestions{{Australian Dictionary of Biography|last=Heney|first=Helen|year=1967|id=A020457b|title=Strzelecki, Sir Paul Edmund de [Count Strzelecki]}} that he deserted the Regiment but in the official history of the Regiment the name Strzelecki does not appear.Paszkowski, Lech, Sir Paul Edmund de Strzelecki. Arkadia, Australian Scholarly Publishing 1997. Not long after, he became a tutor at the manor of local nobility. He fell in love with his young student, a girl of 15, Adyna Turno, but was rejected as a suitor by her father, Adam Turno. There are stories that Strzelecki attempted unsuccessfully to elope with Adyna, but biographers find this unlikely. Adyna and Strzelecki exchanged letters over 40 years but they never married. Strzelecki, provided with funds by his family, travelled in [[Austria]] and [[Italy]]. He eventually came under the notice of [[Sapieha family|Prince Sapieha]], who placed him in charge of a large estate in the Russian-occupied part of Poland. Strzelecki was then about 26 years of age and carried out his duties very successfully. Some years later the prince died, and a dispute arose between his son and heir, Eustace, and Strzelecki. Eustace refused to pay Strzelecki the prince's bequest – a huge sum of money and a considerable estate – accusing him of bad faith and prevarication. After four years the dispute was settled. Strzelecki left Poland about 1829 and stayed some time in [[France]], from where he travelled to [[Africa]].{{cite news|url=http://www.pgi.gov.pl/gdansk/wody-podziemne-pomorza/135-kopalnia-wiedzy-nowe/historia-geologii/2109-pawes-edmund-strzelecki.html |title=Paweł Edmund Strzelecki |access-date=2018-09-08}}{{cite news|url=http://podroze.onet.pl/aktywnie/pawel-edmund-strzelecki/t6264dd |title=Paweł Edmund Strzelecki |access-date=2018-09-08}} On 8 June 1834, he sailed from [[Liverpool]] to New York. He travelled widely in North and South America, [[Cuba]], [[Tahiti]] and the [[Polynesia|South Sea Islands]], and went to [[New Zealand]] probably about the beginning of 1839. ==Australia== [[File:Jindabyne-Strzelecki statue.jpg|thumb|left|upright|Statue of Strzelecki in [[Jindabyne, New South Wales|Jindabyne]]]] He arrived at Sydney on 25 April 1839. He visited the estate of his friend James Macarthur at Camden. He wrote about meeting the German [[vintners]] that the Macarthurs had brought to Australia from the [[Rheingau]] region.https://dictionaryofsydney.org/entry/german_vinedressers_in_camden He wrote: "I had gone with my host to look at the farm, the fields, and the vineyard, — contiguous to which last stood in a row six neat cottages, surrounded with kitchen gardens, and inhabited by six families of German vine-dressers, who emigrated two years ago to New South Wales, either driven there by necessity, or seduced by the hope of finding, beyond the sea, fortune, peace, and happiness, – perhaps justice and liberty. The German salutation which I gave to the group that stood nearest, was like some signal-bell, which instantly set the whole colony in motion. Fathers, mothers, and children came running from all sides to see, to salute, and to talk to the gentleman who came from Germany. They took me for their fellow-countryman, and were happy, questioning me about Germany, the Rhine, and their native town. I was far from undeceiving them."Paul Edmund de Strzelecki, Physical Description of New South Wales and Van Diemen's Land, Longman, Brown, Green, and Longmans, London, 1845, p 462 At the request of the [[Governor of New South Wales]], Sir [[George Gipps]], he made a geological and mineralogical survey of the [[Gippsland]] region in present-day eastern [[Victoria (Australia)|Victoria]], where he made many discoveries. He discovered gold in 1839, but Gipps feared the effects of gold on the colony and persuaded Strzelecki to keep his discovery secret. Later in 1839 Strzelecki set out on an expedition into the [[Australian Alps]] and explored the [[Snowy Mountains]] with James Macarthur, James Riley and two [[Indigenous Australians|Aboriginal]] guides: Charlie Tarra and Jackey. In 1840 he climbed the highest peak on mainland Australia and named it [[Mount Kosciuszko]], to honour [[Tadeusz Kościuszko]], one of the national heroes of Poland and a hero of the [[American Revolutionary War]]. On Victorian maps (but never on New South Wales maps) the name Mount Kosciusko was erroneously connected to the neighbouring peak, at present known as [[Mount Townsend]]Dowd, B.T. 'The Cartography of Mount Kosciusko', Journal of the Royal Australian Historical Society vol. 26 Part I (1940) pp. 97–107 and causing later many confusions, including the recent incorrect information on swapping the names of the mountains.[http://www.abs.gov.au/Ausstats/abs@.nsf/0/6a446874c613a955ca2569e300158043/ Mountain Systems (Orography) of Australia], ''Year Book Australia 1910'', [[Australian Bureau of Statistics]] From there Strzelecki made a journey through Gippsland. After passing the [[La Trobe River]] it was found necessary to abandon the horses and all the specimens that had been collected and try to reach [[Western Port]]. For 22 days they were on the edge of starvation and were ultimately saved by the knowledge and hunting ability of their guide Charlie, who caught native animals for them to eat. The party, practically exhausted, arrived at Western Port on 12 May 1840 and reached [[Melbourne]] on 28 May. From 1840 to 1842, based in [[Launceston, Tasmania|Launceston]], Tasmania (then known as [[Van Diemen's Land]]), Strzelecki explored nearly every part of the island, usually on foot with three men and two pack horses. The [[Governor of Tasmania|Lieutenant-Governor]], Sir [[John Franklin]], and his wife, [[Jane Franklin|Lady Jane]],{{Cite journal|last=Maloney|first=Shane|authorlink=Shane Maloney|date=June 2010|title=Count Paul Strzelecki & Lady Jane Franklin|journal=[[The Monthly]]|issue=57|page=74|issn=1832-3421}} afforded him every help in his scientific endeavours. Strzelecki left Tasmania on 29 September 1842 by steamer and arrived in Sydney on 2 October. He was collecting specimens in northern New South Wales towards the end of that year, and on 22 April 1843, he left Sydney after having travelled {{Convert|11000|km|mi|-3|abbr=off}} through New South Wales, Victoria and Tasmania, examining the geology along the way. He went to England after visiting China, the [[East Indies]] and Egypt. In 1845 he published his ''Physical Description of New South Wales and Van Diemen's Land'' which was awarded the [[Gold Medal of the Royal Geographical Society]] in May 1846. In 1845 he became a naturalised British subject. ==Europe== Towards the end of 1846, the [[Great Famine (Ireland)|Great Irish Famine]] was underway and the [[British Relief Association]] formed with the sum of £500,000 subscribed for the relief of the sufferers. Strzelecki was appointed an agent of the Association to superintend the distribution of supplies in [[County Sligo]], [[County Mayo]] and [[County Donegal]]. He devoted himself to his task with success, though he was for a time incapacitated by famine fever. In 1847 and 1848 he continued his work in Dublin as sole agent for the Association. In recognition of his services, he was made a Companion of the [[Order of the Bath]] (CB) in November 1848. He helped impoverished Irish families to seek new lives in Australia. It has been estimated that the various works in which he was involved saved 200,000 Irish lives. (There is a commemorative plaque dedicated to him on [[O'Connell Street|Sackville Place]], Dublin[https://www.google.ie/maps/place/Sir+Pawe%C5%82+Edmund+Strzelecki+Memorial/@53.3489191,-6.259371,3a,75y,90t/data=!3m8!1e2!3m6!1s-_ueyi7y-eKA%2FWC2oz0BkrEI%2FAAAAAAABneU%2F-afmrNYZfyEB7eV268wk0WOCFbCXtuxHwCLIB!2e4!3e12!6s%2F%2Flh4.googleusercontent.com%2F-_ueyi7y-eKA%2FWC2oz0BkrEI%2FAAAAAAABneU%2F-afmrNYZfyEB7eV268wk0WOCFbCXtuxHwCLIB%2Fw86-h123-k-no%2F!7i1429!8i2048!4m12!1m6!3m5!1s0x0:0x2be47c2757297436!2sAbbey+Theatre!8m2!3d53.3484661!4d-6.2574136!3m4!1s0x0:0x66b48478994b64fc!8m2!3d53.3489318!4d-6.2593766!6m1!1e1 photograph of the plaque in Dublin]). He was also active in helping injured soldiers during the [[Crimean War]], being personally acquainted with [[Florence Nightingale]]. Strzelecki arrived back to London in 1849, where he was made a [[fellow]] of the Royal Geographical Society and was awarded its [[Gold Medal (RGS)|gold medal]] for "exploration in the south eastern portion of Australia". The Society still displays his huge geological map of New South Wales and Tasmania for public viewing. He was also made a fellow of the [[Royal Society]], having gained widespread recognition as an explorer as well as a philanthropist. Strzelecki died of liver cancer in London in 1873 and was buried in [[Kensal Green Cemetery]]. In 1997 his remains were transferred to the crypt P.E.Strzelecki [http://mtkosciuszko.org.au/english/strzelecki-missing.htm transferred to the crypt] of merit of St. Wojciech Church in his hometown of [[Poznań]], Poland. ==Awards and honours== He was awarded an honorary degree from the [[University of Oxford]], appointed a Companion of the [[Order of the Bath]] (CB), and knighted as a Knight Commander of the [[Order of St Michael and St George]] (KCMG) in 1869.{{London Gazette |issue=23512 |page=3750 |date=1 July 1869 }} In 1983 he was honoured on a postage stamp depicting his portrait issued by [[Australia Post]].[http://www.australianstamp.com/images/large/0014560.jpg Stamp depicting Strzelecki] ==Eponyms== [[File:Kosciuszko02.JPG|thumb|A commemorative plaque devoted to Strzelecki on the summit of [[Mount Kosciuszko]], the highest mountain in Australia]] '''In Australia''' *[[Strzelecki Ranges]], Victoria, in which is located the township of Strzelecki. The [[Strzelecki railway line]] ran through the ranges to the township. *Mount Strzelecki, [[Northern Territory]] *Strzelecki Peak, [[Flinders Island]] *[[Strzelecki Creek]], South Australia *Strzelecki Highway, [[Victoria (Australia)|Victoria]] *[[Strzelecki Track]], South Australia *[[Strzelecki Desert]], east of [[Lake Eyre]] in South Australia *Strzelecki Scenic Lookout, [[Newcastle, New South Wales]] '''In Canada''' *Strzelecki Harbour ==Writing== * ''Physical Description of New South Wales. Accompanied by a Geological Map, Sections and Diagrams, and Figures of the Organic Remains'' (London, 1845). ==References== {{reflist}} '''Sources''' *''Sir Paul Edmund de Strzelecki. Reflections of his life '' by Lech Paszkowski, Australian Scholarly Publishing, 1997, {{ISBN|1-875606-39-4}} *''Kosciusko The Mountain in History '' by Alan E.J. Andrews Tabletop Press, Canberra 1991, {{ISBN|0-9590841-2-6}} *''Paul Edmund Strzelecki and His Team. Achieving Together '' by Ernestyna Skurjat-Kozek & Lukasz Swiatek, FKPP, Sydney 2009, {{ISBN|978-0-646-51234-1}} *''Sir Paul E. Strzelecki: A Polish Count's Explorations in 19th Century Australia'' by Marian Kaluski, A E Press, Melbourne, 1985, {{ISBN|0-86787-039-7}} ==External links== {{Commons category|Paul Strzelecki}} *{{OL author|6029850A}} * [http://mtkosciuszko.org.au/ Mt Kosciuszko Inc.] an organisation of Polish emigrants, was established in [[Perth]], Western Australia, in 2002 to raise public interest in the early history of Mount Kosciuszko and Strzelecki's cultural contributions. * [http://www.angelfire.com/scifi2/rsolecki/pawel_strzelecki.html Paweł Edmund Strzelecki], Prominent Poles * [https://www.irishtimes.com/culture/heritage/pole-star-an-irishman-s-diary-about-the-famine-relief-work-of-pawel-strzelecki-1.2115887] * [https://www.irishcentral.com/roots/history/irish-honor-polish-explorer-and-scientist-who-helped-famine-victims] {{Great Hunger}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Strzelecki, Paul Edmund}} [[Category:Polish explorers]] [[Category:Polish geologists]] [[Category:Polish geographers]] [[Category:Explorers of Australia]] [[Category:Australian geologists]] [[Category:Fellows of the Royal Society]] [[Category:Fellows of the Royal Geographical Society]] [[Category:Polish nobility]] [[Category:Companions of the Order of the Bath]] [[Category:Knights Commander of the Order of St Michael and St George]] [[Category:1797 births]] [[Category:1873 deaths]] [[Category:People from the Province of Posen]] [[Category:Burials at Kensal Green Cemetery]]

revision.comment: Adding [[Wikipedia:Short description|short description]]: "Protected nature area in Georgia (country)" ([[User:Galobtter/Shortdesc helper|Shortdesc helper]])
revision.text:
{{short description|Protected nature area in Georgia (country)}} {{Infobox protected area | name = Ritsa Strict Nature Reserve | iucn_category = Ia | photo = რიწის ტბა.jpg | photo_caption = Lake Ritsa. | map = Georgia#Georgia Abkhazia | relief = 1 | map_caption = | location = {{flag|Abkhazia}},{{Abkhazia note}}
{{flag|Georgia}} | nearest_city = | coordinates = {{coords|43|29|24|N|40|37|04|E|display=inline,title}} | coords_ref = | area_acre = | area_km2 =162.88 | area_ref = | authorized = | established = 1930 | visitation_num = | visitation_year = | visitation_ref = | governing_body = Agency of Protected Areas | website = [http://apa.gov.ge/en/protected-areas/reserve Strict Nature Reserve Info] }} '''Ritsa Strict Nature Reserve''' ({{lang-ka|რიწის დაცული ტერიტორია}}) is a [[List of protected areas of Georgia|protected area]] in the [[Gudauta District]] of [[Abkhazia]], [[Georgia (country)|Georgia]].{{cite web|url=https://www.protectedplanet.net/ritsa-strict-nature-reserve|title=Ritsa in Georgia|website=Protected Planet|accessdate=2018-11-02}} Reserve main goal is protecting [[Lake Ritsa]] and flora and fauna in surrounding mountainous region. {{cite web|url=http://apa.gov.ge/en/protected-areas/reserve|title=Strict Nature Reserve Info - Agency of Protected Areas of Georgia|website=apa.gov.ge|accessdate=2018-11-09}} == History == In [[20th century]] de-facto control over this area frequently changed. In 1930 Russian Federation established ''Ritsinsky Reserve''. When [[Georgian independence referendum, 1991|Georgia reestablished it independence in 1991]] the territory of reserve was enlarged and modern '''Ritsa Strict Nature Reserve''' established. With outbreak of [[Abkhaz–Georgian conflict]] and subsequent war, de-facto control is presently exercised by government of [[Abkhazia]], which established here in 1996 ''Ritsinsky Relic National Park''.[https://www.researchgate.net/publication/312644918_Modern_State_of_Populations_of_Rare_Endem_LiliumKesselringianumMiscz_in_Ritsinsky_Relic_National_Park_Republic_of_Abkhazia Modern State of Populations of Rare Endem Lilium Kesselringianum Miscz. in Ritsinsky Relic National Park (Republic of Abkhazia)][https://www.tourister.ru/world/europe/abkhazija/city/gagra/nationalparks/16745 Ritsinsky Relic National Park] == Geography == [[File:SmallRitsa.JPG|250px|left|thumb|[[Lake Smaller Ritsa]].]] '''Ritsa Strict Nature Reserve''' is located in the mountainous part of [[Abkhazia]] on the southern slope of the [[Greater Caucasus range]], covering territory from the Gegi River gorge to the Pshchitsa River gorge. The strong differentiation of the relief from 100 m to 3,256 thousand meters above sea level ([[Mount Agepsta]]) creates a rich spectrum of ecological conditions for the growth of many plants and animal habitats The largest, beautiful and famous is [[Lake Ritsa]]. Other lakes - [[Lake Smaller Ritsa|Smaller Ritsa]], [[:ru:Голубое озеро (Абхазия)|Blue Lake]] - no less picturesque and beautiful. There are also several [[waterfall]]s here, the most famous among them is the Gegsky waterfall, with height at about 55 meters. == Flora == The protected area of [[Euxine-Colchic deciduous forests]] has many evergreen boxwood ([[Buxus colchica]]) groves as well as specimens of the [[Nordmann Fir]] ([[Abies nordmanniana]]), which reach heights of over 70 meters (over 230 ft.), and specimens of [[European yew]] ([[Taxus baccata]]) Arnold Gegechkori [https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S1512188718300836#bbib25 Patterns of distribution and survival of European yew (Taxus baccata L.) in an alpine tree line ecotone in the Greater Caucasus (Georgia)] Annals of Agrarian Science Volume 16, Issue 2, June 2018, Pages 170-176 There are variety of rare endemic specimens, such as [[Lilium kesselringianum]], [[Primula farinosa]] [https://www.researchgate.net/publication/284748695_To_Biology_of_a_Rare_Species_of_Primula_Farinosa_L_in_Ritsinsky_Relic_National_Park_Abkhazia_Republic To Biology of a Rare Species of Primula Farinosa L. in Ritsinsky Relic National Park (Abkhazia Republic)] and others, such as widespread in reserve [[Campanula|bellflower]] ([[Campanula]]). == Fauna == [[Mammals]] are represented by Caucasian Red Deer ([[Cervus elaphus maral]]), [[West Caucasian tur]] ([[Capra caucasica]]), ([[Rupicapra]]), ([[Capreolus]]), [[wild boar]], [[Caucasian wildcat]] ([[Felis silvestris caucasica]]), forest marten, rabbits. Very rich is local world of birds - more than 273 species, 71 of which are rare. About 100 species of birds nest here and others passes through the park via the East Black Sea [[Flyway]]. Here one can see the [[golden eagle]] ([[Aquila chrysaetos]]), [[griffon vulture]] ([[Gyps fulvus]]), [[cinereous vulture]] ([[Aegypius monachus]]), [[common blackbird]] ([[Turdus merula]]), [[great tit]] ([[Parus major]]), [[Caucasian snowcock]] ([[Tetraogallus caucasicus]]), [[Caucasian grouse]] ([[Lyrurus mlokosiewiczi]]), [[red-fronted serin]] ([[Serinus pusillus]]), [[goldcrest]] ([[Regulus regulus]]), [[common chaffinch]] ([[Fringilla coelebs|Fringilla coelebs solomkoi]]). There are also a rare species of frog: the [[Caucasian parsley frog]] ([[Pelodytes caucasicus]]), the [[Caucasian toad]] ([[Bufo verrucosissimus]]), and the endemic [[southern banded newt]] ([[Ommatotriton vittatus]]) and more common [[caucasus viper]] ([[Vipera kaznakovi]]). == See also == *[[Lake Ritsa]] *[[Lake Smaller Ritsa]] == References == {{Reflist}} {{commonscat|Ritsa Strict Nature Reserve}} {{commonscat|Lake Ritsa}} {{Protected areas of Georgia (country)}} [[Category:National parks of Georgia (country)]] [[Category:Protected areas established in 1930]] [[Category:Geography of Abkhazia]] [[Category:Territorial disputes of Georgia (country)]] {{Georgia-geo-stub}} {{Abkhazia-geo-stub}}

{{Other uses|Reunion (disambiguation)|La Reunion (disambiguation){{!}}La Reunion}} {{Infobox French region | name = Réunion | native_name = {{native name|fr|La Réunion|}} | flag = Flag of Réunion.svg | shield = Armoiries Réunion.svg | motto = ''[[Florebo quocumque ferar]]'' | image_map = Département 974 in France (zoom).svg | national_anthem = [[La Marseillaise]] (official) | capital = [[Saint-Denis, Réunion|Saint-Denis]] | largest_city = | area = 2511 |area_source = |currency = Euro |population = 865,826 |pop_ref = {{cite web| url=https://www.insee.fr/fr/statistiques/fichier/1893198/estim-pop-nreg-sexe-gca-1975-2018.xls | title=Estimation de population par région, sexe et grande classe d'âge - Années 1975 à 2018| author=[[INSEE]]| accessdate=27 January 2018|language=fr}} |pop_date = January 2018 |pop_rank = 34 |GDP_rank = |GDP_year = 2016 |GDP_ref = {{cite web | url=http://appsso.eurostat.ec.europa.eu/nui/show.do?dataset=nama_10r_2gdp&lang=en | title=Gross domestic product (GDP) at current market prices by NUTS 2 regions | publisher=[[Eurostat]]|accessdate=2018-03-12}} |GDP = 19.2 |GDP_US$ = 21.3 |GDP_per_capita = 22,400 |GDP_per_capita_US$ = 24,800 |Website = [http://www.reunion.pref.gouv.fr/ Prefecture]
[http://www.regionreunion.com Regional Council]
[http://www.cg974.fr/ Departmental Council] |demonym = Réunionese |leader_title = [[List of Presidents of the Regional Council of Réunion|President of Regional Council]] |leader = [[Didier Robert]] |leader_party = |ruling_party1 =un |ruling_party2 = |cctld = [[.re]] |overseas = overseas |timezone1 = RET |utc_offset1 = +04 |calling_code = 262 |departments = 1 |NUTS = FRY4 |iso region = RE }} '''Réunion''' ({{lang-fr|La Réunion}}, {{IPA-fr|la ʁe.ynjɔ̃|pron|Lareunion.ogg}}; previously ''Île Bourbon'') is an [[overseas department and region of France]] and an [[island]] in the [[Indian Ocean]], east of [[Madagascar]] and {{convert|175|km|mi|abbr=on}} southwest of [[Mauritius]]. {{As of|January 2018}}, it had a population of 865,826. It has the highest [[per capita GDP]] in the Indian Ocean. The island has been inhabited since the 16th century, when people from France and Madagascar settled there. Slavery was abolished on 20 December 1848 (a date celebrated yearly on the island), after which [[indentured workers]] were brought from [[South India]], among other places. The island became an [[overseas department]] of France in 1946. As in France, the official language is [[French language|French]]. In addition, the majority of the region's population speaks [[Réunion Creole]]. Administratively, Réunion is one of the overseas departments of France. Like the other four overseas departments, it is also one of the 18 [[regions of France]], with the modified status of [[overseas region]], and an integral part of the republic with the same status as [[Metropolitan France]]. Réunion is an [[Special member state territories and the European Union|outermost region]] of the [[European Union]] and, as an overseas department of France, part of the [[Eurozone]].Réunion is pictured on all [[Euro banknotes]], on the back at the bottom of each note, right of the Greek ΕΥΡΩ (EURO) next to the denomination. == History == [[File:10-cent-1816-Isle-Bourbon.jpg|thumb|A 1816 10-cent coin, Isle de Bourbon]] Not much is known of Réunion's history prior to the arrival of the [[Portugal|Portuguese]] in the early 16th century.{{cite web|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=WVmqM7F-J4QC&pg=PA9|title=Slaves, Freedmen and Indentured Laborers in Colonial Mauritius|first=Richard B.|last=Allen|date=14 October 1999|publisher=Cambridge University Press|via=Google Books}} Arab traders were familiar with it by the name ''Dina Morgabin''.{{Cite book |title=Histoire de la justice dans les Mascareignes |last=Tabuteau |first=Jacques |language=French |trans-title=|year=1987 |publisher=Océan éditions |location=Paris |isbn=2-907064-00-2 |page=13 |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=BmgwAAAAYAAJ |accessdate=2011-06-11 |quote= }} The island is possibly featured on a map from 1153 AD by [[Muhammad al-Idrisi|Al Sharif el-Edrisi]].{{citation needed|date=August 2015}} The island might also have been visited by [[Swahili people|Swahili]] or [[Austronesian peoples|Austronesian]] (Ancient Indonesian–Malaysian) sailors on their journey to the west from the [[Malay Archipelago]] to Madagascar. The first European discovery of the area was made around 1507 by Portuguese explorer [[Diogo Fernandes Pereira]], but the specifics are unclear. The uninhabited island might have been first sighted by the expedition led by [[Pedro Mascarenhas|Dom Pedro Mascarenhas]], who gave his name to the island group around Réunion, the [[Mascarene Islands|Mascarenes]].{{Cite book |title=Islands in the southern Indian Ocean westward of Longitude 80 degrees east, including Madagascar |last=Moriarty |first=Cpt. H.A. |year=1891 |publisher=[[United Kingdom Hydrographic Office|Great Britain Hydrographic Office]] |location=London |isbn= |oclc=416495775 |page=269 |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=-NmhAAAAMAAJ&pg=PA269}} Réunion itself was dubbed ''Santa Apolónia'' after [[Saint Apollonia|a favourite saint]], which suggests that the date of the Portuguese discovery could have been 9 February, her saint day. [[Diogo Lopes de Sequeira]] is said to have landed on the islands of Réunion and [[Rodrigues]] in 1509.{{citation needed|date=August 2015}} By the early 1600s, nominal Portuguese rule had left Santa Apolónia virtually untouched. The island was then occupied by France and administered from [[Port Louis]], [[Mauritius]]. Although the first French claims date from 1638, when François Cauche and Salomon Goubert visited in June 1638,{{cite web|url=http://www.clicanoo.re/index.php?page=imprimer&id_article=97540 |title=| Journal de l'île de la Réunion |publisher=Clicanoo.re |date= |accessdate=2013-03-12}} the island was officially claimed by Jacques Pronis of France in 1642, when he deported a dozen French [[mutiny|mutineers]] to the island from [[Madagascar]]. The convicts were returned to France several years later, and in 1649, the island was named Île Bourbon after the French royal [[House of Bourbon]]. Colonisation started in 1665, when the [[French East India Company]] sent the first settlers. [[File:MaheDeLaBourdonnais 2.JPG|thumb|Statue of [[Mahé de La Bourdonnais]] in [[Saint-Denis, Réunion|Saint-Denis]]]] "Île de la Réunion" was the name given to the island in 1793 by a decree of the [[Convention Nationale]] (the elected revolutionary constituent assembly) with the [[French Revolution|fall of the House of Bourbon in France]], and the name commemorates the union of revolutionaries from [[Marseille]] with the [[National Guard (France)|National Guard]] in Paris, which took place on 10 August 1792. In 1801, the island was renamed "Île Bonaparte", after First Consul [[Napoleon Bonaparte]]. During the [[Napoleonic Wars]], the island [[Invasion of Île Bonaparte|was invaded]] by a [[Royal Navy]] squadron led by [[Commodore (rank)|Commodore]] [[Josias Rowley]] in 1810, who used the old name of "Bourbon". When it was restored to France by the [[Congress of Vienna]] in 1815, the island retained the name of "Bourbon" until the fall of the restored Bourbons during the [[French Revolution of 1848]], when the island was once again given the name "Île de la Réunion". From the 17th to 19th centuries, French colonisation, supplemented by importing Africans, Chinese and [[Indian people|Indians]] as workers, contributed to ethnic diversity in the population. From 1690, most of the non-Europeans were enslaved. The colony abolished slavery on 20 December 1848. Afterwards, many of the foreign workers came as [[indentured worker]]s. The opening of the [[Suez Canal]] in 1869 reduced the importance of the island as a stopover on the [[East Indies]] trade route.{{citation needed|date=August 2015}} [[File:Fete des travailleurs indiens.jpg|thumb|[[Hindu]] festival, 19th century]] During the [[Second World War]], Réunion was under the authority of the [[Vichy regime]] until 30 November 1942, when [[Free French]] forces [[Liberation of La Réunion|took over the island]] with the [[French destroyer Léopard|destroyer ''Léopard'']].{{citation needed|date=August 2015}} Réunion became a ''[[overseas department|département d'outre-mer]]'' (overseas [[Departments of France|département]]) of France on 19 March 1946. [[INSEE code|INSEE]] assigned to Réunion the department code 974, and the region code 04 when regional councils were created in 1982 in France, including in existing overseas departments which also became overseas regions. Over about two decades in the late 20th century (1963–1982), 1,630 children from Réunion were relocated to rural areas of [[metropolitan France]], particularly to [[Creuse]], ostensibly for education and work opportunities. That program was led by influential [[Gaullist]] politician [[Michel Debré]], who was an MP for Réunion at the time. Many of these children were abused or disadvantaged by the families with whom they were placed. Known as the [[The Children of Creuse|Children of Creuse]], they and their fate came to light in 2002 when one of them, Jean-Jacques Martial, filed suit against the French state for kidnapping and deportation of a minor.{{cite book|author=Jean-Jacques Martial|title=Une enfance volée|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=nYEMAQAAMAAJ|accessdate=2012-09-13|year=2003|publisher=Les Quatre Chemins|isbn=978-2-84784-110-7|page=113}} Other similar lawsuits were filed over the following years, but all were dismissed by French courts and finally by the [[European Court of Human Rights]] in 2011.Géraldine Marcon: [http://www.francebleu.fr/societe/chronologie-les-demraches-judiciaires-des-enfants-reunionnais-de-creuse-1230798 CHRONOLOGIE : L'histoire des enfants réunionnais déplacés en métropole] on francebleu.fr. In 2005 and 2006, Réunion was hit by a crippling epidemic of [[chikungunya]], a disease spread by mosquitoes. According to the [[BBC News]], 255,000 people on Réunion had contracted the disease as of 26 April 2006.{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/europe/4674376.stm |title=Island disease hits 50,000 people |publisher=BBC News |date=2 February 2006 |accessdate=2007-08-18}} The neighbouring islands of Mauritius and Madagascar also suffered epidemics of this disease during the same year.{{cite journal|url=http://wwwnc.cdc.gov/eid/article/14/2/07-1024_article.htm|title=Chikungunya Fever, Mauritius, 2006|first1=Sanjay|last1=Beesoon|first2=Ellen|last2=Funkhouser|first3=Navaratnam|last3=Kotea|first4=Andrew|last4=Spielman|first5=Rebecca M.|last5=Robich|publisher=|volume=14|issue=2|pages=337–338|doi=10.3201/eid1402.071024|pmid=18258136|pmc=2630048}}{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/africa/4777530.stm |title=Madagascar hit by mosquito virus |publisher=BBC News |date=6 March 2006 |accessdate=2007-08-18}} A few cases also appeared in mainland France, carried by people travelling by airline. The French government of [[Dominique de Villepin]] sent an emergency aid package worth €36 million and deployed about 500 troops in an effort to eradicate mosquitoes on the island.{{citation needed|date=August 2015}} == Politics == {{Main article|Politics of Réunion}} [[File:EU OCT and OMR map en.png|thumb|right|Map of the European Union in the world with overseas countries and territories and outermost regions]] Réunion sends seven deputies to the [[National Assembly of France|French National Assembly]] and three senators to the [[Senate of France|Senate]]. == Administrative divisions == {{Main article|Arrondissements of the Réunion department|Cantons of the Réunion department|Communes of the Réunion department}} Administratively, Réunion is divided into 24 [[communes of France|''communes'']] (municipalities) grouped into four [[arrondissements of France|''arrondissements'']]. It is also subdivided into 49 [[cantons of France|cantons]], meaningful only for electoral purposes at the departmental or regional level.{{cite web|url=http://www.insee.fr/fr/nom_def_met/nomenclatures/cog/CarteD.asp?numreg=04&numdep=974#res |title=Insee - Code Officiel Géographique |publisher=Insee.fr |date= |accessdate=6 May 2009}} It is a French overseas department, hence a French overseas region. The low number of ''communes'', compared with French metropolitan departments of similar size and population, is unique: most of its ''communes'' encompass several localities, sometimes separated by significant distances. === Municipalities (''communes'') === {{Div col|colwidth=22em}} * [[Les Avirons]] * [[Bras-Panon]] * [[Cilaos]] * [[Entre-Deux]] * [[L'Étang-Salé]] * [[La Plaine-des-Palmistes]] * [[Petite-Île]] * [[La Possession]] * [[Le Port, Réunion|Le Port]] * [[Saint-André, Réunion|Saint-André]] * [[Saint-Benoît, Réunion|Saint-Benoît]] * [[Saint-Denis, Réunion|Saint-Denis]] * [[Saint-Joseph, Réunion|Saint-Joseph]] * [[Saint-Leu, Réunion|Saint-Leu]] * [[Saint-Louis, Réunion|Saint-Louis]] * [[Sainte-Marie, Réunion|Sainte-Marie]] * [[Saint-Paul, Réunion|Saint-Paul]] * [[Saint-Philippe]] * [[Saint-Pierre, Réunion|Saint-Pierre]] * [[Sainte-Suzanne, Réunion|Sainte-Suzanne]] * [[Sainte-Rose, Réunion|Sainte-Rose]] * [[Salazie]] * [[Trois-Bassins]] * [[Le Tampon]] {{div col end}} The ''communes'' voluntarily grouped themselves into five intercommunalities for cooperating in some domains, apart from the four'' arrondissements'' to which they belong for purposes of applying national laws and executive regulation. After some changes in the composition, name and status of intercommunalities, all of them operate with the status of [[Agglomeration communities in France|agglomeration communities]], and apply their own local taxation (in addition to national, regional, departmental, and municipal taxes) and have an autonomous budget decided by the assembly representing all member communes. This budget is also partly funded by the state, the region, the department, and the [[European Union]] for some development and investment programs. Every ''commune'' in Réunion is now a member of an intercommunality with its own taxation, to which member communes have delegated their authority in various areas. == Foreign relations == Although diplomacy, military, and French government matters are handled by Paris, Réunion is a member of [[La Francophonie]], the [[Indian Ocean Commission]], the [[International Trade Union Confederation]], the [[Universal Postal Union]], the [[Port Management Association of Eastern and Southern Africa]], and the [[World Federation of Trade Unions]] in its own right. == Geography == {{Main article|Geography of Réunion}} {{Réunion location map}} The island is {{convert|63|km|mi|abbr=on}} long; {{convert|45|km|mi|abbr=on}} wide; and covers {{convert|2512|km2|mi2|abbr=on}}. It is above a [[hotspot (geology)|hotspot]] in the Earth's crust. The [[Piton de la Fournaise]], a [[shield volcano]] on the eastern end of Réunion Island, rises more than {{convert|2631|m|ft|abbr=on}} [[above mean sea level|above sea level]] and is sometimes called a sister to Hawaiian volcanoes because of the similarity of climate and volcanic nature. It has erupted more than 100 times since 1640, and is under constant monitoring, most recently erupting on 14 July 2017.[http://www.volcanodiscovery.com/piton_fournaise/news.html Piton de la Fournaise] on volcanodiscovery.com During another eruption in April 2007, the lava flow was estimated at {{convert|3000000|m3|yd3|abbr=on}} per day.{{cite news |author=Thomas Staudacher |url=https://news.yahoo.com/s/afp/20070407/wl_afp/francereunionvolcano |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070409021223/http://news.yahoo.com/s/afp/20070407/wl_afp/francereunionvolcano |archivedate=9 April 2007 |title=Reunion sees 'colossal' volcano eruption, but population safe |publisher=[[Agence France Presse|AFP]] |date=7 April 2007 |accessdate=18 August 2007}} (Web archive) The hotspot that fuels Piton de la Fournaise also created the islands of [[Mauritius]] and [[Rodrigues (island)|Rodrigues]]. The [[Piton des Neiges]] volcano, the highest point on the island at {{convert|3070|m|ft|abbr=on}} above sea level, is northwest of the Piton de la Fournaise. Collapsed calderas and canyons are south west of the mountain. While the Piton de la Fournaise is one of Earth's most active volcanoes, the Piton des Neiges is extinct. Its name means "peak of snows" in French, but snowfall on the summit of the mountain is rare. The slopes of both volcanoes are heavily forested. Cultivated land and cities like the capital city of [[Saint-Denis, Réunion|Saint-Denis]] are concentrated on the surrounding coastal lowlands. Offshore, part of the west coast is characterised by a [[Reunion Island's coral reef|coral reef system]]. Réunion also has three [[caldera]]s: the [[Cirque de Salazie]], the [[Cilaos|Cirque de Cilaos]] and the [[Cirque de Mafate]]. The last is accessible only on foot or by helicopter. File:Ppalmistes2.jpg|[[Plaine-des-Palmistes]] File:Reunion 21.12S 55.51E.jpg|View from satellite File:La Réunion from space.jpg|Réunion from space (NASA image): The three cirques, forming a kind of three-leafed clover shape, are visible in the central north west of the image. Piton de la Fournaise, in the south east, is covered by cloud. File:Volcanreunion.jpg|Lava flow emitted in 2005 by the [[Piton de la Fournaise]] File:L'Ermitage beach, Réunion.jpg|"Plage de l'Ermitage" beach === Climate === [[File:Climat Réunion.jpg|thumb|400px|[[Köppen climate classification]] map of Réunion.]] The [[climate]] in Réunion is [[tropical climate|tropical]], but temperature moderates with elevation. The weather is cool and dry from May to November, but hot and rainy from November to April. Precipitation levels vary greatly within the island, with the east being much wetter than the west. More than 6{{Spaces}}m of rain a year fall on some parts of the east and less than 1{{Spaces}}m a year falls on the west coast.{{cite web |author=Jacques Libert |url=http://pedagogie2.ac-reunion.fr/cotamarp/calliopee/general/pluie.html |title=la pluviométrie |publisher=Pedagogie2.ac-reunion.fr |date= |accessdate=2013-03-12 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130519092213/http://pedagogie2.ac-reunion.fr/cotamarp/calliopee/general/pluie.html |archivedate=19 May 2013 |df=dmy-all }} Réunion holds the world records for the most rainfall in 12-, 24-, 72- and 96-hour periods.{{cite web|title=World Meteorological Organization: Global Weather & Climate Extremes|url=http://wmo.asu.edu/|website=Arizona State University}} === Beaches === Réunion hosts many tropical and unique beaches. They are often equipped with barbecues, amenities, and parking spaces. Hermitage Beach is the most extensive and best preserved lagoon in Réunion Island and a popular snorkelling location.{{cite web|url=http://www.snorkeling-report.com/spot/ermitage-lagoon-reunion-island/|title=Lagon de l'Ermitage|last=|date=|website=Snorkeling Report|first1=|accessdate=15 November 2016}} It is a white sand beach lined with casuarina trees under which the locals often organise picnics. La Plage des Brisants is a well-known surfing spot, with many athletic and leisurely activities taking place. Each November, a film festival is also organised in La Plage des Brisants. Movies are projected on a large screen in front of a crowd. Beaches at Boucan {{not a typo|Canot}} are surrounded by a stretch of restaurants that particularly cater to tourists. L’Etang-Salé on the west coast is a particularly unique beach as it is covered in black sand consisting of tiny fragments of basalt. This occurs when lava contacts water, it cools rapidly and shatters into sand and fragmented debris of various size. Much of the debris is small enough to be considered sand. Grand Anse is a tropical white-sand beach lined with coconut trees in the south of Réunion, with a rock pool built for swimmers, a [[pétanque]] playground, and a picnic area.{{cite web|url=http://www.indian-ocean.com/the-beaches-of-reunion-island/|title=The beaches of Réunion Island|date=|website=Snorkeling Report|last1=Ocean|first1=Indian|accessdate=15 November 2016}} File:Grand Anse Beach Reunion Island.jpg|Sunset at Grand Anse beach Reunion Island File:Lunch on the beach.jpg|Restaurants along Boucan {{not a typo|Canot}} beach{{Cite web|url=https://www.flickr.com/photos/45945287@N08/30266925554/|title=Lunch at Plage de Boucan Canot|website=Flickr|access-date=2016-11-15}} File:Manapany, La Réunion.jpg|Manapany beach rock pool File:Étang-salé-les-bains-plage03.jpg|L'etang Sale Beach - a black sand beach from volcanic basalt File:La Reunion lagoon dsc00240.jpg|L’Ermitage les Bains lagoon in front of Saint Paul, and its pass through the coral reef. == Environment == {{See also|Réunion National Park}} Since 2010, Réunion is home to a [[UNESCO]] [[World Heritage Site]] that covers about 40% of the island's area and coincides with the central zone of the [[Réunion National Park]].{{cite web | url =http://whc.unesco.org/en/list/1317|title=Pitons, cirques and remparts of Reunion Island|publisher=[[UNESCO]]| accessdate =30 July 2015}} === Wildlife === {{Main article|Wildlife of Réunion}} {{See also|List of extinct animals of Réunion}} Réunion is home to a variety of birds such as the [[white-tailed tropicbird]] ({{Lang-fr|paille en queue}}).{{fr icon}} L'Île de la Réunion.com: [http://www.liledelareunion.com/Fr/Oiseaux/paille.php Le paille en queue] Its largest land animal is the [[panther chameleon]], ''Furcifer pardalis.'' Much of the west coast is ringed by coral reef which harbours, among other animals, [[sea urchin]]s, [[conger eel]]s, and [[parrot fish]]. [[Sea turtle]]s and dolphins also inhabit the coastal waters. Humpback whales migrate north to the island from the Antarctic waters annually during the Southern Hemisphere winter (June–September) to breed and feed, and can be routinely observed from the shores of Réunion during this season. At least 19 species formerly [[endemic]] to Réunion have become [[extinct]] following human colonisation. For example, the [[Réunion giant tortoise]] became extinct after being slaughtered in vast numbers by sailors and settlers of the island. Between 2010 and 2017, 23 shark attacks occurred in the waters of Réunion, of which nine were fatal.{{cite web|url=https://www.zinfos974.com/Crise-requin-Les-causes-scientifiques-sous-les-projecteurs-de-la-revue-Nature_a124908.html|title=Crise requin: Les causes scientifiques sous les projecteurs de la revue "Nature"|first=Laurence|last=Gilibert|date=1 March 2018|publisher=|via=ZINFO974}} In July 2013, the [[Prefect of Réunion]] Michel Lalande announced a ban on swimming, surfing, and bodyboarding off more than half of the coast. Lalande also said 45 [[bull shark]]s and 45 [[tiger shark]]s would be [[cull]]ed, in addition to the 20 already killed as part of scientific research into the illness [[ciguatera]].{{cite news|url=http://www.news.com.au/travel/news/big-read-reunion-island-beset-by-shark-controversy/story-e6frfq80-1226707678565|title=Big Read: Reunion Island beset by shark controversy|work=[[News Corp Australia]]|date=2013-08-30}} Migrations of [[humpback whale]]s contributed to a boom of [[whale watching]] industries on Réunion, and watching rules have been governed by the [[:fr:Observatoire Marin de la Réunion|OMAR (Observatoire Marin de la Réunion)]] and [[:fr:Globice|Globice (Groupe local d'observation et d'identification des cétacés)]]. File:FurciferPardalisMale.JPG|A [[panther chameleon]] File:Pomacanthus imperator juvénile.JPG|A juvenile [[Emperor angelfish]] File:Idole des Maures (Zanclus cornutus).jpg|A [[Moorish idol]] File:White-tailed tropicbird.jpg|A white-tailed [[Tropicbird]] File:Eretmochelys imbricata 01.jpg|A [[Hawksbill sea turtle]] File:Humpback whale bis.jpeg|A [[Humpback whale]] off [[Saint-Gilles, Réunion|St-Gilles]] === Gardening - Bourbon roses === The first members of the [[Bourbon rose|"Bourbon" group]] of garden roses originated on this island (then still Île Bourbon, hence the name) from a spontaneous [[Hybridisation (biology)|hybridisation]] between [[Damask rose]]s and ''[[Rosa chinensis]]'',{{cite journal|last1=ADUMITRESEI|first1=LIDIA|last2=STĂNESCU|first2=IRINA|title=Theoretical Considerations upon the origin and nomenclature of the present rose cultivars|journal=Journal of Plant Development|date=2009|volume=16}} which had been brought there by the colonists. The first Bourbon roses were discovered on the island in 1817.{{cite web |url=http://www.rose.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/01/History-of-Roses-Bourbon-Roses2.pdf |title=History of Roses: Bourbon Roses |work=American Rose Society}} == Demographics == [[File:Manapany.jpg|thumb|[[Manapany]]]] {{Main article|Demographics of Réunion}} {{See also|Cafres|Malbars|Chinois (Réunion)|Zarabes|Zoreilles}} Ethnic groups present include people of [[African diaspora|African]], [[Non-resident Indian and person of Indian origin|Indian]], [[White people|European]], [[Malagasy people|Malagasy]] and [[Overseas Chinese|Chinese]] origin. Local names for these are Yabs, [[Cafres]], [[Réunionnais of Indian origin|Malbars]] and [[Chinois (Réunion)|Chinois]]. All of the ethnic groups comprising the island are immigrant populations that have come to Réunion from Europe, Asia and Africa over the centuries. There are no indigenous people on the island, as it was originally deserted.{{cite journal|last1=Bollée|first1=Annegret|title=French on the Island of Bourbon (Réunion)|journal=Journal of Language Contact|date=2015|volume=8|issue=1|page=91|doi=10.1163/19552629-00801005}} These populations have mixed from the earliest days of the island's colonial history (the first settlers married women from Madagascar and of Indo-Portuguese heritage), resulting in a majority population of [[mixed race]] and of "Creole" culture. How many people of each ethnicity live in Réunion is not known exactly, since the French census does not ask questions about ethnic origin,{{cite journal|ssrn=1236362 |title=SSRN-Why France Needs to Collect Data on Racial Identity - In a French Way by David Oppenheimer |publisher=Papers.ssrn.com |date= }} which applies in Réunion because it is a part of the [[Constitution of France|1958 constitution]], and also because of the extent of racial mixing on the island. According to estimates, [[European diaspora|Whites]] (''petits blancs'' and ''gros blancs'') make up roughly one quarter of the population,{{Cite book | first = John A. | last = Holm | title = Pidgins and Creoles: References survey | url = https://books.google.com/books?id=PcD7p9y3EIcC&pg=PA394 | publisher = Cambridge University Press | year = 1989 | page = 394 | isbn = 0-521-35940-6}} [[Malbars]] make up more than 25% of the population and people of Chinese ancestry form roughly 3%.{{Cite web|url=http://indiandiaspora.nic.in/diasporapdf/chapter6.pdf|title=Réunion|last=|first=|date=|website=The Indian Diaspora|publisher=|access-date=}} The percentages for mixed race people and those of Afro-Malagasy origins vary widely in estimates. Also, some people of [[Vietnamese people|Vietnamese]] ancestry live on the island, though they are very few in number.{{cite web |title=La Réunion Métisse |author=Clicanoo |url=http://www.clicanoo.com/index.php?id_article=97657&page=article}}{{cite web |title=Anthropometric evaluations of body composition of undergraduate students at the University of La Réunion |url=http://advan.physiology.org/cgi/content/full/30/4/248 |year=2006 |accessdate=2011-08-21 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6GnQWhklA?url=http://advan.physiology.org/content/30/4/248.full |archivedate=22 May 2013 |df=dmy-all }}{{cite web |url=http://www.religiousintelligence.co.uk/country/?CountryID=151 |title=Country Profile: Reunion (Department of Reunion) |accessdate=2007-10-13 |deadurl=bot: unknown |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071013201658/http://www.religiousintelligence.co.uk/country/?CountryID=151 |archivedate=13 October 2007 |df=dmy-all }} [[Tamil people|Tamils]] are the largest group among the [[Indian people|Indian]] community.{{cite web|url=http://indiandiaspora.nic.in/diasporapdf/chapter6.pdf |title=NRI |format=PDF |date= |accessdate=2010-04-16}} The island's community of Muslims from north western India, particularly [[Gujarat]], and elsewhere is commonly referred to as ''[[zarabes]]''. [[Réunionnais Creole people|Creoles]] (a name given to those born on the island, regardless of ethnic origins) make up the majority of the population. Groups that are not Creole include people recently arrived from Metropolitan France (known as ''[[zoreilles]]'') and those from [[Mayotte]] and the [[Comoros]]. === Historical population === {|class="wikitable" |- ! Year !! Population | rowspan="11" style="width:20px;"| ! Year !! Population | rowspan="11" style="width:20px;"| ! Year !! Population |- | ''1671'' || style="text-align:right" | ''90'' | ''1830'' || style="text-align:right" | ''101,300'' | 1961 || style="text-align:right" | 349,282 |- | ''1696'' || style="text-align:right" | ''269'' | ''1848'' || style="text-align:right" | ''110,300'' | 1967 || style="text-align:right" | 416,525 |- | ''1704'' || style="text-align:right" | ''734'' | ''1849'' || style="text-align:right" | ''120,900'' | 1974 || style="text-align:right" | 476,675 |- | ''1713'' || style="text-align:right" | ''1,171'' | ''1860'' || style="text-align:right" | ''200,000'' | 1982 || style="text-align:right" | 515,814 |- | ''1717'' || style="text-align:right" | ''2,000'' | ''1870'' || style="text-align:right" | ''212,000'' | 1990 || style="text-align:right" | 597,823 |- | ''1724'' || style="text-align:right" | ''12,550'' | 1887 || style="text-align:right" | 163,881 | 1999 || style="text-align:right" | 706,300 |- | ''1764'' || style="text-align:right" | ''25,000'' | 1897 || style="text-align:right" | 173,192 | 2006 || style="text-align:right" | 781,962 |- | ''1777'' || style="text-align:right" | ''35,100'' | 1926 || style="text-align:right" | 182,637 | 2011 || style="text-align:right" | 828,581 |- | ''1789'' || style="text-align:right" | ''61,300'' | 1946 || style="text-align:right" | 241,708 | 2015 || style="text-align:right" | 850,727 |- | ''1826'' || style="text-align:right" | ''87,100'' | 1954 || style="text-align:right" | 274,370 | ''2018'' ||style="text-align:right" | ''865,826'' |- | colspan="8" style="text-align:center" | Official data from [[INSEE]] by census or estimate; estimates shown in ''italics''. |} === Religion === {{See also|Islam in Réunion|Hinduism in Réunion}} [[File:Cilaos kirche.jpg|thumb|Catholic church of Notre-Dame-des-Neiges in [[Cilaos]]]] The predominant religion is [[Christianity]], notably [[Roman Catholicism]], with a single (Latin Rite) jurisdiction, the [[Roman Catholic Diocese of Saint-Denis-de-La Réunion]]. Religious Intelligence estimates Christians to be 84.9% of the population, followed by [[Hindu]]s (6.7%) and [[Muslim]]s (2.2%). [[Chinese folk religion]] and [[Buddhism]] are also represented, among others. Most large towns have a [[Hindu temple]] and a [[mosque]].{{cite book|title=Peoples of Africa: Réunion-Somalia|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=Tsqua-r16i4C&pg=PA412|year=2001|publisher=Marshall Cavendish|isbn=978-0-7614-7166-0|pages=412–}} == Culture == {{See also|Réunionnais literature}} Réunionese culture is a blend (''métissage'') of European, African, [[Réunionnais of Indian origin|Indian]], [[Chinois (Réunion)|Chinese]] and insular traditions. The most widely spoken language, [[Réunion Creole]], [[French-based creole languages|derives from French]]. === Language === [[French language|French]] is the only official language of Réunion. Although not official, [[Réunion Creole]] is the native language of a large part of the population and is spoken alongside French. Creole is used informally and orally in some administration offices whereas the official language of any administration office as well as education is French.{{cite web|url=http://www.ethnologue.com/show_language.asp?code=rcf |title=Ethnologue report (language code:rcf) |publisher=Ethnologue.com |date= |accessdate=2010-04-16}} Because of the diverse population, other languages are also spoken such as [[Comorian language|Comorian]] language varieties (especially [[Shimaore]]), [[Malagasy language|Malagasy]] by recent immigrants from [[Mayotte]] and Madagascar, [[Mandarin Chinese|Mandarin]], [[Hakka language|Hakka]] and [[Yue Chinese|Cantonese]] by members of the Chinese community, but fewer people speak these languages as younger generations start to converse in French and Réunion Creole. There are significant number of speakers of [[Languages of India|Indian languages]] mostly [[Tamil language|Tamil]], [[Gujarati language|Gujarati]] and [[Urdu]]. [[Arabic language|Arabic]] is taught in mosques and spoken by a small community of Muslims. English is a compulsory second language as part of the French school curriculum,{{citation needed|date=August 2015}} but as in mainland France, English fluency is rare. German and Spanish are offered as a third language. [[Yue Chinese|Cantonese]], [[Arabic language|Arabic]], [[Tamil language|Tamil]] is also taught as an optional language in some schools. ===Music=== {{Main article|Music of Réunion}} {{See also|Sega music|Maloya}} There are two music genres which originated in Réunion: sega, which originated earlier and is also traditional in Mauritius, Rodrigues and Seychelles and maloya, which originated in the 19th century and is only found in Réunion. ===Sport=== [[Moraingy|Moringue]] is a popular combat/dance sport similar to [[capoeira]]. There are several famous Réunionese sportsmen and women like the [[Team handball|handballer]] [[Jackson Richardson]], as well as the [[karate]]ka [[Lucie Ignace]]. Professional [[Association football|footballers]] include [[Dimitri Payet]], [[Florent Sinama Pongolle]] and [[Guillaume Hoarau]]. [[Laurent Robert]] and ex-[[Hibernian F.C.|Hibernian]] and [[Celtic F.C.|Celtic]] player [[Didier Agathe]] have also featured in movies. Agathe appeared in [[A Shot at Glory]], whilst Robert was in ''[[Goal! (film)|Goal!]]''. Réunion has a number of contributions to worldwide professional [[surfing]]. It has been home to notable pro surfers including [[Jeremy Flores]], [[Johanne Defay]] and [[Justine Mauvin]]. Famous break St Leu has been host to several world surfing championship competitions. Since 1992, Réunion has hosted a number of [[ultramarathons]] under the umbrella name of the [[Grand Raid]]. As of 2018, four different races compose the Grand Raid: the Diagonale des Fous, The Trail de Bourbon, the Mascareignes, and the Zembrocal Trail.{{cite web |title=The Grand Raid: 25 years of madness! |url=https://en.reunion.fr/organize/news/the-grand-raid-25-years-of-madness |website=La Réunion |accessdate=20 August 2018}} == Media == === Broadcasting === Réunion has a local public television channel, [[Réseau Outre-Mer 1re|Réunion 1ère]], which now forms part of [[France Télévision]], and also receives [[France 2]], [[France 3]], [[France 4]], [[France 5]] and [[France 24]] from metropolitan France, as well as [[France Ô]], which shows programming from all of the [[Overseas departments and territories of France|overseas departments and territories]]. There are also two local private channels, Télé Kréol and Antenne Réunion. It has a local public radio station, formerly Radio Réunion, but now known as Réunion 1ère, like its television counterpart. It also receives the [[Radio France]] networks [[France Inter]], [[France Musique]] and [[France Culture]]. The first private local radio station, Radio Freedom, was introduced in 1981. They broadcast daily content about weather and local services. === Newspapers === Two main newspapers: *''[[Journal de l'île de La Réunion]]'' *''{{ill|Le Quotidien (Réunionese newspaper)|fr|Le Quotidien de La Réunion}}'' === Film === *''[[Adama (film)|Adama]]'' (animated there) *''[[Mississippi Mermaid]]'' (1969) (filmed there) === Blogs === *''[[Visit Reunion (Instagram)|Visit Reunion]]'' (English language blog and [https://www.instagram.com/visitreunion/ instagram] page){{cite web|url=https://www.instagram.com/visitreunion/|title=Réunion Island (@visitreunion) • Instagram photos and videos|author=|date=|website=www.instagram.com|accessdate=15 April 2018}} *''[http://www.welcometoreunionisland.com/ Reunion Island Tourism blog]'' (English/French tourism blog) == Economy == {{Main article|Economy of Réunion}} [[File:LePortEst.JPG|thumb|The east dock of Réunion's main seaport in [[Le Port, Réunion|Le Port]].]] [[File:Trieur de vanille - La Réunion.jpg|thumb|Man sorting [[Bourbon vanilla]].]] In 2016, the [[Gross domestic product|GDP]] of Réunion was estimated at 19.2 billion [[euro]]s (US$21.3 bn) and the GDP per capita was 22,400 [[euro]]s (US$24,800). [[Sugar]] was traditionally the chief agricultural product and export. [[Tourism]] is now an important source of income.{{cite web|url=http://www.elefant-tours.com/location/reunion/|title=Reunion Island Holidays|publisher=}} The island's remote location combined with its stable political alignment with Europe makes it a key location for satellite receiving stations{{cite web | url=http://www.vigisat.eu/web/en/63-news.php?item=71 | title=SEAS-OI, VIGISAT international success Réunion Island acquires an acquisition and processing system for high-resolution satellite images | access-date=3 April 2016|language=en}} and naval navigation.{{cite web | url=http://www.cls.fr/en/ground-segments-and-operations/surveillance-of-maritime-and-terrestrial-activities-by-radar/#fragment1 | title=Surveillance of maritime and terrestrial activities by radar | publisher= | access-date=3 April 2016|language=en}} GDP sector composition in 2013 (contribution of each sector to the total [[gross value added]]):{{cite web | url=https://www.insee.fr/fr/statistiques/2386064 | title=Comptes économiques définitifs de La Réunion | date=2017|publisher=[[INSEE]] | accessdate=2018-03-13|language=fr}} {| class="wikitable" |- ! Sector !! % of total GVA |-bgcolor="#afa" || Agriculture, forestry and fishing || 1.5% {{collapsed infobox section begin|Detail}} |- | Agriculture and forestry || 1.1% |- | Fishing || 0.3% {{collapsed infobox section end}} |-bgcolor="#F2CEE0" | Mining and quarrying || 0.0% |-bgcolor="#F2CEE0" | Manufacturing || 4.4% {{collapsed infobox section begin|Detail}} |- | Food manufacturing
(of which: sugar and rum)|| 1.8%
(0.4%) |- | Petroleum and coal products manufacturing || 0.0% |- | Non-food and non-petroleum/coal manufacturing || 2.6% {{collapsed infobox section end}} |-bgcolor="#F2CEE0" | Utilities || 1.8% |-bgcolor="#F2CEE0" | Construction || 5.4% |-bgcolor="#B0E0E6" | Market services || 51.1% {{collapsed infobox section begin|Detail}} |- | Wholesale and retail trade || 12.1% |- | Transportation and warehousing || 3.5% |- | Accommodation and food services || 1.6% |- | Information and communication || 3.6% |- | Finance and insurance || 3.9% |- | Real estate activities || 15.2% |- | Professional, scientific and technical services || 3.2% |- | Administrative and support services || 3.5% |- | Other (entertainment, repair, personal and laundry services)|| 4.4% {{collapsed infobox section end}} |-bgcolor="#B0E0E6" | Non-market services || 35.9% {{collapsed infobox section begin|Detail}} |- | Public administration and defense || 10.9% |- | Education, health care, elderly care, child day-care|| 24.9% {{collapsed infobox section end}} |} Unemployment is a major problem on Réunion, although the situation has improved markedly since the beginning of the 2000s: the unemployment rate, which stood above 30% from the early 1980s to the early 2000s, declined to 24.1% in 2007, then rebounded to 29.6% in 2011 due to the [[Financial crisis of 2007–2008|2008 global financial crisis]] and subsequent [[Great Recession]], but has since 2011 again declined, reaching 22.4% in 2016,{{cite web | url=http://appsso.eurostat.ec.europa.eu/nui/show.do?dataset=lfst_r_lfu3rt&lang=en | title=Unemployment rates by sex, age and NUTS 2 regions (%) | publisher=[[Eurostat]]|accessdate=2018-03-12}} its lowest level in 40 years.{{cite book |last1=Célimène |first1=Fred|last2=Legris|first2=André |date=2011 |title=De l'économie coloniale à l'économie mondialisée - Aspects multiples de la transition (XXe et XXIe siècles) |url=https://books.google.fr/books?id=n2QkA7LOJC8C&pg=PA179&dq=%22taux+de+ch%C3%B4mage%22+%22la+r%C3%A9union%22+%221974%22&hl=fr&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwjOxLT4s-XZAhXoBsAKHSfSCzsQ6AEILjAB#v=onepage&q=%22taux%20de%20ch%C3%B4mage%22%20%22la%20r%C3%A9union%22%20%221974%22&f=false |location=Paris |publisher=Publibook|page=179 |isbn=978-2-7483-7225-0 }} In 2014, 40% of the population lived below the poverty line (defined by [[INSEE]] as 60% of [[Metropolitan France]]'s median income; in 2014 the poverty line for a family of 2 parents and 2 young children was €2,064 (US$ 2,743) per month).{{cite web | url=https://www.insee.fr/fr/statistiques/3128421 | title=Quatre Réunionnais sur dix vivent sous le seuil de pauvreté | date=2017|publisher=[[INSEE]] | accessdate=2018-03-12|language=fr}} [[Rum]] distillation is a sugar-based process that contributes to the island's economy. A "[[List of French rums|Product of France]]", it is shipped to Europe for bottling, then shipped to consumers around the world. == Public services == === Health{{anchor|Health care|Healthcare}} === In 2005–2006, Réunion experienced an epidemic of [[chikungunya]], a viral disease similar to [[dengue fever]] brought in from East Africa, which infected almost a third of the population because of its transmission through mosquitoes. The epidemic has since been eradicated. See the [[#History|History]] section for more details. === Transport === {{Main article|Transport in Réunion}} [[Roland Garros Airport]] serves the island, handling flights to mainland [[France]], [[India]], [[Madagascar]], [[Mauritius]], [[Tanzania]], [[Comoros]], [[Seychelles]], [[South Africa]], [[China]] and [[Thailand]]. [[Pierrefonds Airport]], a smaller airport, has some flights to Mauritius and Madagascar. == See also == {{portal|Africa|||France||Islands}} {{Div col|colwidth=30em}} * [[Administrative divisions of France]] * [[Anchaing]] * [[List of colonial and departmental heads of Réunion]] * [[List of islands administered by France in the Indian and Pacific oceans]] * [[List of islands]] * [[List of Réunionnais]] * [[Malaysia Airlines Flight 370]] * [[Overseas departments and territories of France]] * [[Scouting and Guiding in Réunion]] {{div col end}} {{clear}} == References == {{Reflist|30em}} == Bibliography == * James Rogers and Luis Simón. [http://www.europarl.europa.eu/meetdocs/2004_2009/documents/dv/sede300309studype407004_/SEDE300309StudyPE407004_en.pdf The Status and Location of the Military Installations of the Member States of the European Union and Their Potential Role for the European Security and Defence Policy (ESDP).] Brussels: European Parliament, 2009. 25 pp. == External links == {{Commons category}} {{Wikivoyage}} ;Government * [http://www.france.fr/en/regions-and-cities/reunion-severe-island Réunion - The severe island] - Official French website (in English) * [http://www.cg974.fr/ Departmental Council website] * [http://www.region-reunion.com/ Régional council website] ; General information * [http://www.reunion.fr/en/ Official tourism website] * {{dmoz|Regional/Africa/Reunion}} * {{wikiatlas|Réunion}} * [http://whc.unesco.org/en/list/1317 UNESCO World Heritage Site datasheet] {{Réunion topics}} {{Navboxes |title = Articles relating to Réunion |list = {{Réunion-related lists}} {{Countries of Africa}} {{French overseas departments and territories}} {{Indian Ocean}} {{Somali Plate}} {{Outlying territories of European countries}} {{Regions of France|current}} {{EU dependencies}} {{EU Outermost regions}} }} {{Authority control}} {{Coord|21|06|52|S|55|31|57|E|region:RE_type:adm1st_scale:500000|display=title}} {{Use dmy dates|date=August 2010}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Reunion}} [[Category:Réunion| ]] [[Category:Mascarene Islands]] [[Category:Countries of the Indian Ocean]] [[Category:Dependent territories in Africa]] [[Category:Islands of Overseas France]] [[Category:Overseas departments of France]] [[Category:East African countries]] [[Category:Southeast African countries]] [[Category:Volcanic islands]] [[Category:Former colonies in Africa]] [[Category:Former French colonies]] [[Category:French colonisation in Africa]] [[Category:French East India Company]] [[Category:Outermost regions of the European Union]] [[Category:Regions of France]] [[Category:French-speaking countries and territories]] [[Category:Pirate dens and locations]] [[Category:States and territories established in 1946]] [[Category:1946 establishments in Africa]] [[Category:1946 establishments in the French colonial empire]] [[Category:Countries in Africa]] [[Category:France geography articles needing translation from French Wikipedia]]

revision.comment: Switched a sentence to past tense. Added the aquisition by Verizon Connect and respective citation.
revision.text:
{{Infobox company | name = Telogis | logo = [[File:Telogis Logo.png|center|220px]] | type = [[Subsidiary]] | foundation = 2001 | location = [[Aliso Viejo, California|Aliso Viejo]], [[California]]<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/2013-10-02/telogis-raises-93-million-from-kleiner-perkins-to-track-fleets.html |title=Telogis Raises $93 Million From Kleiner Perkins to Track Fleets |author=Douglas MacMillan |date=October 2, 2013}}</ref> | key_people =<!-- only if notable and cited --> | num_employees = 500-1000 (2015) | industry = [[Software as a service]]| | homepage = {{URL |https://www.telogis.com}} | parent = [[Verizon Connect]] }}
'''Telogis''' was a privately held US-based company that develops location-based software to manage mobile resources.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.pr.com/company-profile/overview/64529 |title=Telogis Inc Company Profile |year=2010}}</ref> Telogis sold [[software as a service]] (SaaS) which incorporated location information into applications for fleet owners as well as geospatial software development toolkits.<ref name=Williams />
In 2016 Telogis was aquired by Verizon Connect.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://techcrunch.com/2016/06/21/verizon-buys-telogis-to-drive-deeper-into-the-connected-vehicle-market/?guccounter=1|title=Verizon buys Telogis to drive deeper into the connected vehicle market|work=TechCrunch|access-date=2018-11-05|language=en-US}}</ref>
==History== Telogis was founded in 2001 by Howard Jelinek, Newth Morris and Ralph Mason, as a trunked radio hardware and software provider. Former [[Novell]] Inc. Chairman and CEO Jack Messman is chairman of the board of directors.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.ocregister.com/jobsearch/telogis-596138-register-bill.html |title=Telogis Focuses on 'Culture of Creativity and Excellence' |date=January 6, 2014 |accessdate=May 23, 2014 |author=Bill Quinnan |publisher=Orange County Register}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://investing.businessweek.com/research/stocks/private/person.asp?personId=202738&privcapId=33426620 |accessdate=May 23, 2014 |publisher=BusinessWeek |title=Jack Messman bio}}</ref> The company was started with investments from its founders, and by 2012 the privately held company had approximately $69 million in revenue.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.inc.com/profile/telogis|title=Inc. Telogis Company Profile}}</ref>
''[[Wall Street Journal]]'' reporter Don Clark stated of the company's technology that, "Telogis exploited the evolution of software-as-a-service–placing data from vehicles in the cloud ... so that companies that own vehicle fleets can track their cars and trucks without the need to set up their own servers for the purpose."<ref>{{cite news |url=https://blogs.wsj.com/digits/2013/10/02/dot-com-bust-survivor-telogis-finally-takes-funding/ |author=Don Clark |publisher=Wall Street Journal |title=Dot-com Bust Survivor Telogis Finally Takes Funding |date=October 2, 2013 |accessdate=May 23, 2014}}</ref> In July 2010 Telogis acquired the assets of Remote Dynamics,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.socaltech.com/telogis_buys_remote_dynamics/s-0029633.html |title=Telogis Buys Remote Dynamics|year=2010}}</ref> then in February, 2011 Telogis acquired the assets of Intergis, a provider of routing, mobile resource and fleet management software for approximately 2,000 small to mid-sized business fleets.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.socaltech.com/telogis_buys_integris/s-0033801.html |title=Telogis Buys Integris|year=2011}}</ref> In July 2012 Telogis acquired Navtrak. The acquisition resulted in Telogis Navigation, commercial navigation software that gives professional drivers built-in feedback systems to provide up-to-date road network information.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.socaltech.com/telogis_buys_navtrak/s-0043901.html |title=Telogis Buys Navtrak|year=2012}}</ref>
The company's first outside [[venture capital]] was announced in October 2013, with $93 million from [[Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers]].<ref name=Williams>{{Cite news |title= Telogis Raises $93M From Kleiner Perkins In Pre-IPO Round To Extend Location Intelligence SaaS Platform For New Mobile Workforce |author= Alex Williams |date= October 1, 2013 |work= Tech Crunch |url= https://techcrunch.com/2013/10/01/telogis-raises-93m-from-kleiner-perkins-in-pre-ipo-round-to-extend-location-intelligence-saas-platform-for-new-mobile-workfore/ |accessdate= October 16, 2013 }}</ref> In February 2011 private investors provided $2.9 million.<ref name="funding">{{Cite news |title= Telogis Raises $2.9 Million More To Help Companies Manage Fleets, Reduce Emissions |work= Tech Crunch |date= February 11, 2011 |author= Lora Kolodny |url= https://techcrunch.com/2011/02/11/telogis-2-9-million-more/ |accessdate= October 16, 2013 }}</ref> Additional funding was received from GM Ventures in 2014.<ref>{{cite news |title= GM Ventures Makes a Strategic Investment in Telogis |publisher= ''Yahoo Finance'' |date= October 27, 2014 |url= https://finance.yahoo.com/news/gm-ventures-makes-strategic-investment-205845142.html }}</ref>
On June 21, 2016, it was announced that Telogis will merge with Verizon via an acquisition. <ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.telogis.com/press-releases/verizon-acquisition-telogis|title=Verizon to enhance significantly its connected vehicle business with the acquisition of Telogis {{!}} Telogis|website=www.telogis.com|access-date=2016-06-22}}</ref>
On March 6, 2018, a press release<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.morningstar.com/news/pr-news-wire/PRNews_20180306CG30720/introducing-verizon-connect-and-a-new-era-of-connected-vehicle-solutions.html |title=Introducing Verizon Connect and a New Era of Connected Vehicle Solutions |author=Morningstar |date=March 6, 2018}}</ref> announced that Telogis would be rebranded along with sister companies–[[Fleetmatics]] and Verizon Telematics–as [[Verizon Connect]].
==Software== Telogis software collects location-based data from embedded and installed hardware in vehicles, as well as from mobile devices. It works on over 40 different hardware platforms from 12 different manufacturers and collects an important array of data.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://venturebeat.com/2013/10/02/bootstrapped-telogis-raises-93m-to-bring-location-based-data-to-vehicle-fleets/ |title=Bootstrapped Telogis raises $93M to bring location-based data to vehicle fleets |date=October 2, 2013 |author=Rebecca Grant |accessdate=May 23, 2014 |publisher=Venture Beat}}</ref> Telogis also provides a [[software development kit]] for users to create location-based mobile and desktop applications.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.forbes.com/lists/2011/28/most-promising-companies-11_Telogis_2FQP.html |title=Telogis |publisher=''Forbes Magazine'' |accessdate=May 23, 2014}}</ref> One of the primary functions of Telogis's software is to provide United States Federal Government mandated [[hours of service]] commercial driver activity logs.
==OEM Agreements== Telogis provides a built-in telematics option for several OEMs including Ford, GM,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://media.gm.com/media/us/en/gm/news.detail.html/content/Pages/news/us/en/2014/mar/0305-gm-telogis.html |title=GM Offers Fleets Insights on the Road |publisher=''GM'' |date=March 5, 2014}}</ref> Volvo, Mack, Hino, Isuzu (United States based trucks), and Manitowoc. This allows fleet owners to opt for factory-installed telematics hardware when purchasing selected new cars and trucks. The advantages include immediate over-the-air activation when adding new vehicles to their fleet management system and additional data points such as DEF (Diesel Exhaust Fluid) quality, water in the diesel and extra DTCs (Diagnostic Trouble Codes) across the body, powertrain and chassis. For off-highway vehicles, Telogis also works with John Deere.<ref>http://markets.on.nytimes.com/research/stocks/news/press_release.asp?docTag=201611021400PR_NEWS_USPRX____NY34192&feedID=600&press_symbol=86832</ref>
In addition to the OEM built-in options, selected Freightliner trucks offer a pre-wired option that makes it simpler to add the required hardware for tracking trucks.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/apps/news?pid=conewsstory&tkr=DAI:GR&sid=aeCxiVpcV6Mk |title=Freightliner Trucks to Offer Pre-wire Option for Telogis Telematics Platform |publisher=''Bloomberg'' |date=March 28, 2011}}</ref>
==Uses== In October 2013 the ''Wall Street Journal'' reported that trucking companies were using Telogis to monitor their drivers, using the data they received to either reward or discipline their drivers.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://online.wsj.com/news/articles/SB10001424052702303672404579151440488919138 |accessdate=May 23, 2014 |title=Memo to Workers: The Boss Is Watching |author=Spencer Ante |publisher=Wall Street Journal |date=October 22, 2013}}</ref> This has led some employees to become concerned about privacy issues.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.aseonline.org/ArticleDetailsPage/tabid/7442/ArticleID/732/Yes-it-is-Big-Brother-You-Got-a-Problem-With-That.aspx |accessdate=May 23, 2014 |title=Yes, it is Big Brother. You Got a Problem With That? |author=Anthony Kaylin |date=November 6, 2013 |publisher=American Society of Employers}}</ref> Councilman Lewis Rotella of [[Niagara Falls, New York]], stated that, "It’s almost like big brother’s watching you ... You have to put some trust into the employees doing the job," in response to a 2006 contract placing Telogis devices in Niagara city vehicles. He stated further that he believed that such devices can be used to ensure safety, but should not be used for "surreptitiously trailing employees". Rotella also admitted to using the devices himself in his private business to monitor safety.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.niagara-gazette.com/local/x681257825/NIAGARA-FALLS-Technology-gives-bosses-view-from-afar/print |date=November 1, 2006 |publisher=''Niagara Gazette'' |accessdate=May 23, 2014 |title=NIAGARA FALLS: Technology gives bosses view from afar |author=Denise Jewell}}</ref> Stephen Roy, president of [[Mack Trucks]], another Telogis partner, also stated that the software would be used by Mack to help manage workflow and not to track the minute-by-minute decisions of its employees.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-359627230.html |author=Sean Kilcarr |title=Mack's New President Shares Insight on OEM's Strategic Initiatives |publisher=Fleet Owner |date=February 24, 2014 |accessdate=May 23, 2014}}</ref>
==Recognition== *In March 2014 Telogis was listed among Inc. Magazine's "Build 100" for sustained year-over-year growth.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.inc.com/build100/ |title=The Build 100 List of Sustained-Growth Companies|year=2014}}</ref> *In November 2013 Telogis was ranked among Deloitte's "Technology Fast 500".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.deloitte.com/view/en_US/us/Industries/technology/technology-fast500/c75a1ec6f6001210VgnVCM100000ba42f00aRCRD.htm |title=Deloitte Technology Fast 500 Rankings|year=2013}}</ref> *In October 2010 the company was ranked on the Inc 5000.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.inc.com/inc5000/2009/company-profile.html?id=200905690|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090817152627/http://www.inc.com/inc5000/2009/company-profile.html?id=200905690|dead-url=yes|archive-date=2009-08-17|title=Inc.com Company Profile - Telogis Inc.|year=2009}}</ref>
==See also== * [[Fleetmatics]] * [[Field service management]] * [[Field force automation]] * [[Mobile enterprise application framework]] * [[Mobile asset management]] * [[Ford Sync#Crew_Chief|Ford Sync (Crew Chief)]]
==References== {{Reflist|2}} {{Use dmy dates|date=March 2012}}
[[Category:Software companies based in California]] [[Category:Companies based in Aliso Viejo, California]] [[Category:2001 establishments in California]] [[Category:Global Positioning System]] [[Category:Vehicle telematics]]

{{Orphan|date=October 2016}} '''The Fainting Club''' is a members-only [[supper club]] for women, founded in 2014 by artist [[Zoe Crosher]]. Described as an "old boys' club, for girls", it celebrates and draws creative women from multiple disciplines—artists, writers, filmmakers, chefs, musicians—and welcomes any and all like-minded souls.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2014/11/05/t-magazine/fainting-club-new-york-zoe-crosher-julia-sherman.html|title=A Los Angeles Ladies-Only Dinner Club Migrates to New York|date=5 November 2014|work=The New York Times}}</ref>
Started in Los Angeles<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.harpersbazaar.com/culture/travel-dining/a12253/best-supper-clubs/|title=#ChicEats: Exclusive Supper Clubs to Try|date=21 September 2015|publisher=}}</ref> and based on the knowledge that strong, interesting and intelligent women are more powerful as a group, the club has begun to expand internationally. It now has chapters worldwide including in New York, Mexico City, London, Berlin, Paris and Hong Kong.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.newyork.com/articles/restaurants/fabulous-secret-supper-clubs-in-nyc-98775/|title=8 Fabulous "Secret" Supper Clubs in NYC - March 26, 2015 - NewYork.com|date=26 March 2015|publisher=}}</ref> All new members must be invited in person or, if distance prevents this, verbally, as connection and conversation are key to the club’s purpose. The only requirement for joining is a generous, collaborative spirit and a willingness to support other women.
==See also== * [[List of supper clubs]]
==References== {{reflist}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Fainting Club}} [[Category:Dining clubs]] [[Category:Women-only spaces]] [[Category:Supper clubs]]

revision.text:
