{{Crisis in Bolivarian Venezuela}} {{Multiple image|direction=vertical|width=320|align=right|image1=Mother of All Marches - Holding Flag.jpg|image2=Mother of All Marches - Caracas.jpg|caption1={{Center|Image facing east on the [[Francisco Fajardo Freeway]]}}|caption2=Facing west in same position during [[Mother of All Marches]]}}
The '''[[2017 Venezuelan protests]]''' began in late January following the abandonment of [[Holy See|Vatican]]-backed dialogue between the Bolivarian government and the opposition. [[Timeline of the 2014 Venezuelan protests|The series of protests originally began in February 2014]] when hundreds of thousands of Venezuelans protested due to high levels of criminal violence, inflation, and chronic scarcity of basic goods because of policies created by the [[Venezuelan government]]<ref>{{cite news|last=Lopez|first=Linette|title=Why The United States Has Done Nothing About Venezuela|url=http://www.businessinsider.com/why-the-us-wont-touch-venezuela-2014-4|accessdate=12 April 2014|newspaper=Business Insider|date=11 April 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Protesters in Venezuela Press Government|url=https://online.wsj.com/news/articles/SB10001424052702304834704579401612202743396|accessdate=12 April 2014|newspaper=The Wall Street Journal|date=23 February 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Venezuelans protest en masse in rival rallies|url=http://www.theborneopost.com/2014/02/24/venezuelans-protest-en-masse-in-rival-rallies/|accessdate=12 April 2014|newspaper=Borneo Post|date=24 February 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news| title= Venezuela's Maduro says 2013 annual inflation was 56.2 pct|url= https://www.reuters.com/article/2013/12/30/venezuela-inflation-annual-idUSL2N0K90V020131230 |accessdate= 19 January 2014|newspaper= Reuters|date= 30 December 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news | title = Venezuela Inflation Hits 16-Year High as Shortages Rise|url= https://www.bloomberg.com/news/2013-11-07/venezuela-inflation-hits-16-year-high-as-shortages-rise.html |accessdate=16 February 2014|newspaper= Bloomberg|date= 7 November 2013}}</ref> though the size of protests had decreased since 2014. Following the [[2017 Venezuelan constitutional crisis]], protests began to increase greatly throughout Venezuela.<ref>{{cite news |title = Venezuela accused of 'self-coup' after Supreme Court shuts down National Assembly |url = http://www.buenosairesherald.com/article/225180/venezuela-accused-of-%E2%80%98selfcoup%E2%80%99-after-supreme-court-shuts-down-national-assembly |accessdate = 1 April 2017 |work = [[Buenos Aires Herald]] |date = 31 March 2017 }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title = Venezuela's Descent Into Dictatorship |url = https://www.nytimes.com/2017/03/31/opinion/venezuelas-descent-into-dictatorship.html?_r=0 |accessdate = 1 April 2017 |work = The New York Times |date = 31 March 2017 }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url = http://www.skynews.com.au/news/world/sthamerica/2017/04/01/venezuela-clashes--self-inflicted-coup---oas.html |title = Venezuela clashes 'self-inflicted coup': OAS |accessdate = 1 April 2017 |publisher = [[Sky News Australia]] |date = 1 April 2017 }}</ref>
The opposition protests demanded immediate presidential elections to be held following controversy surrounding the [[Presidency of Nicolás Maduro#Recall referendum|failure to recall]] President [[Nicolás Maduro]]. The protests are listed below according to the month they had happened.
==January== * '''9 January''' – The [[National Assembly (Venezuela)|National Assembly]] declares President Maduro of abandoning his office, accusing him of "breach of the constitutional and democratic order, the violation of Human Rights and the devastation of the economic and social foundations of the nation".<ref>{{cite news|title=Venezuela National Assembly Decides Nicolas Maduro No Longer President|url=http://www.latintimes.com/nicolas-maduro-out-national-assembly-declares-venezuela-president-abandonment-409210|accessdate=13 January 2017|work=[[Latin Times]]|date=10 January 2017}}</ref> * '''11 January''' – President Maduro declares the opposition-led National Assembly "self-dissolved" following their ruling that he had abandoned the presidency.<ref name="REUT2017">{{cite news|last1=Oré|first1=Diego|last2=Ulmer|first2=Alexandra|title=Venezuela arrests anti-Maduro politicians in sweep|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-venezuela-politics-idUSKBN14W2QP|accessdate=13 January 2017|work=[[Reuters]]|date=13 January 2017}}</ref> * '''12 January''' – Multiple opposition leaders and members are arrested by the Venezuelan government for allegedly attempting to overthrow the government, with individuals including former general [[Raul Baduel]]. Opposition leader [[Henrique Capriles Radonski]] states that the Maduro administration is attempting to bar opposition politicians from being in office.<ref name="REUT2017"/> [[Democratic Unity Roundtable]] Secretary General, [[Jesús Torrealba]], stated that demonstrations would be held on 23 January 2017 on the anniversary of the fall of [[Marco Perez Jimenez]]'s dictatorship, with Torrealba stating "there will be a national mobilization demanding democracy before the authoritarian regime".<ref>{{cite news|last1=Latinoamérica|first1=García Media|title=Oposición llamó a manifestarse el 23 de enero por elecciones|url=http://eltiempo.com.ve/venezuela/protesta/oposicion-llamo-a-manifestarse-el-23-de-enero-por-elecciones/234806|accessdate=20 January 2017|work=[[El Tiempo (Anzoátegui)|El Tiempo]]|date=12 January 2017}}</ref> * '''13 January''' –Following the arrests of opposition members, a scheduled dialogue session between the opposition and Bolivarian government is cancelled.<ref name="LAHT19jan2017">{{cite news|title=Latin American Herald Tribune - After Venezuela Government Fails to Honor Commitments, Vatican Pulls Out of Dialogue It Sponsored|url=http://www.laht.com/article.asp?ArticleId=2429464&CategoryId=10717|accessdate=20 January 2017|work=[[Latin American Herald Tribune]]|date=19 January 2017}}</ref> * '''19 January''' – The Vatican officially pulls out of the dialogue process between the Bolivarian government and the opposition, essentially ending talks between both parties.<ref name="LAHT19jan2017"/> * '''20 January'''-Following the election of [[Donald Trump]] as President of the United States, the Venezuelan government gifted $500,000 toward [[Donald Trump's inauguration]] on 20 January 2017.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Campoy|first1=Ana|title=Venezuela, where people are starving, gave Trump half a million dollars for his inauguration|url=https://qz.com/963702/fec-report-venezuelas-citgo-donated-500000-to-donald-trumps-inaugural-committee/|accessdate=19 April 2017|work=[[Quartz (publication)|Quartz]]|date=19 April 2017}}</ref>
{{Quote box|width=250px|align=right|quote=This is our last conventional protest, the next ones, well, those will be surprise ones.|source=-- [[Henrique Capriles Radonski]]<ref name=LAHT23jan>{{cite news|title=Latin American Herald Tribune - Venezuela Opposition Warns of "Surprise Tactics" Against Maduro Regime|url=http://www.laht.com/article.asp?ArticleId=2429708&CategoryId=10717|accessdate=26 January 2017|work=[[Latin American Herald Tribune]]|date=23 January 2017}}</ref>}}
* '''23 January''' – Several thousand Venezuelans protested throughout the country, with numbers much smaller than the previous year due to fear of repression and discouragement, along with reports that protesters were stopped by government checkpoints en route to the demonstration.<ref name="WPjan23">{{cite news|last1=Barbarani|first1=Sofia|title=Thousands march against Maduro government in Venezuela as crisis deepens|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/the_americas/thousands-march-against-maduro-government-in-venezuela-as-crisis-deepens/2017/01/23/6151f18e-e180-11e6-a419-eefe8eff0835_story.html|accessdate=26 January 2017|work=Washington Post|date=23 January 2017}}</ref> The Bolivarian government had also cordoned of the planned march areas with police and closed all subway and transportation systems to the area.<ref name=LAHT23jan/> Opposition leader Henrique Capriles announces that the days march would be the last official march, with future demonstrations potentially occurring by "surprise".<ref name="WPjan23"/> * '''24 January''' – The first surprise demonstration occurs with only hundreds of Venezuelans attending, blocking the Francisco Fajardo highway in both directions holding a sign saying "Elections now", with Venezuelan authorities not being able to respond until an hour later when the protest was peacefully broken up.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Camacho|first1=Carlos|title=Latin American Herald Tribune - Venezuela Opposition Warns of "Surprise Tactics" Against Maduro Regime|url=http://www.laht.com/article.asp?ArticleId=2429708&CategoryId=10717|accessdate=26 January 2017|work=[[Latin American Herald Tribune]]|date=24 January 2017}}</ref> * '''27 January''' – Members of the opposition-led National Assembly gathered for a meeting in the Caracas slum of [[Petare]], one of the largest slums in the world, rebuking Russian rhetoric that regarded opposition protests as a "[[color revolution]]".<ref>{{cite news|title=Venezuela parliament rejects Russian 'interventionist communique'|url=http://www.upi.com/Top_News/World-News/2017/01/27/Venezuela-parliament-rejects-Russian-interventionist-communique/9741485529549/|accessdate=3 February 2017|work=[[UPI]]|date=27 January 2017|language=en}}</ref>
==February== * '''1 February''' – President Maduro announces that the [[Venezuelan National Militia|Bolivarian National Militia]] would be directed towards an anti-protest objective, saying that his supporters "will multiply throughout the territory, special forces of rapid action, special troops of the militias ... to make our homeland impregnable".<ref>{{cite news|title=Maduro anunció despliegue de "fuerzas civiles antidisturbios" en todo el territorio nacional|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/02/01/maduro-anuncio-despliegue-de-fuerzas-civiles-antidisturbios-en-todo-el-territorio-nacional/|accessdate=3 February 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=1 February 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> * '''12 February''' – Student leaders called for protests on 12 February, commemorating three years of national protests called La Salida, with marches in Caracas planned to pass by the area where student Robert Redman was killed on the first day of protests.<ref>{{cite news|title=Estudiantes convocan a los venezolanos a marchar este #12F|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/02/02/estudiantes-convocan-a-los-venezolanos-a-marchar-este-12f/|accessdate=3 February 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=2 February 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> Later, opposition deputies attempted to enter the CNE headquarters to present a document demanding a time frame of regional and municipal elections, with National Guardsmen responding violently towards the deputies after the politicians attempted to enter past them.<ref>{{cite news|title=GNB saca a empujones a diputados del CNE (Fotos + Videos)|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/02/02/gnb-saca-a-empujones-a-diputados-del-cne-fotos-video/|accessdate=3 February 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=2 February 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> * '''16 February''' - The Supreme Tribunal of Justice upholds a 13-year and 9-month prison sentence on [[Popular Will]] founder, [[Leopoldo López]] for inciting violence by "subliminal messages" at the 2014 anti-government protests. US President Donald Trump demands Venezuela release him.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-trump-venezuela/trump-calls-on-venezuela-to-release-jailed-opposition-leader-lopez-idUSKBN15V01F |title=Trump calls on Venezuela to release jailed opposition leader Lopez}}</ref>
==March== [[File:TSJ protest 31 March 2017.webm|thumb|right|Students protesting against rulings outside of the TSJ on 31 March 2017.]] * '''22 March''' –In Los Ruices, Venezuelans suffering from chronic diseases protested outside of a social security pharmacy due to the shortages of medication facing the country.<ref>{{cite news|last1=León|first1=Daniela|title=Pacientes se "encadenaron" en Los Ruices por la escasez de medicinas|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/noticias/protestas/pacientes-encadenaron-los-ruices-por-escasez-medicinas_86643|accessdate=13 April 2017|work=[[El Nacional (Caracas)|El Nacional]]|date=22 March 2017|language=es}}</ref> * '''29 March''' – The [[2017 Venezuelan constitutional crisis]] begins, with immunity being taken away from opposition parliamentarians by the [[Supreme Tribunal of Justice (Venezuela)|Supreme Tribunal of Justice of Venezuela (TSJ)]], with the TSJ assuming legislative powers of the opposition-controlled National Assembly.<ref>[http://www.dw.com/en/opinion-coup-in-venezuela/a-38221905 Coup in Venezuela]</ref><ref>[http://www.dw.com/en/venezuela-supreme-court-takes-over-legislative-powers-from-national-assembly/a-38214811 Venezuela Supreme Court takes over legislative powers from National Assembly]</ref> * '''30 March''' -Deputy spokesperson for the U.S. Department of State [[Mark Toner]] expressed disapproval on behalf of the United States by stating the U.S. considered the dissolution of the Venezuelan National Assembly as "a serious setback for democracy" in the country, further stating "The United States condemns the Venezuelan Supreme Court's March 29 decision to usurp the power of the democratically elected National Assembly..." * '''31 March''' - Attorney general, [[Luisa Ortega Díaz]] denounces the dissolution of the National Assembly with some protesters holding signs saying "No To Dictatorship".<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-venezuela-politics/venezuela-seeks-to-cool-outrage-over-court-power-grab-idUSKBN1721P8 |title=Venezuela seeks to cool outrage over court power grab}}</ref>
==April== [[File:Venezuelan Assembly special session 08.jpg|thumb|Parliamentaries special session in Brión Square]] [[File:No + Dictadura.jpg|thumb|Demonstrators holding signs saying "No more dictatorship"]] [[File:Marcha Altamira 2017.jpg|thumb|Opposition march on 6 April]] * '''1 April''' – The National Assembly holds a special session a calls for a concentration in Brión Square in Caracas to discuss the Supreme Court sentences. Although it was noted that the Supreme Court reversed its decision in following resolutions, the parliamentaries argued that the juridic action was a coup.<ref>{{cite web|title=AN acordó agenda de protestas en sesión de este sábado|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/noticias/asamblea-nacional/acordo-agenda-protestas-sesion-este-sabado_88463|publisher=El Nacional|accessdate=4 April 2017|language=es}}</ref> * '''4 April''' – The opposition called for a march from [[Plaza Venezuela]] to the National Assembly; access to the meeting point was blocked by the [[Bolivarian National Guard]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Reportan que GNB restringe accesos a Plaza Venezuela|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/noticias/sociedad/reportan-que-gnb-restringe-accesos-plaza-venezuela_88835|publisher=El Nacional|accessdate=4 April 2017|language=es}}</ref> Twelve [[Caracas Metro]] subway stations were closed.<ref>{{cite web|title=Mantienen cerradas 12 estaciones del Metro de Caracas|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/noticias/servicios/mantienen-cerradas-estaciones-del-metro-caracas_88831|publisher=El Nacional|accessdate=4 April 2017|language=es}}</ref> Pro-government [[Colectivo (Venezuela)|colectivos]] blocked opposition marches and fired weapons at protesters,<ref>{{cite news|title=Colectivos disparan contra manifestantes en la autopista Francisco Fajardo|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/noticias/politica/colectivos-dispararon-contra-manifestantes-francisco-fajardo_88905|accessdate=5 April 2017|work=[[El Nacional (Caracas)|El Nacional]]|date=4 April 2017|language=es}}</ref> with demonstrations resulting in the injuries of about 42 individuals, including seven police officers, while over 50 people were arrested.<ref>{{cite news|title=Más de 40 heridos dejó represión gubernamental por protestar la ruptura del hilo Constitucional|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/04/04/mas-de-40-heridos-dejo-represion-gubernamental-por-protestar-la-ruptura-del-hilo-constitucional/|accessdate=5 April 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=4 April 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> * '''5 April''' – National guards fired tear gas in the engineering faculty of the [[University of Carabobo]] and dispersed a protest, violating the university's autonomy. The rector of the university, the governor of Carabobo and other figures denounced the actions. There were 14 injured and 4 arrests during the protest and classes were suspended indefinitely. Hours later the detainees were released.<ref>{{cite web|title=14 heridos y 4 detenidos en la Universidad de Carabobo tras enfrentamientos|url=http://www.talcualdigital.com/Nota/141230/14-heridos-y-4-detenidos-en-la-universidad-de-carabobo-tras-enfrentamientos|publisher=Tal Cual|accessdate=6 April 2017}}</ref> * '''6 April''' – Jairo Ortiz, a 19-year-old student of the [[Bicentenary University of Aragua]], was shot and killed while protesting in [[Carrizal, Venezuela|Carrizal]], [[Miranda (state)|Miranda]].<ref name="deadAPRIL17">{{cite news|title=Murió joven durante protesta en Carrizal|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/noticias/sucesos/murio-joven-durante-protesta-carrizal_647353|accessdate=7 April 2017|work=[[El Universal (Caracas)|El Universal]]|date=7 April 2017|language=es}}</ref> * '''7 April''' – General [[Angel Vivas]] was arrested during a [[SEBIN]] operation that tricked him into helping a young man that hit his car into the front door of his house, three years after a detention order was published during the 2014 protests.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Salazar|first1=Abraham|title=Detenido el General Ángel Vivas mediante "operación sorpresa"|url=http://efectococuyo.com/principales/detenido-el-general-angel-vivas-mediante-operacion-sorpresa|accessdate=11 April 2017|agency=Efecto Cocuyo|date=7 April 2017|language=es}}</ref> * '''8 April''' – During the protests 16 subway stations and 19 Caracas Metrobus routes were closed;<ref>{{cite web|title=16 estaciones del Metro de Caracas y 19 rutas del Metrobús están cerradas|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/noticias/caracas/estaciones-del-metro-caracas-rutas-del-metrobus-estan-cerradas_647533|publisher=El Universal|accessdate=10 April 2017|language=es}}</ref> [[Henrique Capriles]]' campaign command was attacked with tear gas and burned by the Bolivarian Guard and Police.<ref>{{cite web|title=Denuncian que GNB y PNB incendiaron comando de campaña de Capriles|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/noticias/politica/denuncian-que-gnb-pnb-incendiaron-comando-campana-capriles_96055|publisher=El Nacional|accessdate=10 April 2017}}</ref> The Supreme Tribunal was attacked by violent protestors during the afternoon, burning furniture, breaking windows and damaging the front door.<ref>{{cite web|title=Magistratura del TSJ denuncia que sede en Chacao fue atacada por vándalos|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/noticias/sucesos/magistratura-del-tsj-denuncia-que-sede-chacao-fue-atacada-por-vandalos_96064|publisher=El Nacional|accessdate=9 April 2017|language=es}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=En video: Vándalos incendian sede del TSJ|url=http://www.notitarde.com/en-video-vandalos-incendian-sede-del-tsj-/pais/2017/04/08/1054501/|publisher=Notitarde|accessdate=9 April 2017}}</ref> Although the [[SEBIN]] pointed out that [[Primero Justicia]] leaders were involved, opposition leaders like [[Freddy Guevara]] and [[David Smolansky]] denounced the attack.<ref>{{cite web|title=Sebin: Dirigentes de PJ están involucrados en actos vandálicos|url=http://www.caraotadigital.net/nacionales/sebin-dirigentes-de-pj-estan-involucrados-en-actos-vandalicos/|publisher=Caraota Digital|accessdate=9 April 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Dirigentes opositores repudian ataque a la sede del TSJ en Chacao|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/noticias/oposicion/dirigentes-opositores-repudian-ataque-sede-del-tsj-chacao_96063|publisher=El Nacional|accessdate=9 April 2017|language=es}}</ref> * '''9 April''' – Secretary General [[Luis Almagro]] stated "I can not help but admire the courage of the people in the street. When no one has solved this humanitarian and political crisis, neither by means of mediation nor by rigged dialogues, the people have decided to make their voices heard in the whole continent, as mandated by the Bolivarian Constitution in its [[Article 350]]. * '''10 April''' – Daniel Queliz, a 19-year-old student of the [[Arturo Michelena University]], was shot and killed during a protest in [[Valencia, Carabobo|Valencia]] by a Carabobo Police officer.<ref>{{cite news|title=Confirman asesinato de estudiante Daniel Queliz durante protesta en Valencia este lunes|url=http://www.elimpulso.com/noticias/nacionales/confirman-asesinato-de-estudiante-daniel-queliz-durante-protesta-en-valencia-este-lunes|accessdate=11 April 2017|publisher=El Impulso|date=11 April 2017}}</ref> More than 50 individuals wounded were reported. The National Guard fired tear gas at a clinic after receiving wounded from the protests, including parliamentary [[Delsa Solórzano]], who was hit in the chest by a tear gas canister, affecting patients and forcing a baby to be taken out of the building.<ref>{{cite news|title=Protestas en Caracas dejaron más de 50 heridos|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/noticias/protestas/protestas-caracas-dejaron-mas-heridos_113787|accessdate=11 April 2017|agency=El Nacional|date=10 April 2017|language=es}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=GNB arrojó bombas lacrimógenas a Policlínica Las Mercedes|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/noticias/sucesos/gnb-arrojo-bombas-lacrimogenas-policlinica-las-mercedes_113764|accessdate=11 April 2017|publisher=El Nacional|date=10 April 2017|language=es}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Bomba lacrimógena impactó contra Delsa Solórzano|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/noticias/oposicion/bomba-lacrimogena-impacto-contra-delsa-solorzano_113758|accessdate=11 April 2017|publisher=El Nacional|date=10 April 2017|language=es}}</ref> PROVEA, opposition leaders and the [[Defensoría del Pueblo (Venezuela)|Ombudsman]], [[Tarek William Saab]], denounced that some canisters were fired from helicopters, which is against the Venezuelan Civil Aeronautics Law.<ref>{{cite news|title=Lanzan bombas lacrimógenas desde helicópteros en Chacaíto|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/noticias/protestas/lanzan-bombas-lacrimogenas-desde-helicopteros-chacaito_113767|accessdate=11 April 2017|agency=El Nacional|date=11 April 2017|language=es}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Ley establece prisión por arrojar cosas o sustancias nocivas desde aeronave|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/noticias/protestas/ley-establece-prision-por-arrojar-cosas-sustancias-nocivas-desde-aeronave_113792|accessdate=11 April 2017|agency=El Nacional|date=10 April 2017|language=es}}</ref> * '''11 April''' –While visiting San Félix, Venezuela, President Maduro had objects thrown at him during a parade while riding in a convertible [[Tiuna]] military vehicle.<ref>{{cite news|title=Groserías y "proyectiles"… a Maduro sí lo corrieron de San Félix, CON TODO (VIDEO)|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/04/11/groserias-y-proyectiles-a-maduro-si-lo-corrieron-de-san-felix-con-todo-video/|accessdate=12 April 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=11 April 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> Five persons were detained after the incident.<ref>{{cite news|title=Detienen a cinco personas por hechos contra caravana presidencial en San Félix|url=http://eltiempo.com.ve/venezuela/situacion/detienen-a-cinco-personas-por-hechos-contra-caravana-presidencial-en-san-felix/238092|accessdate=12 April 2017|agency=El Tiempo|date=11 April 2017}}</ref> In Barquisimeto, a child and a young man were shot and killed by colectivos during protests, while more than twelve individuals were wounded.<ref>{{cite news|title=11 tiros recibió joven asesinado en el oeste en manos de presuntos colectivos|url=http://www.elimpulso.com/noticias/sucesos/11-tiros-recibio-joven-asesinado-en-el-oeste-en-manos-de-presuntos-colectivos|agency=El Impulso|date=12 April 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Confirman muerte de niño de 14 años tras recibir disparo|url=http://www.2001.com.ve/en-la-calle/157062/confirman-muerte-de-nino-de-14-anos-tras-recibir-disparo.html|accessdate=12 April 2017|work=2001}}</ref> * '''12 April''' –Venezuela's Catholic church called for a calm from violence and denounced violent colectivos, with Archbishop Jorge Urosa Savino saying "the government cannot continue to protect these groups that are acting illegally". Hours later, pro-government individuals stormed the [[Basilica of St. Teresa]] in Caracas, attempting to attack Urosa, though parishioners defended him and police arrested those behind the assault.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Charner|first1=Flora|title=Venezuela protests escalate|url=http://www.cnn.com/2017/04/12/americas/venezuela-protests-escalate-san-felix-bicentennial/|accessdate=13 April 2017|work=[[CNN]]|date=12 April 2017}}</ref> * '''13 April''' – Two young students and members of Primero Justicia, the Sánchez brothers, were detained. Opposition leaders stated that they were tortured to force them incriminate leaders and parliamentaries.<ref>{{cite news|title=Almagro condenó detención y presunta tortura a hermanos Sánchez|url=http://runrun.es/nacional/305192/almagro-condeno-detencion-y-presunta-tortura-a-hermanos-sanchez.html|accessdate=17 April 2017|agency=EFE|publisher=Runrun.es|date=16 April 2017}}</ref> 27 subway stations were closed,<ref>{{cite news|title=Cerradas 27 estaciones del Metro de Caracas este jueves|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/noticias/servicios/cerradas-estaciones-del-metro-caracas-este-jueves_177154|accessdate=7 April 2018|agency=El Nacional|date=13 April 2017|language=Spanish}}</ref> * '''14 April''' –The opposition announced the "Grand March and Great Taking in All States" march to take place on 19 April to "overflow" Caracas.<ref>{{cite news|title=Oposición invita a ejercer la mayor presión "desbordando Venezuela" contra la dictadura este #19Abr|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/04/14/oposicion-invita-a-ejercer-la-mayor-presion-desbordando-venezuela-contra-la-dictadura-este-19abr/|accessdate=18 April 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=14 April 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Unidad marcha este #19Abr hacia la Defensoría y establece agenda para días próximos (+Puntos)|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/04/15/unidad-marcha-este-19abr-hacia-la-defensoria-y-establece-agenda-para-dias-proximos-puntos/|accessdate=18 April 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=15 April 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> * '''15 April''' –President Maduro announced that over 2,000 security checkpoints would be established throughout Venezuela prior to the 19 April "mega march", with nearly 200,000 Venezuelan authorities said to be participating.<ref>{{cite news|title=Maduro dejará en las calles de Venezuela 2.026 puntos de control hasta el #19Abr|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/04/15/maduro-dejara-en-las-calles-de-venezuela-2-026-puntos-de-control-hasta-el-19abr/|accessdate=18 April 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=15 April 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref>
{{Quote box|width=216px|align=right|quote=I order SEBIN to sue those spokesmen of the opposition who are accusing of barbarities and improper acts that are never discussed in this republic.|source=-- President [[Nicolás Maduro]]<ref name=SEBINsue>{{cite news|title=Gobierno ordenó querellas judiciales contra quienes acusan a organismos policiales de torturas|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/04/16/gobierno-ordeno-querellas-judiciales-contra-quienes-acusan-a-organismos-policiales-de-torturas/|accessdate=18 April 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=16 April 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref>}}
* '''16 April''' –On Easter, [[Burning of Judas]] celebrations occurred, with Venezuelans burning effigies of TSJ judges, President Maduro, Ombudsman [[Tarek Saab|Tarek Wiliam Saab]] and other Bolivarian officials they accused of "betraying" Venezuela.<ref>{{cite news|title=Magistrados, Maduro, oficialistas GNB y PNB, entre los Judas que queman los venezolanos (+Fotos)|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/04/16/magistrados-maduro-oficialistas-gnb-y-pnb-entre-los-judas-que-queman-los-venezolanos-fotos/|accessdate=18 April 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=16 April 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> Venezuela's intelligence agency, [[SEBIN]], is ordered by President Maduro to take legal actions against individuals who state that they have tortured by authorities.<ref name=SEBINsue/> * '''17 April''' –President Maduro ordered the expansion of the [[Venezuelan National Militia]] to involve 500,000 loyal Venezuelans, stating that each would be armed with a rifle and demanded the prevention of another event similar to the [[2002 Venezuelan coup d'état attempt]].<ref>{{cite news|title=En un país sin medicinas, ni comida… Maduro aprueba recursos para "garantizar un fusil para cada miliciano"|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/04/17/en-un-pais-sin-medicinas-ni-comida-maduro-aprueba-recursos-para-garantizar-un-fusil-para-cada-miliciano/|accessdate=18 April 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=17 April 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> [[Diosdado Cabello]], a high-level PSUV official loyal to the Bolivarian government, stated that 60,000 motorized colectivos and the National Militia would be spread throughout Caracas on 19 April "until necessary" to deter the opposition's "megamarch", calling their actions "terrorism".<ref>{{cite news|title=Diosdado Cabello: La oposición no va a entrar a Caracas este #19Abr|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/04/17/diosdado-cabello-la-oposicion-no-va-a-entrar-a-caracas-este-19abr/|accessdate=18 April 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=17 April 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref>
<big>'''Mother of All Protests'''</big> {{Main|Mother of All Protests}} [[File:Altamira Square April 19th 2017.jpg|thumb|right|[[Altamira Square]], one of the meeting points of the April 19th 2017 march.]] [[File:Venezuelan March of Silence 01.jpg|thumb|right|Students wearing black and carrying white roses during the March of Silence.]] [[File:Venezuela Sit In 2017 01.jpg|thumb|right|Teacher giving lecture during a sit-in on 24 April.]] [[File:Marcha Juan Pablo Pernalete.jpg|thumb|right|Silent march in honor of Juan Pablo Pernalete on 27 April.]] *'''19 April''' –The "mother of all protests," as it was called by organizers,<ref name="npr 4/20">{{cite web | url=https://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/04/19/524708302/venezuela-erupts-in-mother-of-all-protests-as-anti-maduro-sentiment-seethes | title=Venezuela Erupts In 'Mother Of All Protests' As Anti-Maduro Sentiment Seethes | publisher=NPR | date=19 April 2017 | accessdate=20 April 2017}}</ref> occurred. The day began with demonstrators gathering around the country at about 10:30am, with [[Caracas]] having 26 different routes for the main march to head to the office of the Ombudsman to demonstrate.<ref name="ABCmother">{{cite news|title=The Latest: US official expresses concern over Venezuela|url=http://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/latest-venezuelans-gear-opposition-march-46887245|accessdate=19 April 2017|work=[[ABC News]]|date=19 April 2017|language=en}}</ref> As the march progressed through Caracas, the National Guard began to block routes and fire [[tear gas]] at marchers at 11:50am, with the demonstrators refusing to leave despite the use of force.<ref name="ABCmother"/> :At about 12:30pm, demonstrations by both opposition and pro-government Venezuelans fill Caracas' avenues.<ref name="ABCmother"/> Shortly after 12:45pm, protesters on the Francisco Fajardo Freeway near Bello Monte begin to flee the area after enduring over an hour of tear gas from authorities, with many leaping into the [[Guaire River]], which is used for sewage drainage, to avoid the gas.<ref>{{cite news|title=Manifestantes se lanzan al río Guaire para huir de los gases lacrimógenos|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/noticias/protestas/manifestantes-lanzan-rio-guaire-para-huir-los-gases-lacrimogenos_177892|accessdate=20 April 2017|work=[[El Nacional (Caracas)|El Nacional]]|date=19 April 2017|language=es}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Venezuela: opositores saltan al río Guaire para escapar de la represión|url=http://elcomercio.pe/mundo/latinoamerica/venezuela-opositores-saltan-al-rio-escapar-represion-noticia-1985192|accessdate=20 April 2017|work=[[El Comercio (Peru)|El Comercio]]|date=19 April 2017|language=es}}</ref> Near 2:10pm, a 17-year-old boy was shot in the head and killed at a protest.<ref name="ABCmother"/> At about 4:35pm, pro-government [[paramilitary|paramilitaries]] called [[Colectivo (Venezuela)|colectivos]] shot and killed Paola Ramirez, a 23-year-old woman who was protesting.<ref name="ABCmother"/> :Later in the evening, a National Guardsman was killed south of Caracas, the first authority killed in the year's protests, with the day's deaths raising the death toll of 2017 protests to at least 8 people.<ref>{{cite news|title=Venezuela crisis: Three killed at anti-government protests|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-latin-america-39645809|accessdate=20 April 2017|work=[[BBC News]]|date=20 April 2017}}</ref> By 9:00pm, the Penal Forum stated that 521 Venezuelans had been arrested throughout the day, bringing the number of total arrests since the beginning of the year to over 1,000.<ref>{{cite news|title=Foro Penal reporta más de 1000 arrestos tras protestas desde el 4-A {{!}} En la Agenda {{!}} 2001.com.ve|url=http://www.2001.com.ve/en-la-agenda/157561/foro-penal-reporta-mas-de-1000-arrestos-tras-protestas-desde-el-4-a.html|accessdate=20 April 2017|work=[[Diario 2001]]|date=19 April 2017}}</ref> :Various observers gave different estimates on the numbers of protesters. ''[[The New York Times]]'' estimated "thousands of people",<ref>{{cite news |first1=Nicholas |last1=Casey |author2=Patricia Torres |date=19 April 2017 |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/04/19/world/americas/venezuela-caracas-maduro-protests.html?_r=1 |title=At Least 3 Die in Venezuela Protests Against Nicolás Maduro |website=The New York Times |accessdate=20 April 2017 }}</ref> several other media outlets<ref>{{cite news |first=Colin |last=Dwyer |date=19 April 2017 |title=Venezuela Erupts in 'Mother of All Protests' As Anti-Maduro Sentiment Seethes |url=https://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/04/19/524708302/venezuela-erupts-in-mother-of-all-protests-as-anti-maduro-sentiment-seethes |website=NPR |accessdate=20 April 2017 }}</ref> (including [[NBC News]]<ref>{{cite news|title='Mother of all marches' turns violent in Venezuela|url=http://www.nbcnews.com/news/latino/mother-all-marches-turns-violent-venezuela-n748396|accessdate=19 April 2017|work=[[NBC News]]|date=19 April 2017|language=en}}</ref> and [[Reuters]]<ref>{{cite news |first1=Brian |last1=Ellsworth |author2=Diego Oré |date=20 April 2017 |title=Venezuelan opposition protests again against Maduro |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-venezuela-politics-idUSKBN17M1OO |website=Reuters |accessdate=20 April 2017 }}</ref>) stated "hundreds of thousands", and [[Central University of Venezuela|Central University]] mathematics professor Ricardo Rios estimated at least 1.2 million protesting, which would make it the largest protest in Venezuela's history.<ref name="BLOOMmillions2017">{{cite news|title=Venezuelans March as Maduro Comes Under Increasing Scrutiny|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/politics/articles/2017-04-19/venezuelans-march-as-maduro-comes-under-increasing-scrutiny|accessdate=20 April 2017|work=[[Bloomberg L.P.]]|date=19 April 2017}}</ref> According to pollster Meganálisis, 2.5 million Venezuelans protested in Caracas alone, while 6 million protested throughout the country.<ref name="ENmillions">{{cite news|last1=LUGO-GALICIA|first1=HERNÁN|last2=NUÑEZA|first2=AYATOLA|title=El país grito: "Maduro, no te queremos"|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/noticias/politica/pais-grito-maduro-queremos_178023|accessdate=20 April 2017|work=[[El Nacional (Caracas)|El Nacional]]|date=20 April 2017|language=es}}</ref><ref name="SEMANAmillions">{{cite news|title=El corresponsal de SEMANA en Caracas relata cómo la madre de todas las marchas que convocó la oposición venezolana, terminó como se esperaba con represión con violencia. Análisis del duro panorama en el vecino país.|url=http://www.semana.com/mundo/articulo/venezuela-pedido-de-elecciones-acumula-represion-y-muerte/522587|accessdate=21 April 2017|work=[[Semana]]|date=20 April 2017}}</ref><ref name="RFImillions">{{cite news|title=Noticias de América - Día de violencia en las marchas a favor y en contra de Maduro|url=http://es.rfi.fr/americas/20170420-dia-de-violencia-en-las-marchas-favor-y-en-contra-de-maduro|accessdate=21 April 2017|work=[[Radio France Internationale]]|date=20 April 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref>
*'''20–21 April''' – At least twelve people were killed at the streets of [[Caracas]] during lootings. The office of the Venezuelan attorney general said that eleven of those deaths were caused by electrocution and gunshot wounds in [[El Valle del Espíritu Santo]]. A district mayor [[Carlos Ocariz]] said that one protestor was fatally shot in [[Petare]].<ref>{{cite news |first1=Nicholas |last1=Casey |author2=Patricia Torres |date=21 April 2017 |title=At Least 12 Die as Rioting Breaks Out in Venezuela |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/04/21/world/americas/venezuela-riots.html |website=The New York Times |accessdate=21 April 2017 }}</ref> *'''22 April''' – Hundreds of thousands of Venezuelans participate in a silent march in memory of those killed, marching from the wealthier east side of Caracas to the west side, the first time demonstrators were able to travel to western Caracas without be barricaded by authorities. Many gathered in the Montalbán municipality of Caracas near the [[Venezuelan Episcopal Conference]]. Opposition leaders vowed to keep protesting until new elections are announced.<ref>{{cite news|title=The Latest: Venezuelan protesters cross into western Caracas|url=http://www.foxnews.com/world/2017/04/22/latest-venezuelan-protesters-cross-into-western-caracas.html|accessdate=23 April 2017|work=[[Fox News]]|date=22 April 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=¡Al grito de sí se pudo!: Cientos de miles de caraqueños copan Montalbán junto a dirigentes opositores (FOTO + VIDEO)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/04/22/al-grito-de-si-se-pudo-cientos-de-miles-de-caraquenos-copan-montalban-junto-a-dirigentes-opositores-foto-video/|accessdate=23 April 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=22 April 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> *'''23 April''' – The Democratic Unity Roundtable announces the plans for the 24 April protest titled "The National Sit-in", with gathering points designated in La Villa, Crema Paraíso de Santa Monica, Plaza Brión de Chacaíto, Caurimare, Santa Fe, Altamira, Unicentro el Marqués and Altamira.<ref>{{cite news|title=Estos son los puntos de concentración para el "Gran Plantón" en Caracas este #24A|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/04/23/estos-son-los-puntos-de-concentracion-para-el-gran-planton-en-caracas-este-24a/|accessdate=24 April 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=23 April 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> Organizers stated that it "is a protest of resistance, not of ruckus", calling for a national standstill and asked marchers be prepared with food, water, comfortable clothes and cell phone batteries.<ref>{{cite news|title=Claves para la realización de el "Gran Plantón" de este #24A|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/04/23/puntos-claves-para-el-gran-planton-de-este-24a/|accessdate=24 April 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=23 April 2017|language=es}}</ref> *'''24 April''' – The National Sit-in occurs, with Venezuelans peacefully filling the country's streets grinding them to a halt. In Caracas, demonstrators sat playing games in streets, using umbrellas to shade themselves from the sun. In other locations, professors gave lectures in the streets about politics while other created fires, cooking soups in the streets. By the evening, smaller skirmishes separate from the sit-ins caused most of the days violence, leaving more than two Venezuelans dead and 3 wounded.<ref>{{cite news|title=Venezuela death toll rises as unrest enters fourth week|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-venezuela-politics-idUSKBN17Q1KO|accessdate=25 April 2017|work=[[Reuters]]|date=25 April 2017}}</ref><ref>https://venezuelanalysis.com/news/13074</ref> In Miranda state, a local United Socialist Party leader was shot dead at her home.<ref>https://venezuelanalysis.com/news/13072</ref>{{better source|date=April 2017}} *'''26 April''' –The Bolivarian government begins efforts to withdraw from the [[Organization of American States]], a 2-year process, after multiple member states called for a special session to discuss Venezuela's crisis.<ref>{{cite news|title=Venezuela goes through with threat to leave the OAS|url=http://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/venezuela-threatens-exit-oas-pressure-maduro-mounts-47021385|accessdate=27 April 2017|work=[[ABC News]]|date=26 April 2017|language=en}}</ref> The Caracas Metro was closed completely after being open for two hours, along with the suspension of the Metrobus and Bus Caracas services.<ref>{{cite news|title=Cerrado en su totalidad el Sistema Metro en Gran Caracas|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/noticias/servicios/cerrado-totalidad-sistema-metro-gran-caracas_179128|accessdate=7 April 2018|agency=El Nacional|ref=26 April 2017|language=Spanish}}</ref> Juan Pablo Pernalete, a 20-year-old economy student of the [[Universidad Metropolitana]], was killed by the impact of a tear gas canister in his chest during protests in Altamira. Ramón Muchacho, mayor of Chacao, reported he arrived at Salud Chacao without vital signs.<ref>{{cite news|first1=Vanessa|last1=Moreno Losada|title=Falleció estudiante en Caracas por impacto de bomba lacrimógena|url=http://efectococuyo.com/principales/fallecio-estudiante-en-caracas-por-impacto-de-bomba-lacrimogena|agency=Efecto Cocuyo|date=26 April 2017|language=es}}</ref> Following the death of the student. the son of Ombudsman [[Tarek Saab]], Yibram Saab, uploaded a video on YouTube stating that he had protested that night and that "That could've been me!", condemning what he called and plead to his father saying "Dad, in this moment you have the power to end the injustice that has sunk this country. I ask you as your son and in the name of Venezuela, to whom you serve, that you reflect on the situation and do what you have to do".<ref name="BBCson">{{cite news|title=Venezuela crisis: Son criticises rights ombudsman father in video|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-latin-america-39731693|accessdate=27 April 2017|work=[[BBC News]]|date=27 April 2017}}</ref><ref name="WPson">{{cite news|last1=Miroff|first1=Nick|title=Analysis {{!}} A top Venezuelan official's son makes video plea for his dad to 'end the injustice'|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/worldviews/wp/2017/04/27/a-top-venezuelan-officials-son-makes-video-plea-for-his-dad-to-end-the-injustice/|accessdate=27 April 2017|work=[[The Washington Post]]|date=27 April 2017}}</ref><ref name="FOXson">{{cite news|title=Venezuela crisis: Son of top Chavista official publically [sic] urges him to help stop bloodshed|url=http://www.foxnews.com/world/2017/04/27/venezuela-crisis-son-top-chavista-official-publically-urges-him-to-help-stop-bloodshed.html|accessdate=27 April 2017|work=[[Fox News]]|date=27 April 2017}}</ref> *'''27 April''' – Students marched for two hours from the [[Universidad Metropolitana]] to the place in [[Altamira Square]] where Juan Pablo Pernalete was killed, after holding a mass in the university in his honor.<ref>{{cite news|title=Homenajearon a Juan Pablo Pernalete en el lugar donde fue asesinado|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/noticias/protestas/homenajearon-juan-pablo-pernalete-lugar-donde-fue-asesinado_179397|accessdate=2 May 2017|agency=El Nacional|date=27 April 2017|language=es}}</ref>
==May== [[File:USB student protest.jpg|thumb|250px|right|[[Simón Bolívar University]] students protest blocked by National Guard trucks on 4 May.]] [[File:Chávez statue destroyed 2017.webm|170px|thumb|right|A statue of [[Hugo Chávez]] destroyed in Zulia on 5 May.]] [[File:Puputovs.jpg|thumb|250px|right|Puputovs in opposition sit in.]] [[File:Lilian Tintori Plantón.jpg|thumb|right|250px|From left to right: [[David Smolansky]], Manuela Bolívar, [[Lilian Tintori]] and Juan Andrés Mejía during national sit in on 15 May.]] [[File:Marcha Nocturna Venezuela 2017.jpg|250px|thumb|right|Nocturnal march in Caracas on 17 May 2017.]] [[File:We Are Millions march Venezuela.jpg|250px|right|thumb|Millions of Venezuelans marching on 20 May during the We Are Millions march.]] [[File:We Are Millions March Venezuela 2017.jpg|250px|right|thumb|Venezuelans marching on 20 May during the We Are Millions march in the [[Francisco Fajardo Freeway]].]] [[File:Medic Protesters Venezuela 2017.jpg|250px|right|thumb|Medics hold arms during the Health March on 24 May.]] [[File:Enfrentamiento en el Puente de Las Mercedes Venezuela 2017.jpg|250px|right|thumb|Protesters and National Guard clash during the March of the Liberators on 26 May.]]
*'''1 May''' – Hundreds of thousands protested, attempting to march to various government buildings to have their demands met. Police responded to the peaceful marches violently firing tear gas, with one National Assembly member, Jose Olivares, being struck in the head with a tear gas canister which led to heavy bleeding. President Maduro announces plans to replace the National Assembly with a communal national constitutional assembly and calls for the drafting of a new constitution, the 3rd in modern times.<ref>{{cite news|title=Venezuela's embattled socialist president calls for citizens congress, new constitution|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/world/2017/05/01/maduro-citizens-congress/101175468/|accessdate=1 May 2017|work=[[USA TODAY]]|agency=[[Associated Press]]|date=1 May 2017|language=en}}</ref> *'''3 May''' - Hundreds of thousands of people marched nationwide; two protesters were killed, and a police officer who was shot died the following day.<ref name="wp 5/4">{{cite web | url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/the_americas/venezuelans-again-take-to-streets-as-death-toll-jumps-to-37/2017/05/04/19f4df50-312f-11e7-a335-fa0ae1940305_story.html | title=Venezuelans again take to streets as death toll jumps to 37 | publisher=The Washington Post |date=4 May 2017 | accessdate=5 May 2017}}</ref> Reports circulate that [[Leopoldo López]], the leader of the [[2014 Venezuelan protests]] who was sentenced the 13 years in prison in 2015, was "transferred to a military hospital with health complications".<ref name="HRWlopezHEALTH">{{cite web|last1=Vivanco|first1=José Miguel|title=Letter to President Maduro requesting authorization to visit Leopoldo López|url=https://www.hrw.org/news/2017/05/05/letter-president-maduro-requesting-authorization-visit-leopoldo-lopez|website=[[Human Rights Watch]]|accessdate=6 May 2017|language=en|date=5 May 2017}}</ref> During a protest in Altamira, a [[Vehicle-ramming attack|National Guard truck ran over]] a group of protesters, resulting in at least three wounded.<ref>{{cite news|title=Venezuela: Graban en video a tanqueta atropellando a opositores|url=http://elcomercio.pe/mundo/latinoamerica/venezuela-graban-video-tanqueta-atropellando-opositores-noticia-1989008|accessdate=9 May 2017|agency=El Comercio|date=3 May 2017}}</ref> *'''4 May''' - Protesters, primarily students, marched in and around Caracas, with tear gas being used near the [[Central University of Venezuela]].<ref name="wp 5/4"/> The president of the federation of student centers of the José Antonio Anzoátegui university was killed during a student assembly in the city of [[El Tigre]]. Another student wounded during the incident died days later.<ref>{{cite news|title=Murió César Guzmán, estudiante herido en Universidad José Antonio Anzoátegui|url=http://globovision.com/article/fallece-cesar-guzman-estudiante-herido-la-universidad-jose-antonio-anzoategui-de-el-tigre|accessdate=19 May 2017|agency=Globovisión|date=7 May 2017}}</ref> Many supporters of [[Leopoldo López]], gathered outside of [[Ramo Verde Prison]] and protested throughout the region following reports that his health was seriously impaired and the Bolivarian government's denial of visitors to López, though they released a "proof of life" video, which some described as fabricated.<ref>{{cite news|title=Venezuela protests rage, jailed Lopez supporters stage vigil|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-venezuela-politics-idUSKBN1801OI|accessdate=6 May 2017|work=[[Reuters]]|date=5 May 2017}}</ref> [[Human Rights Watch]] further demanded President Maduro to authorize a visit to López since he had been denied visits from his family and his lawyer since early-April.<ref name="HRWlopezHEALTH"/> [[Lilian Tintori]], López's wife, later called for a march of women on Saturday, 6 May, stating to the Minister of Defense, "[[Vladimir Padrino Lopez]], are you going to shoot the women this Saturday?"<ref>{{cite news|title=Oposición convoca a las mujeres a marchar este sábado|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/noticias/oposicion/oposicion-convoca-las-mujeres-marchar-este-sabado_180604|accessdate=6 May 2017|work=[[El Nacional (Caracas)|El Nacional]]|date=4 May 2017|language=es}}</ref> *'''5 May''' - Opposition officials drape a large banner down the side of the National Assembly's administrative building high above central Caracas reading "Dictator Maduro".<ref>{{cite news|title="Maduro dictador": el pancartazo de los diputados en la AN|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/noticias/oposicion/maduro-dictador-pancartazo-los-diputados_180671|accessdate=6 May 2017|work=[[El Nacional (Caracas)|El Nacional]]|date=5 May 2017|language=es}}</ref> Citizens of [[La Villa del Rosario]] burn and tear down a statue of late President [[Hugo Chávez]], an image compared to [[Firdos Square statue destruction|the destruction of Saddam Hussein's statue in Iraq]] as well as other instances of statue toppling during times of popular unrest.<ref>{{cite news|title=Manifestantes derriban estatua de Hugo Chávez|url=https://es-us.noticias.yahoo.com/manifestantes-derriban-estatua-de-hugo-chavez-221526670.html|accessdate=9 May 2017|work=[[Yahoo News]]|date=5 May 2017|language=es-US}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Otras caídas de estatuas y símbolos que representaron el final de una era|url=http://www.infobae.com/america/mundo/2017/05/06/otras-caidas-de-estatuas-y-simbolos-que-representaron-el-final-de-una-era/|accessdate=9 May 2017|work=[[Infobae]]|date=6 May 2017|language=es-LA}}</ref> *'''6 May''' - Tens of thousands of Venezuelan women march throughout Venezuela against the government of President Maduro. In Caracas, nuns, women dressed in white and topless women marched on the Francisco Fajardo Freeway together until they were barricaded by the National Guard near central Caracas. In [[Táchira]], women marched carrying rosaries and prayed for protest victims.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Aponte|first1=Andreína|last2=Cawthorne|first2=Andrew|title=Vestidas de blanco y con rosas, mujeres opositoras marchan en Venezuela contra Maduro{{!}} Principales noticias{{!}} Reuters|url=http://es.reuters.com/article/topNews/idESKBN1820NQ-OESTP|accessdate=6 May 2017|work=[[Reuters]]|date=6 May 2017}}</ref> *'''8 May''' - President Maduro announces a plan of "a military constituency to deepen the Bolivarian military revolution within the very heart of the National Bolivarian Armed Forces", calling for the military to help draft a new constitution with the goal to "strengthen the union" between the military and civilians.<ref>{{cite news|title=Maduro activará una "constituyente militar" para fortalecer la "gloriosa" Fuerza Armada|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/05/08/maduro-activara-una-constituyente-militar-para-fortalecer-la-gloriosa-fuerza-armada/|accessdate=9 May 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=8 May 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> In Maracaibo, a foundation housing children and elderly individuals was caught between a clash of authorities and protesters, resulting in the evacuation of hundreds due to the heavy use of tear gas.<ref>{{cite news|title=Hundreds evacuated in Venezuela as tear gas seeps into homes|url=http://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/hundreds-evacuated-venezuela-tear-gas-seeps-homes-47286900|accessdate=9 May 2017|work=[[ABC News]]|date=8 May 2017|language=en}}</ref> Demonstrators begin using "Puputovs", a play on words of [[Molotov cocktail]], with glass devices filled with excrement and thrown at authorities after PSUV official [[Jacqueline Faría]] mocked protesters who had to crawl through sewage in the [[Guaire River]].<ref name="PUPUTOV">{{cite news|title=Las #Puputov son TT… tal vez a Jacqueline Faría le parezca "sabroso"|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/05/08/las-puputov-son-tt-tal-vez-a-jacqueline-faria-le-parezca-sabroso/|accessdate=9 May 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=8 May 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> The hashtag #puputov began to trend on Twitter in Venezuela while there were also reports of authorities beginning to vomit after being drenched in excrement by protesters.<ref name="PUPUTOV"/><ref>{{cite news|title=¡LO ÚLTIMO! Manifestantes lanzaron excremento a los PNB y GNB represores y #puputovs se vuelve tendencia|url=https://dolartoday.com/lo-ultimo-manifestantes-lanzaron-excremento-los-pnb-y-gnb-represores-y-puputovs-se-vuelve-tendencia/|accessdate=9 May 2017|work=[[DolarToday]]|date=9 May 2017|language=es}}</ref> *'''9 May''' - In Caracas and Táchira, the Democratic Unity Roundtable called for [[open cabildos]] to discuss the proposed assembly constituency.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Delgado|first1=Eleonora|title=En cabildos abiertos discutirán propuesta de Constituyente en Táchira|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/noticias/oposicion/cabildos-abiertos-discutiran-propuesta-constituyente-tachira_181297|agency=El Nacional|date=9 May 2017|language=es}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=MUD realizará cabildo abierto contra la Constituyente este martes en Caracas|url=http://globovision.com/article/mud-realiza-cabildo-abierto-contra-la-constituyente-este-martes-en-caracas|agency=Globovisión|date=9 May 2017}}</ref> 25-year-old Oriana Wadskier, a student of the [[University of Carabobo]], was run over by an IVSS truck (Instituto Venezolano de los Seguros Sociales) during a protest of agricultural workers in [[Calabozo]], [[Guárico State]]. She was taken to a hospital by helicopter, where she was later stabilized, while the National Guard arrested the truck driver.<ref>{{cite news|title=Camioneta del IVSS atropelló a una manifestante en Calabozo|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/noticias/protestas/camioneta-del-ivss-atropello-una-manifestante-calabozo_181319|agency=El Nacional|date=9 May 2017|language=es}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Arrollan a una dama mientras protestaba en Calabozo #9Mayo|url=http://www.elimpulso.com/featured/video-gnb-arrollo-una-dama-protestaba-calabozo-9mayo|agency=El Impulso|date=9 May 2017}}</ref> On social media, Venezuelans, apparently unrelated to political parties, call for a "Marcha de la Mierda", or a ''"March of the Shit"'', asking protesters to bring "puputov cocktails" to marches to retaliate against the use of tear gas by authorities, instructing Venezuelans how to make them and safe methods of using containers other than glass so they would not hurt authorities.<ref>{{cite news|title='They have gas; we have excrement': Venezuela protests take a dirty turn|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2017/may/09/venezuela-protest-poo-poo-tov-cocktail-nicolas-maduro|accessdate=10 May 2017|work=[[The Guardian]]|date=9 May 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Venezolanos usan excremento contra policía; convocan a "Marcha de la Mierda"|url=http://www.eluniversal.com.mx/articulo/mundo/2017/05/9/venezolanos-usan-excremento-contra-policia-convocan-marcha-de-la-mierda|accessdate=10 May 2017|work=[[El Universal (Mexico City)|El Universal]]|date=9 May 2017|language=es}}</ref>''"They have gas; we have excrement,"'' reads an image floating around social media to advertise Wednesday's "shit march". *'''10 May''' - Demonstrators attempt to march to the [[Supreme Tribunal of Justice (Venezuela)|Supreme Tribunal of Justice]] headquarters. Protests turn violent as authorities repress demonstrators. In Altamira, one student is shot in the head with a tear gas canister and knocked unconscious.<ref>{{cite news|title=[VIDEO] ¡UNA MASACRE! Régimen de Maduro hiere de gravedad a una joven estudiante que manifestaba en Altamira|url=https://dolartoday.com/video-una-masacre-regimen-de-maduro-hiere-de-gravedad-una-joven-estudiante-que-manifestaba-en-altamira/|accessdate=11 May 2017|work=[[DolarToday]]|date=10 May 2017|language=es}}</ref> In total, 170 Venezuelans were injured while one, 27-year-old Miguel Castillo Bracho, a journalist who had graduated the previous week, was killed after being shot in the chest with a tear gas canister by a National Guardsman after already being detained.<ref>{{cite news|title=Más atrocidades GNB: Venezolano recibe un bombazo en el pecho en la autopista Prados del Este (VIDEO)|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/05/10/mas-atrocidades-gnb-venezolano-recibe-un-bombazo-en-el-pecho-en-la-autopista-prados-del-este-video/|accessdate=11 May 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=10 May 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=EN FOTOS: La brutal represión que dejó la "revolución" este #10May|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/05/10/en-fotos-la-brutal-represion-que-dejo-la-revolucion-este-10may/|accessdate=11 May 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=10 May 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Jorge M.|first1=María Emilia|title=Asesinan a manifestante en Las Mercedes durante protestas del 10 de mayo|url=http://elestimulo.com/blog/asesinan-a-manifestante-de-27-anos-en-las-mercedes/|accessdate=11 May 2017|work=El Estímulo|date=10 May 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Davies|first1=Gareth|title=Horrifying moment a protester is fatally shot in the chest|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-4495564/Horrifying-moment-protester-fatally-shot-chest.html?ITO=applenews|accessdate=11 May 2017|work=[[Daily Mail]]|date=11 May 2017}}</ref> *'''11 May''' - A march commemorating Miguel Castillo Bracho, who died the previous day, occurs with participants carrying flowers while singing hymns and saying prayers. Students in several universities throughout Venezuela also held events in memory of the fallen protester.<ref>{{cite news|title=Oraciones, himnos y flores en homenaje a Miguel Castillo (Fotos)|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/05/11/oraciones-himnos-y-flores-en-homenaje-a-miguel-castillo-fotos/|accessdate=12 May 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=11 May 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> *'''12 May''' - The "March of Grandparents", which was a demonstration of grandparents calling for a better future for their grandchildren, was repressed with tear gas as they attempted to make their way to the ombudsman's headquarters.<ref>{{cite news|title=Reprimen con gas pimienta marcha de los abuelos en Chacaíto #12May (Videos)|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/05/12/reprimen-con-gas-pimienta-marcha-de-los-abuelos-en-chacaito-12may-videos/|accessdate=12 May 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=12 May 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> *'''13 May''' - Opposition protesters block the Central Regional Highway, with demonstrators in Aragua shutting down "the most important roadway in the country", while opposition leaders calling it a "victory" and that they "made history".<ref>{{cite news|title=Machado: Hicimos historia y tomamos la ARC, cada victoria nos lleva a la libertad|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/05/13/machado-hicimos-historia-y-tomamos-la-arc-cada-victoria-nos-lleva-a-la-libertad/|accessdate=14 May 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=13 May 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> *'''14 May''' - Mothers demonstrated wearing black, protesting for a better future for their children and pleaded for Venezuelan authorities to stop killing young protesters.<ref>{{cite news|title=EN FOTOS: Vestidas de negro y en paz manifestaron las madres por una Venezuela sin violencia|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/05/14/en-fotos-vestidas-de-negro-y-en-paz-manifestaron-las-madres-por-una-venezuela-sin-violencia/|accessdate=15 May 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=14 May 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> Opposition parties announce locations for nationwide sit-in protests that were planned for 15 May.<ref>{{cite news|title=Conoce los puntos por estado del "Gran Plantón" de este #15May|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/05/14/conoce-los-puntos-por-estado-del-gran-planton-de-este-15may/|accessdate=15 May 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=14 May 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> *'''15 May''' - The national sit-in occurs with thousands of Venezuelans blocking designated areas of trafficking for up to 12 hours.<ref>{{cite news|title=Manifestantes cumplieron con el "Gran Plantón" de Altamira por 12 horas|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/noticias/oposicion/manifestantes-cumplieron-con-gran-planton-altamira-por-horas_182301|accessdate=16 May 2017|work=[[El Nacional (Caracas)|El Nacional]]|date=15 May 2017|language=es}}</ref> In Táchira, two were shot dead; 17-year-old Luis Alviarez and 32-year-old Diego Hernández.<ref>{{cite news|title=Confirman dos asesinados en Táchira este 15M|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/noticias/sucesos/confirman-dos-asesinados-tachira-este-15m_182440|accessdate=16 May 2017|work=[[El Nacional (Caracas)|El Nacional]]|date=15 May 2017|language=es}}</ref> *'''17 May''' - Venezuelans throughout the country gather in the evening at designated areas to mourn those who had been killed during the protests. Demonstrators in Caracas gathered at Parque Cristal while in Altamira, they gathered at Plaza Francia, with both meetings involving candlelight vigils during the night. In other states such as Lara and Carabobo, citizens participated in peaceful marches, reciting prayers in candlelight.<ref>{{cite news|title=Desafiando la roja oscuridad, Venezuela se manifiesta en honor a los caídos en protestas (FOTOS)|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/05/17/desafiando-la-roja-oscuridad-venezuela-se-manifiesta-en-honor-a-los-caidos-en-protestas-fotos/|accessdate=21 May 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=17 May 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> *'''18 May''' - 24-year-old Paul René Moreno, a student of medicine at University of Zulia and a member of the Green Cross, was killed after being struck by an armored [[Toyota Hilux]] in Maracaibo.<ref>{{cite news|title=Asesinaron a miembro de la Cruz Verde durante protesta en Maracaibo|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/noticias/oposicion/asesinaron-miembro-cruz-verde-durante-protesta-maracaibo_182998|accessdate=19 May 2017|work=[[El Nacional (Caracas)|El Nacional]]|date=18 May 2017|language=es}}</ref> During evening protests, 16-year-old Daniel Rodríguez was killed after being shot in the head by colectivo members while protesting in Córdoba, Táchira.<ref>{{cite news|title=Denuncian que colectivo dejó herido de gravedad a adolescente en Táchira|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/noticias/oposicion/fallecio-daniel-rodriguez-joven-herido-por-civiles-armados-tachira_183075|accessdate=21 May 2017|work=[[El Nacional (Caracas)|El Nacional]]|date=19 May 2017|language=es}}</ref> *'''19 May''' - Protesters in Mérida close off multiple roads with barricades.<ref>{{cite news|title=Cierran principales vías de Mérida con barricadas|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/noticias/protestas/cierran-principales-vias-merida-con-barricadas_183089|accessdate=21 May 2017|work=[[El Nacional (Caracas)|El Nacional]]|date=19 May 2017|language=es}}</ref> In the evening hours, strong clashes occur in Altos Mirandinos, resulting in one young man dead, 60 injured, 15 arrested and over 70 businesses in the area looted.<ref>{{cite news|title=Noche de protestas en los Altos Mirandinos|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/noticias/protestas/noche-protestas-los-altos-mirandinos_183331|accessdate=21 May 2017|work=[[El Nacional (Caracas)|El Nacional]]|date=20 May 2017|language=es}}</ref> *'''20 May''' - On the 50th day of consecutive protests, millions of Venezuelans protested in Caracas during the "We Are Millions" march, demanding an end to violent repression and immediate elections. Capriles announced that the march would later head towards the Ministry of Internal Affairs; the march was blocked shortly afterwards.<ref>{{cite news|title=El gentío que abarrotó la autopista Francisco Fajardo (FOTOS)|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/05/20/el-gentio-que-abarroto-la-autopista-francisco-fajardo-fotos/|accessdate=20 May 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=20 May 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> Reporters captured images of authorities using fireworks against protesters as well as obtaining shotgun shells used by state forces that were loaded with [[Marble (toy)|marbles]].<ref>{{cite news|title=PNB lanzó cohetones contra manifestantes|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/noticias/protestas/pnb-lanzo-cohetones-contra-manifestantes_183405|accessdate=21 May 2017|work=[[El Nacional (Caracas)|El Nacional]]|date=20 May 2017|language=es}}</ref> In Caracas alone, the march resulted in more than 90 individuals wounded.<ref>{{cite news|title=Más de 90 heridos tras represión en la marcha "Somos Millones"|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/noticias/oposicion/mas-heridos-tras-represion-marcha-somos-millones_183427|accessdate=21 May 2017|work=[[El Nacional (Caracas)|El Nacional]]|date=21 May 2017|language=es}}</ref> In the Francisco de Miranda avenue, a gray Corsa drove towards an opposition march, being the third incident where a vehicle runs over demonstrators. The driver ran over at least five persons, one of which was taken to Salud Chacao.<ref>{{cite news|title=Reportan 1 herido por arrollamiento en la avenida Francisco de Miranda|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/noticias/oposicion/reportan-herido-por-arrollamiento-avenida-francisco-miranda_183385|accessdate=21 May 2017|agency=El Nacional|date=20 May 2017|language=es}}</ref> During evening protests, Alejandro Aguilar was killed in Valera, Trujillo by colectivo members despite nearby police presence.<ref>{{cite news|title=Asesinaron a joven en Valera|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/noticias/sucesos/asesinaron-joven-valera-por-disparo-pecho_183426|accessdate=21 May 2017|work=[[El Nacional (Caracas)|El Nacional]]|date=21 May 2017|language=es}}</ref> *'''22 May''' - The March of Health occurs in Caracas with demonstrators attempting to travel to the Ministry of Health headquarters to protest against the shortages of medicine and other essential medical supplies,<ref>{{cite news|title=Manifestantes se dirigen hacia la Francisco Fajardo #22May|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/05/22/manifestantes-se-dirigen-hacia-la-francisco-fajardo-22may/|accessdate=22 May 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=22 May 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> though the march was quickly repressed by authorities.<ref>{{cite news|title=GN reprimió fuertemente la Marcha de la Salud de este #22May (Fotos + Video)|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/05/22/gn-reprimio-fuertemente-la-marcha-de-la-salud-de-este-22may-fotos-video/|accessdate=22 May 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=22 May 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> The health march was the only official opposition demonstration of the day.<ref name=CHAVEZburns>{{cite news|title=Incendian la casa natal de Hugo Chávez luego de la muerte de dos estudiantes en Barinas|url=http://www.diariolasamericas.com/america-latina/incendian-la-casa-natal-hugo-chavez-luego-la-muerte-dos-estudiantes-barinas-n4122528|accessdate=23 May 2017|work=[[Diario Las Americas]]|date=22 May 2017|language=es}}</ref> An government endorsed medic march headed from Caracas Square to the [[Miraflores Palace]] in support of the assembly constituency.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Castro|first1=Frederlin|title=Sector salud oficialista se moviliza en apoyo a la Constituyente|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/noticias/politica/sector-salud-oficialista-moviliza-apoyo-constituyente_653724|accessdate=23 May 2017|agency=El Universal|date=22 May 2017|language=es}}</ref> In [[Barinas, Barinas]] near [[Hugo Chávez]]'s hometown, hundreds are injured in rioting against President Maduro's constitutional proposals as at least 50 stores are looted and multiple government buildings are firebombed, including the area's PSUV headquarters and the La Concordia police station where uniforms and firearms were stolen.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Camacho|first1=Yonny|title=Centenares de heridos tras caos y saqueos en Barinas|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/noticias/protestas/centenares-heridos-tras-caos-saqueos-barinas_183635|accessdate=22 May 2017|work=[[El Nacional (Caracas)|El Nacional]]|date=22 May 2017|language=es}}</ref> Following the death of two students who are killed by the National Guard in Barinas, Hugo Chávez's birthplace home is burned down by protesters.<ref name=CHAVEZburns/><ref name=CHIburn>{{cite news|last1=Sanchez|first1=Fabiola|last2=Dreier|first2=Hannah|title=Hugo Chavez's childhood home burned by protesters in Venezuela, lawmaker says|url=http://www.chicagotribune.com/news/nationworld/ct-venezuela-protesters-burn-down-hugo-chavez-childhood-home-20170522-story.html|accessdate=23 May 2017|work=[[Associated Press]]|date=22 May 2017}}</ref> Protesters in the area also destroyed five statues of Chávez in addition to destroying his childhood home.<ref name=CHIburn/> Up to six individuals were killed during the rioting in Barinas.<ref>{{cite news|title=Asciende a cinco los manifestantes asesinados este lunes en Barinas|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/noticias/sucesos/asciende-cinco-los-manifestantes-asesinados-este-lunes-barinas_183754|accessdate=23 May 2017|work=[[El Nacional (Caracas)|El Nacional]]|date=23 May 2017|language=es}}</ref> *'''23 May''' - The CNE clears the way for the [[Venezuelan Constitutional Assembly election, 2017|Constitutional Assembly elections to occur in late-July]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Venezuela's Maduro Unveils Details of Constituent Assembly|url=http://www.telesurtv.net/english/news/Venezuelas-Maduro-Unveils-Details-of-Constituent-Assembly-20170523-0013.html|publisher=[[teleSUR]]|accessdate=24 May 2017|language=es}}</ref> *'''24 May''' - Tens of thousands of Venezuelans march against the CNE's approval of Maduro's Constitutional Assembly, with a march to the CNE headquarters being quickly dispersed. One man was lit on fire in the clashes, suffering severe burns.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Bello|first1=Marco|title=Man set on fire during Venezuela protests|url=https://widerimage.reuters.com/story/man-set-on-fire-during-venezuela-protests|accessdate=1 June 2017|work=[[Reuters]]|date=24 May 2017|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=La manifestación de este #24May del inicio a la represión (Video + Fotos)|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/05/24/la-manifestacion-de-este-24may-del-inicio-a-la-represion-fotos/|accessdate=1 June 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=24 May 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> Government supporters organized a counter march to support the constituency.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Núñez|first1=Aimé|title=Oficialistas marcharon por la paz y en apoyo a la Constituyente en Maracaibo|url=http://www.panorama.com.ve/politicayeconomia/Oficialistas-marcharon-por-la-paz-y-en-apoyo-a-la-Constituyente-en-Maracaibo-20170524-0059.html|accessdate=10 June 2017|agency=Panorama|date=24 May 2017}}</ref> Luisa Ortega Díaz declared during a press conference, while explaining the details of the investigation of Juan Pablo Pernalete, that he was killed by a tear gas canister, contrary to government official's declarations claiming that he was killed with a captive bolt pistol.<ref name="Notitotal">{{cite news|title=Oficialistas marchan este #26May para exigir destitución de Luisa Ortega Díaz|url=http://notitotal.com/2017/05/26/oficialistas-marchan-este-26may-para-exigir-destitucion-de-luisa-ortega-diaz/|accessdate=10 June 2017|agency=Notitotal|date=26 May 2017}}</ref> [[Jorge Rodríguez (politician)|Jorge Rodríguez]] tweeted: "Luisa Ortega Díaz TRAITOR, how many dollars was your conscience worth?? Pernalete was killed by the very same right wing, don't be Inmoral miss "Attorney""<ref>{{cite news|title=¡EL QUIEBRE ES INMINENTE! Jorge Rodríguez estalla contra Luisa Ortega: "Traidora" (+Tuit picado)|url=https://maduradas.com/el-quiebre-es-inminente-jorge-rodriguez-estalla-contra-luisa-ortega-traidora-tuit-picado/|accessdate=10 June 2017|agency=Maduradas|date=24 May 2017}}</ref> The TSJ admitted denounces against eight opposition mayors: five from Miranda and three from Mérida, including Gerardo Blyde, Ramón Muchacho and [[David Smolansky]]. The tribunal published a decision demanding them to prevent barricades in their respective municipalities and protect the right of transit of the citizens under the threat of imprisonment; in 2014 the TSJ released similar sentences that later on justified and aprehension order of mayors [[Daniel Ceballos]] and Enzo Scarano.<ref>{{cite news|title=TSJ ordenó a ocho alcaldes opositores impedir barricadas o irán a prisión|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/noticias/politica/tsj-ordeno-ocho-alcaldes-opositores-impedir-barricadas-iran-prision_184038|accessdate=9 June 2017|agency=El Nacional|date=24 May 2017|language=es}}</ref> The following day the mayors rejected the sentence, declaring that they wouldn't reject any citizen initiative of pacific protest.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Granados|first1=Lewin|title=TSJ declara "improponible" oposición de Smolansky sobre medidas contra alcaldes|url=http://www.analitica.com/actualidad/actualidad-nacional/tsj-declara-improponible-oposicion-de-smolansky-sobre-medidas-contra-alcaldes/|agency=Analítica|date=9 June 2017}}</ref> *'''26 May''' - Venezuelans protest in the "March of the Liberators", demanding the armed forces to cut their support of President Maduro and to obey the constitution, believing that the military had become a political tool of the ruling party. Their march to Fort Tiuna, a large military base in Caracas, was thwarted by authorities who dispersed the demonstrators.<ref>{{cite news|title=Venezuelan Police Break Up Opposition Marches|url=http://www.laht.com/article.asp?ArticleId=2437148&CategoryId=10717|accessdate=1 June 2017|work=[[Latin American Herald Tribune]]|date=26 May 2017}}</ref> Government supporters marched asking for the removal from office of Ortega Díaz after her declarations.<ref name="Notitotal"/> *'''27 May''' - The March for Freedom of Expression occurs to commemorate the tenth anniversary of the [[2007 RCTV protests]] and closing of [[RCTV]].<ref>{{cite news|title=El interior del país también se moviliza #PorLaLibertadDeExpresión #27May|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/05/27/el-interior-del-pais-tambien-se-moviliza-porlalibertaddeexpresion-27may/|accessdate=1 June 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=27 May 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> Reports of Venezuelan authorities firing [[Marble (toy)|marbles]] at demonstrators emerged as the day's protests subsided.<ref>{{cite news|title=Balines de acero y metras disparó la GNB y PNB en la Fajardo este #27May (Video + Fotos)|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/05/27/balines-de-acero-y-metras-disparo-la-gnb-y-pnb-en-la-fajardo-este-27may-video-fotos/|accessdate=1 June 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=27 May 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> *'''29 May''' - Venezuelan authorities block a march to the Ombudsman's office, suppressing demonstrators with tear gas and pressurized-water trucks.<ref>{{cite news|title=Reprimen a manifestantes que marchaban hacia la Defensoría del Pueblo #29May|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/05/29/reprimen-a-manifestantes-que-marchaban-hacia-la-defensoria-del-pueblo-29may/|accessdate=30 May 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=29 May 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> Opposition leader Henrique Capriles and his team were attacked by the National Guard near [[Las Mercedes (district in Caracas, Venezuela)|Las Mercedes]] with three individuals being injured with shotgun pellets – one suffered an open would from the gunfire – while Capriles was beaten by authorities and had his cell phone and equipment stolen.<ref>{{cite news|title=Capriles y su equipo fueron emboscados y robados en Las Mercedes por la GNB #29May|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/05/29/capriles-y-su-equipo-fueron-emboscados-y-robados-en-las-mercedes-por-la-gnb-29may/|accessdate=30 May 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=29 May 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> At a conference following the days protests, it was revealed that nearly 300 were injured, with Capriles stating that a national strike had been considered.<ref>{{cite news|title=Al menos 257 heridos dejó la fuerte represión de este lunes, según Capriles|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/05/29/al-menos-257-heridos-dejo-la-fuerte-represion-de-este-lunes-segun-capriles/|accessdate=30 May 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=29 May 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> *'''30 May''' - A march planned to have embassies and consulates as destinations, because of the OAS chancellors meeting, was cancelled after Henrique Capriles declared that there were plans to attack the embassies and spoil the protest. The march was changed in order to accompany students to the Ministry of Internal Affairs.<ref>{{cite news|title=Cancelada movilización hacia embajadas: Oposición marchará hacia el Ministerio de Interior|url=http://notitotal.com/2017/05/30/oposicion-marchara-hacia-ministerio-interior-este-martes/|accessdate=10 June 2017|date=30 May 2017}}</ref> *'''31 May''' - A march to the headquarters of the Venezuelan Chancellery in Caracas was quickly repressed by authorities, resulting in nearly 100 injured.<ref>{{cite news|title=Cerca de 100 heridos por metras, perdigones y lacrimógenas dejó la represión este #31May en Caracas (FOTOS)|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/05/31/cerca-de-100-heridos-por-metras-perdigones-y-lacrimogenas-dejo-la-represion-este-31may-en-caracas-fotos/|accessdate=1 June 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=31 May 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref>
==June== [[File:Protestas Venezuela 2017 Metra.jpg|thumb|left|200px|Marble shot by the National Guard on 7 June.]] [[File:Escuderos 03 Venezuela 2017.jpg|thumb|right|250px|Protesters protecting themselves from rubber bullets on 7 June.]] [[File:Marcha Neomar Lander 08 Venezuela 2017.jpg|thumb|right|200px|Man kneeling in an altar dedicated to [[Neomar Lander]] on 8 June.]] [[File:Marcha CONATEL 2017.jpg|thumb|right|250px|Protesters outside the entrance of CONATEL on 9 June.]] [[File:We want Maduro to resign.jpg|250px|thumb|right|Students holding signs asking for Maduro's resignation in different languages on 19 June.]] [[File:Escuderos 19 de junio 2017.jpg|250px|thumb|right|Escuderos facing National Guard's tanks in the Francisco Fajardo freeway on June 19, hours before Fabián Urbina was shot dead.]] [[File:David Vallenilla shot.webm|250px|thumb|right|David Vallenilla being shot dead by Venezuelan authorities on 22 June.]] [[File:Trancazo Caracas.jpg|250px|thumb|right|Trancazo (stoppage in English) in eastern Caracas on 23 June.]] [[File:Marcha CNE.jpg|250px|thumb|right|March under rain to the Electoral Council in Caracas on 29 June, minutes before USB students were arrested.]] *'''2 June''' - Protesters demonstrate outside of the state television studios of [[Venezolana de Televisión]] in Los Ruices, demanding the channel to not censor the crisis in Venezuela.<ref>{{cite news|title=Oposición exige desde las afueras de VTV que informen la verdad #2Jun|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/06/02/oposicion-exige-desde-las-afueras-de-vtv-que-informen-la-verdad-2jun/|accessdate=7 June 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=2 June
