2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> 20-year-old Luis Miguel Gutierrez was killed after being shot in Tovar, Mérida.<ref>{{cite news|title=Fiscalía investiga asesinato de manifestante en Tovar, Mérida|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/06/02/fiscalia-investiga-asesinato-de-manifestante-en-tovar-merida/|accessdate=8 June 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=2 June 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> *'''3 June''' - A March of Empty Pots occurs, protesting against shortages and hunger in the country, and is quickly repressed by authorities, resulting in the injuries of several protesters in the Montalbán area of western Caracas.<ref>{{cite news|title=Varios heridos durante brutal represión en Montalbán #3Jun|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/06/03/manifestante-resulto-herido-durante-represion-en-montalban-3jun/|accessdate=8 June 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=3 June 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> *'''5 June''' - A national sit-in occurs once more, though the attempt in Caracas was quickly thwarted by authorities. More than 100 were injured in Caracas following the repression as authorities used live ammunition on protesters. Members of [[CONAS]], an elite anti-kidnapping task force, were seen fire live ammunition near the CCCT shopping mall where protesters gathered in eastern Caracas. The Bolivarian government calls for an evaluation of Attorney General [[Luisa Ortega Diaz]] following her criticism of the government and opposition to the constitutional assembly.<ref>{{cite news|title=More injuries in Venezuela as regime pushes referendum|url=http://www.dw.com/en/more-injuries-in-venezuela-as-regime-pushes-referendum/a-39123757?maca=en-gk_volltext_AppleNews_topstories-16393-xml-atom|accessdate=6 June 2017|work=[[Deutsche Welle]]|date=6 June 2017|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Venezuela's New Government Approach to Crowd Control: Robbery|url=http://www.laht.com/article.asp?ArticleId=2437675&CategoryId=10717|accessdate=6 June 2017|work=[[Latin American Herald Tribune]]|date=5 June 2017}}</ref> *'''6 June''' - Students from various universities in the Caracas areas protested against the constitutional assembly near [[Universidad Metropolitana]], with dozens injured following the response of the National Guard, who fired tier bombs, pellets and marbles at students.<ref>{{cite news|title=Más de 20 alumnos heridos de la Unimet dejó represión en el Distribuidor Metropolitano|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/06/06/mas-de-20-alumnos-heridos-de-la-unimet-dejo-represion-en-el-distribuidor-metropolitano/|accessdate=8 June 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=6 June 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> 19 National Guards are being tried for offenses which include homicide and 18 more have warrants out for their arrest. National Guard forces are also accused of injuring more than half the 1,000 persons reported wounded in demonstrations since April 1. *'''7 June''' - A second march to the CNE occurs. A 17-year-old boy, Neomar Lander, is killed after being shot directly with a tear gas canister.<ref>{{cite news|title=Una bomba lacrimógena presuntamente le habría causado la muerte a un joven en la avenida Libertador|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/06/07/una-bomba-lacrimogena-presuntamente-le-habria-causado-la-muerte-a-un-joven-en-la-avenida-libertador/|accessdate=7 June 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=7 June 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> Government sources argue that he died due to a homemade mortar.<ref>{{cite news|title=Joven venezolano muere al estallarle arma artesanal en protesta|url=http://wp.telesurtv.net/news/Joven-venezolano-muere-al-estallarle-arma-artesanal-en-protesta-20170607-0060.html|accessdate=12 June 2017|agency=Telesur|date=7 June 2017|language=es}}</ref> Demonstrations in Caracas result in at least 200 injured.<ref>{{cite news|title=196 heridos dejó brutal represión en Caracas|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/06/07/un-fallecido-y-196-heridos-dejo-brutal-represion-en-caracas-este-07jun/|accessdate=8 June 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=7 June 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> *'''8 June''' - Venezuelan bishops of the [[Venezuelan Episcopal Conference]] (CEV) meet with [[Pope Francis]], stating that "we have his full trust ... there's no distance between him and the conference".<ref name="CRUX">{{cite news|title=Venezuela's bishops say Pope has their backs in tensions with Maduro|url=https://cruxnow.com/global-church/2017/06/08/venezuelas-bishops-say-pope-backs-tensions-maduro/|accessdate=9 June 2017|work=Crux|date=8 June 2017}}</ref> The bishops of the CEV "completely deny" that the pope is against the opposition and working with President Maduro, stating that the Bolivarian government desires the suffering of Venezuelans to distract them from public policies and that since the Bolivarian government will not guarantee "a humanitarian corridor, the recognition of the National Assembly, the release of the political prisoners, and resuming the electoral calendar", "there's no possibility of dialogue", concluding that the church "cannot trust the words from the government".<ref name="CRUX"/> The National Assembly approved unanimously a no-confidence motion of Néstor Reverol, the minister of internal affairs, due to the actions of security agents, human rights violations and the neglect of his functions as minister.<ref>{{cite news|title=AN aprobó voto de censura a Néstor Reverol|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/noticias/asamblea-nacional/aprobo-voto-censura-nestor-reverol_186664|accessdate=11 June 2017|date=8 June 2017}}</ref> *'''9 June''' - Movimiento Estudiantil students march to CONATEL to deliver a document criticizing censorship in Venezuela. The march was not impeded by authorities and they successfully delivered their statements.{{Citation needed|date=June 2017}} *'''10 June''' - During a march headed towards the Victoria Avenue, the [[Bolivarian National Police|National Police]] fired tear gas at the [[Red Cross]] seat in Caracas in La Candelaria. The building hoisted the Red Cross flag after the attack.<ref>{{cite news|title=La Cruz Roja izó sus banderas en sede de la Candelaria tras represión|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/noticias/sociedad/cruz-roja-izo-sus-banderas-sede-candelaria-tras-represion_187053|agency=El Nacional|date=10 June 2017|language=es}}</ref> *'''12 June''' - The MUD summons the "Metro a Metro" march, with every subway station in Caracas being a meeting point to march to the Supreme Tribunal.<ref>{{cite news|title=Oposición usará el Metro de Caracas para llegar al TSJ este lunes|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/noticias/protestas/oposicion-usara-metro-caracas-para-llegar-tsj-este-lunes_187170|accessdate=9 August 2017|agency=El Nacional|date=11 June 2017|language = es}}</ref> Entries to the Tribunal were blocked by National Guardsmen.{{citation needed|date=August 2017}} *'''13 June''' - SEBIN officers shot a dog in the eye during a raid in a residential community in western Caracas. Neighbors also reported electricity and water cuts, damage to their vehicles and that CONAS, National Guard and SEBIN officers entered firing tear gas towards the buildings.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Toro|first1=Satya|title=Sebin le disparó a un perro en el ojo durante allanamiento en Los Verdes|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/noticias/sucesos/sebin-disparo-perro-ojo-durante-allanamiento-los-verdes_187562|agency=El Nacional|date=13 June 2017|language=es}}</ref> *'''14 June''' -Protests occur in Altamira, with the National Guard firing tear gas at national and international media correspondents so they would not cover their response to protests.<ref>{{cite news|title=Continúa la arremetida: GNB lanza lacrimógenas a los pies de la prensa nacional e internacional (Video)|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/06/14/continua-la-arremetida-gnb-lanza-lacrimogenas-a-los-pies-de-la-prensa-nacional-e-internacional-video/|accessdate=17 June 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=14 June 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> *'''15 June''' - Thousands marched for peace during the Divina Pastora procession in Barquisimeto, Lara.<ref>{{cite news|title=¡Histórico! Divina Pastora salió en multitudinaria procesión por segunda vez en un mismo año|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/06/15/historico-divina-pastora-salio-en-multitudinaria-procesion-por-segunda-vez-en-un-mismo-ano/|accessdate=17 June 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=15 June 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> [[Cacerolazo]]s were held in Caracas, with banging pots being heard throughout the capital city.<ref>{{cite news|title=Caracas se activó y le suenan duro esas ollas a Maduro este #15Jun (+Video)|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/06/15/caracas-se-activo-y-le-suenan-duro-esas-ollas-a-maduro-este-15jun-video/|accessdate=17 June 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=15 June 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> *'''16 June''' - Bolivarian official [[Pedro Carreño]] calls on the Supreme Court to prosecute Attorney General [[Luisa Ortega Díaz]], with magistrates ruling that Ortega was prohibited from leaving Venezuela.<ref>{{cite web|title=TSJ envía "LA NOTA" de prensa para decir que Maikel Moreno "recibió" recurso contra la Fiscal|url=https://www.scribd.com/document/351516452/TSJ-envia-LA-NOTA-de-prensa-para-decir-que-Maikel-Moreno-recibio-recurso-contra-la-Fiscal|website=Scribd|accessdate=19 June 2017|language=en}}</ref> In Barquisimeto, Lara, a young man was killed after being shot at a demonstration.<ref>{{cite news|title=Muere un joven durante manifestación en Barquisimeto|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/06/16/muere-un-joven-durante-manifestacion-en-barquisimeto/|accessdate=17 June 2017|work=www.lapatilla.com|date=16 June 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> *'''17 June''' - At least 180 Twitter accounts of the Venezuelan government were suspended.<ref>{{cite news|title=Villegas denuncia suspensión de cuentas Twitter de entes públicos y chavistas|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/06/17/villegas-denuncia-suspension-de-cuentas-twitter-de-entes-publicos-y-chavistas/|accessdate=19 June 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=17 June 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> The United in Faith Marches occur throughout the country.<ref>{{cite news|title=Arranca caminata de Unidos en la Fe por la paz de Venezuela en Carabobo|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/06/17/arranca-caminata-de-unidos-en-la-fe-por-la-paz-de-venezuela-en-carabobo/|accessdate=10 July 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=17 June 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> *'''18 June''' - Students who were marching nearly {{convert|380|km|mi}} from Barquisimeto to Caracas arrived in Los Teques, Miranda near Caracas and had their goods stolen by National Guardsmen in the area.<ref>{{cite news|title=Estudiantes que caminan desde Barquisimeto a Caracas llegaron a Los Teques (Fotos y Video)|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/06/18/estudiantes-que-caminan-desde-barquisimeto-a-caracas-llegaron-a-los-teques-fotos-y-video/|accessdate=19 June 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=18 June 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> *'''19 June''' - 17-year-old Fabián Urbina, who had been already wounded during a protest on 17 March near [[Universidad Pedagógica Experimental Libertador]] in Maracay,<ref>{{cite news|last1=González|first1=Carolina|title=Fabián Urbina ya había sido herido durante ataque de colectivos y GNB en Upel Maracay|url=https://www.el-carabobeno.com/fabian-urbina-colectivos-gnb-upel-maracay/|agency=El Carabobeño|date=19 June 2017|language=es}}</ref> was killed by a National Guardsman who fired live ammunition at protesters in Altamira, wounding at least four others.<ref>{{cite news|title=[EXCLUSIVO] Registramos cuando GNB le disparó a manifestantes en Altamira|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/noticias/protestas/exclusivo-registramos-cuando-gnb-disparo-manifestantes-altamira_188563|agency=El Nacional|date=19 June 2017|language=es}}</ref> Néstor Reverol admitted that the National Guard was responsible for his death and assured that justice would be brought to those who were responsible for the violence.<ref>{{cite news|title=Ministro Reverol admite que la GNB mató a Fabián Urbina|url=http://runrun.es/nacional/314295/ministro-reverol-admite-que-la-gnb-mato-a-fabian-urbina.html|agency=Runrun.es|date=19 June 2017|language=es}}</ref> *'''20 June''' - The TSJ releases a statement announcing an extraordinary public hearing involving Attorney General Luisa Ortega Diaz in a "merit suit", stating that Marching since 8 June, students from Barquisimeto complete their {{convert|380|km|mi}} journey to Caracas.<ref>{{cite news|title=Estudiantes que emprendieron caminata desde Barquisimeto llegan a Caracas #20Jun|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/06/20/estudiantes-que-emprendieron-caminata-desde-barquisimeto-llegan-a-caracas-20jun/|accessdate=20 June 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=20 June 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> Following the TSJ's actions, the opposition-led National Assembly convened and enacted Article 350 of the constitution, which states that Venezuelans "will not know any regime, legislation or authority that violates democratic values, principles and guarantees or impairs human rights", further explaining that further TSJ actions would not be recognized and expressed support for Attorney General Ortega.<ref>{{cite news|title=Unidad anuncia activación del 350, nueva hoja de ruta y respaldo a la Fiscal General|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/06/20/unidad-anuncia-activacion-del-350-nueva-hoja-de-ruta-y-respaldo-a-la-fiscal-general/|accessdate=21 June 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=20 June 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> A march in memory of Fabián Urbina who was shot and killed by a National Guardsman the previous day was rescheduled to 21 June due to the passing of [[Tropical Storm Bret (2017)|Tropical Storm Bret]],<ref>{{cite news|title=Venezolanos realizarán movilización nocturna este #21Jun en rechazo a la violencia|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/06/20/unidad-realizara-movilizacion-nocturna-este-21jun-en-rechazo-a-la-violencia/|accessdate=21 June 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=20 June 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> many still appeared to demonstrate through the storm.<ref>{{cite news|title=Independiente de la cancelación, la lluvia y la noche; los venezolanos honraron a Fabián Urbina este #20Jun (FOTOS)|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/06/20/independiente-de-la-cancelacion-la-lluvia-y-la-noche-los-venezolanos-honraron-a-fabian-urbina-este-20jun-fotos/|accessdate=21 June 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=20 June 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> *'''21 June''' - Hundreds march to the OAS headquarters in eastern Caracas, passing the spot where Fabian Urbina was shot dead by National Guardsmen.<ref>{{cite news|title=Latin American Herald Tribune - Opposition Marches to OAS Office in Caracas, Remembering Victims of Protests|url=http://www.laht.com/article.asp?ArticleId=2438655&CategoryId=10717|accessdate=22 June 2017|work=[[Latin American Herald Tribune]]|date=22 June 2017}}</ref> The opposition announces plans to march to the Attorney General's office to support Ortega on Thursday, convene citizen assemblies denouncing the constitutional assembly on Friday and resuming protests on Saturday.<ref>{{cite news|title=Himno Nacional, Alma Llanera y sana PAZ sin órganos de represión: Marcha nocturna honró a los caídos en sede OEA|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/06/21/himno-nacional-alma-llanera-y-sana-paz-sin-organos-de-represion-marcha-nocturna-honro-a-los-caidos-en-sede-oea/|accessdate=22 June 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=21 June 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> *'''22 June''' - 22-year-old David José Vallenilla died in the El Ávila clinic after being shot at point blank range by an [[Venezuelan Air Force|Air Force]] officer in front of the [[Generalissimo Francisco de Miranda Air Base]],<ref>{{cite news|title=Joven de 22 años fue asesinado con disparo en el pecho en la autopista|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/noticias/protestas/joven-anos-fue-asesinado-con-disparo-pecho-autopista_189110|agency=El Nacional|date=22 June 2017|language=es}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Momento en que GNB disparó a quemarropa a manifestante en La Carlota|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/videos/protestas/momento-que-gnb-disparo-quemarropa-manifestante-carlota_35746|agency=El Nacional|date=22 June 2017|language=es}}</ref> being the first death in hands of an [[National Bolivarian Armed Forces of Venezuela|Armed Forces]] officer besides the National Guard.<ref>{{cite news|title=David Vallenilla murió en manos de funcionario de la Fuerza Aérea|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/noticias/sucesos/david-vallenilla-murio-manos-funcionario-fuerza-aerea_189187|agency=El Nacional|date=22 June 2017|language=es}}</ref> *'''23 June''' - A national trancazo occurs.<ref>{{cite news|title=Alfredo Jimeno: En honor a David Vallenilla y a todos nuestros hermanos caídos realizamos trancazo nacional|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/06/23/alfredo-jimeno-en-honor-a-david-vallenilla-y-a-todos-nuestros-hermanos-caidos-realizamos-trancazo-nacional/|accessdate=10 July 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=23 June 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> *'''24 June''' - The President Maduro warned that ''he and his supporters would be willing to take up arms if his government was toppled by "undemocratic forces".'' Thousands of protesters demonstrate near the La Carlota airport following the death of David José Vallenilla on 22 June, calling for less repression of protesters.<ref>{{cite news|title=Opositores se concentraron frente a Base Aérea La Carlota #24Jun|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/06/24/desde-estos-puntos-saldra-la-oposicion-para-concentrarse-en-la-carlota-24jun/|accessdate=10 July 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=24 June 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> *'''25 June''' - The opposition announces future trancazo protests.<ref>{{cite news|title=Unidad anuncia mega-trancazo de 4 horas para este lunes #26Jun (+Agenda)|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/06/25/unidad-anuncia-mega-trancazo-de-4-horas-para-este-lunes-26jun-agenda/|accessdate=10 July 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=25 June 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> *'''26 June''' - Another national trancazo protest occurs.<ref>{{cite news|title=Inicia "trancazo" en la autopista Francisco Fajardo #26Jun|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/06/26/inicia-trancazo-en-la-autopista-francisco-fajardo-26jun/|accessdate=10 July 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=26 June 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> At night, mass looting occurs in [[Maracay, Aragua]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Tensión en Maracay: Saqueos y represión este #26jun (VIDEOS)|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/06/26/maracay-bajo-tension-reportan-saqueos-y-fuerte-represion-este-26jun-videos/|accessdate=10 July 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=26 June 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> *'''27 June''' - In the afternoon, a video is released showing men with assault rifles flanking [[Óscar Pérez (policeman)|Oscar Pérez]], an actor and investigator of [[CICPC]], Venezuela's investigative agency, stating that "We are nationalists, patriots and institutionalists. This fight is not with the rest of the state forces, it is against the tyranny of this government".<ref name=PANOperez>{{cite news|last1=Rincón|first1=Arminda|title=Funcionario del Cicpc se convirtió en protagonista de una película|url=http://www.panorama.com.ve/experienciapanorama/Funcionario-del-Cicpc-se-convirtio-en-protagonista-de-una-pelicula-20151025-0041.html|accessdate=28 June 2017|work=[[Diario Panorama]]|date=25 October 2015|deadurl=bot: unknown|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170628015924/http://www.panorama.com.ve/experienciapanorama/Funcionario-del-Cicpc-se-convirtio-en-protagonista-de-una-pelicula-20151025-0041.html|archivedate=28 June 2017|df=}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Militar roba helicóptero y lanza granadas contra sede de TSJ de Venezuela|url=https://www.elheraldo.co/mundo/militar-roba-helicoptero-y-lanza-granadas-contra-sede-de-tsj-de-venezuela-376657|accessdate=28 June 2017|work=[[El Heraldo (Colombia)|El Heraldo]]|date=27 June 2017|language=es}}</ref> Pérez, a CICPC investigator and helicopter pilot of nearly 20 years had recently become an actor in 2015.<ref name=PANOperez/> Hours after the video was released, [[Caracas helicopter incident|Pérez is seen piloting a CICPC helicopter over the Supreme Court with a banner on the side reading "350 Liberty"]], a reference to Article 350 of the constitution which states that "The people of Venezuela ... shall disown any regime, legislation or authority that violates democratic values, principles and guarantees or encroaches upon human rights".<ref name="NBCmia">{{cite news|title=Maduro Says Helicopter Fired on Venezuela's Supreme Court|url=http://www.nbcmiami.com/news/local/Maduro-Reports-of-Alleged-Military-Uprising-in-Venezuela-431196343.html?_osource=SocialFlowTwt_MIBrand|accessdate=28 June 2017|work=NBC 6 South Florida|date=27 June 2017|language=en}}</ref> While the helicopter was near the Supreme Court, gunfire was heard in the area.<ref name="NBCmia"/> President Maduro stated that a military rebellion had occurred while opposition officials said that the actions were staged so Maduro could justify a crackdown on those who oppose his government and the constitutional assembly.<ref name="NBCmia"/> National Guardsmen then storm the [[National Assembly (Venezuela)|National Assembly]], assaulting the largely opposition legislative body.<ref name="NBCmia"/> *'''28 June''' - A trancazo in Caracas closes the [[Francisco Fajardo Freeway]] for hours.<ref>{{cite news|title=¡Vacías! Así lucen las autopistas capitalinas por el trancazo de este #28Jun (+Fotos y Videos)|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/06/28/vacias-asi-lucen-las-autopistas-capitalinas-por-el-trancazo-de-este-28jun-fotos-y-videos/|accessdate=10 July 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=28 June 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> *'''29 June''' - March to the CNE occurs, where a group of protesters, including 17 students from the Universidad Simón Bolivar were arrested.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Castro|first1=Frederlin|title=PNB detuvo a 19 estudiantes de la USB en El Rosal|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/noticias/politica/pnb-detuvo-estudiantes-usb-rosal_659233|accessdate=14 July 2017|agency=El Universal|date=29 June 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> The Prados del Este Highway was blocked during a trancazo.<ref>{{cite news|title=Cerrada la autopista Prados del Este a la altura de Santa Fe #29Jun (fotos)|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/06/29/cerrada-la-autopista-prados-del-este-a-la-altura-de-santa-fe-29jun/|accessdate=10 July 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=29 June 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> President Maduro states that the [[Bolivarian missions]] must be "re-launched".<ref>{{cite news|title=¡A reparación! Maduro manda a "revisar" las misiones: Es la gran tarea (Video)|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/06/29/a-reparacion-maduro-manda-a-revisar-las-misiones-es-la-gran-tarea-video/|accessdate=10 July 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=29 June 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> The Supreme Court barred the Attorney General [[Luisa Ortega Diaz]] from leaving the country and froze her assets, due to alleged "serious misconduct" in office.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.voanews.com/a/venezuela-attorney-general-barred-from-leaving-country/3920939.html|title=Venezuela's Attorney General Barred From Leaving Country|publisher=Voice of America|date=29 June 2017}}</ref> Despite having been appointed under the government of [[Hugo Chávez]]. She has been conspicuous in refusing to extend blanket support for the beleaguered regime of [[Nicolas Maduro]]. *'''30 June''' - Protests occur in the state of [[Lara (state)|Lara]], with a large truck dumping unused butcher bones to barricade streets, though hungry Venezuelans later removed all of [[Bone marrow (food)|the bones to eat]].<ref>{{cite news|title=¡Hecho en socialismo! Armaron barricada con huesos y la gente los recogió para comer (fotos+video)|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/06/30/hecho-en-socialismo-armaron-barricada-con-huesos-y-la-gente-los-recogio-para-comer-fotosvideo/|accessdate=10 July 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=30 June 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> At least four are killed during protests in Lara.<ref>{{cite news|title=Asesinatos en Lara a manos de paramilitares y fuerzas de in-seguridad habrían aumentado a cuatro #30Jun|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/06/30/asesinatos-en-lara-a-manos-de-paramilitares-y-fuerzas-de-in-seguridad-habrian-aumentado-a-cuatro-30jun/|accessdate=10 July 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=30 June 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref>
== July == [[File:2017 Venezuelan National Assembly attack.webm|thumb|250px|right|[[Colectivo (Venezuela)|Colectivos]] attacking lawmakers during the [[2017 Venezuelan National Assembly attack]]]] [[File:Leopoldo López free.webm|250px|thumb|right|López chanting "''[[Sí se puede]]''" following his release to house arrest]] [[File:Óscar Pérez.jpg|200px|thumb|right|Óscar Pérez appearance in the nocturnal opposition march in Altamira on July 13]] [[File:Catia plebiscito nacional de Venezuela de 2017.webm|250px|thumb|right|[[Colectivo (Venezuela)|Colectivos]] firing at voters in Catia]] [[File:Caja Consulta Popular 16J.jpg|200px|thumb|right|Ballot box of a voting center on 16 July]]
* '''1 July''' - 25 protesters who were arrested in Caracas on 29 June, including 17 USB students, were sentenced unconditional freedom and nullity of arrest.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Mora|first1=Fanny|title=Otorgan libertad plena a los 25 estudiantes detenidos en El Rosal|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/noticias/politica/otorgan-libertad-plena-los-estudiantes-detenidos-rosal_659606|accessdate=14 July 2017|agency=El Universal|date=2 July 2017|language = ES}}</ref> * '''2 July''' - 27 Universidad Pedagógica Experimental Libertador (UPEL) students were arrested in [[Maracay]] after police officers burst into the college campus, violating the university's autonomy. * '''3 July''' - The opposition announces an unofficial referendum for Venezuelans to participate in to contest with the constitutional assembly on 30 July. Citizens were invited to vote on 16 July to share their opinions on the military, the proposed constitutional assembly and if they preferred the creation of a separate "national unity" government.<ref>{{cite news|title=Venezuela Opposition Challenges Maduro With Unofficial Referendum|url=https://www.usnews.com/news/world/articles/2017-07-03/venezuela-opposition-plans-unofficial-july-16-vote-on-maduro-plan|accessdate=12 July 2017|work=[[US News and World Report]]|date=3 July 2017}}</ref> * '''4 July''' - The 27 UPEL students arrested on 2 July were taken to military tribunals and sentenced to jail, while the female students were placed on house arrest.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Segura|first1=Brian|title=Estudiantes de la UPEL Maracay fueron sentenciados este martes 4Jul|url=http://www.caraotadigital.net/regionales/estudiantes-de-la-upel-maracay-fueron-sentenciados-este-martes-4jul/|accessdate=14 July 2017|agency=Caraota Digital|date=4 July 2017 |language= es}}</ref> * '''5 July''' - The [[2017 Venezuelan National Assembly attack]] occurs after [[Vice President of Venezuela|Vice President]] [[Tareck El Aissami]] leads supporters and [[Colectivo (Venezuela)|colectivos]] to the [[Palacio Federal Legislativo]]. National Guardsman allow mobs of government supporters into the National Assembly facility, with the attack leaving at least 12 opposition lawmakers and their staff injured.<ref name=SBSvote>{{cite news|title=Deadly violence erupts at Venezuela vote|url=http://www.sbs.com.au/news/article/2017/07/17/deadly-violence-erupts-venezuela-vote|accessdate=17 July 2017|work=[[SBS News]]|date=16 July 2017|language=en}}</ref> The opposition later announced plans for the [[Venezuelan referendum, 2017]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://efectococuyo.com/politica/plebiscito-consulta-referendo-juicio-popular-convocatoria-de-la-oposicion-para-el-16jul|title=¿Plebiscito, consulta, referendo, juicio popular?, convocatoria de la oposición para el #16Jul|date=4 July 2017|work=[[Efecto Cocuyo]]|language=es-ES|accessdate=15 July 2017}}</ref> * '''6 July''' - The MUD announces the questions to be asked on the ballots in their unofficial referendum, with ballots asking voters if they deny the proposed Constitutional Assembly, if they demand the armed forces to support the 1999 constitution and the National Assembly and if they demand immediate general elections with the creation of a "unity government".<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/noticias/oposicion/mud-anuncio-las-tres-preguntas-para-plebiscito-popular_191558|title=MUD anunció las tres preguntas para el plebiscito popular|date=6 July 2017|work=[[El Nacional (Caracas)|El Nacional]]|language=es|last1=Web|first1=El Nacional|accessdate=15 July 2017}}</ref> * '''7 July''' - Archbishop Diego Padron, president of the [[Venezuelan Episcopal Conference]], states that the Constitutional Assembly is "unnecessary and inconvenient", that it would result in "a military, socialist, Marxist and communist dictatorship" and that the process was illegal since the Bolivarian government required a referendum prior to voting for members of an assembly.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.miamiherald.com/news/nation-world/world/americas/venezuela/article160091129.html|title=Catholic Church calls Venezuela government 'dictatorship'|last=|first=|date=7 July 2017|work=[[The Miami Herald]]|access-date=2017-07-17|language=en}}</ref> * '''8 July''' - Opposition leader [[Leopoldo López]] is released from [[Ramo Verde Prison]] and placed on house arrest.<ref name="REUTrelease">{{cite news|last1=Oré|first1=Diego|last2=Gupta|first2=Girish|title=Buoyed by Lopez release, Venezuela opposition rallies for 100th day|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-venezuela-politics-idUSKBN19U0S6|accessdate=9 July 2017|work=[[Reuters]]|date=9 July 2017}}</ref> * '''9 July''' - Thousands take to the streets of Caracas to protest for the 100th consecutive day.<ref name="REUTrelease"/> * '''10 July''' - Another national trancazo occurs.{{citation needed|date=July 2017}} An [[Improvised explosive device|IED]] targeting members of the Venezuelan National Guard on motorcycle is detonated on the Troncal 9 in [[Altamira (Caracas)|Altamira]].<ref name="BellingcatIED">{{cite news |publisher=[[bellingcat]] |title=The Bombs of Caracas |date=September 2, 2017 |first=Nick |last=Waters |url=https://www.bellingcat.com/news/americas/2017/09/02/the-bombs-of-caracas/}}</ref> * '''13 July''' - The <nowiki>''</nowiki>Nocturnal March of the Fallen<nowiki>''</nowiki> of the fallen occurs. Óscar Pérez makes an appearance in Altamira neighborhood of Caracas announcing support for the opposition-organized referendum that was to be held on July 16 and promoted upon the so-called "Zero Hour" of 18 July.<ref>{{cite news|title=Óscar Pérez apareció en Altamira y envió nuevo mensaje|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/noticias/oposicion/oscar-perez-aparecio-altamira-envio-nuevo-mensaje_192991|accessdate=14 July 2017|agency=El Nacional|publisher=13 July 2017|language = es}}</ref> 21-year-old protester Giovany Scovino with [[Asperger syndrome]] was severely beat up by four National Guardsmen and four National Policemen in [[Lecheria, Anzoategui|Lechería]], [[Anzoátegui]], causing him [[hematomas]] and [[internal bleeding]]. Tarek William Saab described the actions as "cruel, degrading and inhuman treatment", visited Scovino in the hospital where he was hospitalized and announced the security officers were under arrest, although the [[Public Ministry of Venezuela|Public Ministry]] denied this and announced that the arrest hasn't been formalized.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Mora|first1=Fanny|title=MP desmiente detención de GNB y PNB agresores de joven con Asperger|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/noticias/sucesos/desmiente-detencion-gnb-pnb-agresores-joven-con-asperger_661809|accessdate=18 July 2017|agency=El Universal|date=17 July 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Pellicani|first1=Giovanna|title=VIDEO | Joven que recibió golpiza de la GN y PNB en Lechería tuvo que ser operado|url=https://elpitazo.com/oriente/video-joven-que-recibio-golpiza-de-la-gn-y-pnb-en-lecheria-tuvo-que-ser-operado/|accessdate=18 July 2017|agency=El Pitazo|date=15 July 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Defensor visitó a Gianni Scovino atacado por efectivos de seguridad en Lechería|url=http://www.2001.com.ve/en-la-agenda/164585/defensor-visito-a-gianni-scovino-atacado-por-efectivos-de-seguridad-en-lecheria.html|accessdate=18 July 2017|agency=2001.com.ve|date=16 July 2017}}</ref> The [[Bolivarian National Police]] are outfitted with new militarized, camouflage uniforms and red berets during a ceremony in Caracas, with President Maduro – while wearing the new uniform – comparing himself to [[Saddam Hussein]] and announced a raise of the salary for the [[Bolivarian National Police]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/07/14/ahora-la-pnb-estara-mas-rojita-que-nunca-dotan-con-boinas-a-los-nuevos-represores-video/|title=Ahora la PNB estará más ROJITA que nunca … Dotan con boínas a los nuevos represores (+video)|last=|first=|date=|website=[[La Patilla]]|language=es-ES|access-date=2017-07-15}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/07/14/chiste-del-dia-maduro-condecora-asciende-y-le-sube-el-sueldo-a-los-represores-de-la-pnb-video/|title=¡Chiste del día! Maduro condecora, asciende y le sube el sueldo a los represores de la PNB (+video)|last=|first=|date=|website=[[La Patilla]]|language=es-ES|access-date=2017-07-15}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/07/14/maduro-dice-en-cadena-nacional-que-se-parece-al-dictador-sadam-husein-video/|title=Maduro dice en cadena nacional que se parece al dictador Sadam Husein (video)|last=|first=|date=|website=[[La Patilla]]|language=es-ES|access-date=2017-07-15}}</ref> * '''16 July''' - The [[Venezuelan National Consultation, 2017|National Consultation]] occurs as Venezuelans vote internationally. In Catia, colectivos fire upon voters in the neighborhood that was predominately pro-government, killing two.<ref name="SBSvote"/> Participation in the "rehearsal" for President Maduro's constitutional assembly is low, with Maduro ignoring the attack on voters in Catia and instead blaming his opposition for any violence in the country.<ref name="SBSvote" /> The results of the election show that over 99% of those who voted did not want the constitutional assembly proposed by President Maduro, wanted the [[Venezuelan armed forces]] to support the 1999 constitution and the National Assembly, and demanded an immediate general elections as well as the establishment of a "unity government".<ref name="ENresults">{{cite news|title=Más de siete millones de venezolanos participaron en consulta popular|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/noticias/oposicion/mas-siete-millones-venezolanos-participaron-consulta-popular_193587|accessdate=17 July 2017|work=[[El Nacional (Caracas)|El Nacional]]|date=17 July 2017|language=es}}</ref> * '''17 July''' - The opposition announces their future "Zero Hour" plans to achieve a "unity" government. On 18 July, it was planned for the Commission on Judicial Applications to announce candidates for a separate Supreme Tribunal Justice (TSJ). On 19 July, the creation of a Government of National Union will occur following the "popular consultation" on 16 July, with the signing of a Unitary Commitment for Governance. On 20 July, a nationwide strike is planned to occur for 24 hours. On 21 July, the new opposition elected [[:es:Tribunal Supremo de Justicia de Venezuela en el exterior|TSJ magistrates would be appointed]].<ref>{{cite news|title=El pueblo decidió, el manifiesto de la AN y la Unidad que anuncia la hora cero|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/07/17/el-pueblo-decidio-el-manifiesto-de-la-an-y-la-unidad-que-anuncia-la-hora-cero/|accessdate=17 July 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=17 July 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> * '''18 July''' - Spontaneous protests occur throughout Caracas, shutting down roads in many areas.<ref>{{cite news|title=Protestas espontáneas paralizan parcialmente Caracas #18Jul|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/07/18/protestas-espontaneas-paralizan-parcialmente-caracas-18jul/|accessdate=19 July 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=18 July 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> Strong clashes between the National Guard and protesters near [[Universidad Metropolitana]] occur, with a National Guard [[VN-4]] [[Vehicle-ramming attack|running over]] protesters after they had attacked the vehicle with Molotov cocktails.<ref>{{cite news|title=En FOTOS y VIDEO: La tanqueta que arrolló y detuvo manifestantes en la Universidad Metropolitana|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/07/18/en-fotos-y-video-la-tanqueta-que-arrollo-y-detuvo-manifestantes-en-la-universidad-metropolitana/|accessdate=19 July 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=18 July 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Tanqueta de la GNB intentó arrollar a un estudiante de la Unimet|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/noticias/protestas/tanqueta-gnb-intento-arrollar-estudiante-unimet_193932|accessdate=19 July 2017|work=[[El Nacional (Caracas)|El Nacional]]|date=18 July 2017|language=es}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Quemaron una tanqueta de la GNB en el distribuidor Metropolitano|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/noticias/protestas/quemaron-una-tanqueta-gnb-distribuidor-metropolitano_193908|accessdate=19 July 2017|work=[[El Nacional (Caracas)|El Nacional]]|date=18 July 2017|language=es}}</ref> * '''19 July''' - A national trancazo occurs, with Venezuelans barricading and blocking major highways and transit points throughout the country.<ref>{{cite news|title=Movimiento Estudiantil invitó al trancazo de 10 horas mañana|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/noticias/protestas/mud-anuncio-convocatoria-para-este-miercoles-19j_193967|accessdate=20 July 2017|work=[[El Nacional (Caracas)|El Nacional]]|date=18 July 2017|language=es}}</ref> The Venezuelan opposition cancels its plan to make an alternative government – known as the Government of National Unity – instead announcing plans to fix the crisis in Venezuela, while also focusing on further protests and a nationwide strike.<ref>{{cite news|title=The Latest: Venezuela opposition eases alternate gov't plan|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/the_americas/the-latest-vatican-backs-venezuela-clerics-amid-crisis/2017/07/19/2c86f484-6c97-11e7-abbc-a53480672286_story.html|accessdate=20 July 2017|work=[[The Washington Post]]|date=19 July 2017}}</ref> * '''20 July''' - Millions of Venezuelans participate in the opposition's 24-hour general strike, with industry and commerce ceasing throughout the nation. President Maduro warns private business owners that they would face consequences for participating in the strike, though many public offices were also short of staff due to the strike. Protesters barricaded streets to maintain the slowdown, with opposition leader Henrique Capriles calling on demonstrators to clear paths for emergency vehicles when necessary.<ref>{{cite news|title=Millions heed anti-Maduro strike in Venezuela|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/2017/07/millions-heed-anti-maduro-strike-venezuela-170720212929397.html|accessdate=21 July 2017|work=[[Al Jazeera]]|date=20 July 2017}}</ref> * '''22 July''' - Protesters march towards the Supreme Court alleging them of bias towards President Maduro.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/07/22/world/americas/venezuela-protests-maduro.html |title=The Battle for Venezuela, Through a Lens, Helmet and Gas Mask}}</ref> * '''27 July''' - The President Nicolás Maduro, proposed to the opposition to set up a dialogue, national agreement and reconciliation, before the [[National Constitutional Assembly]] (NCA) is installed. Maduro said ''"The opposition should take this proposal, I know what I say! I propose to the opposition to abandon the insurrectional path, to return to the Constitution and install in the next few hours, before the election and installation of the NCA, a table of dialogue, national agreement and reconciliation. A national table of understanding, to talk about the great issues of the country, to talk about peace."'' At least five people are killed in violent clashes with police after a strike was declared by the opposition.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/2017/07/killed-venezuela-opposition-strike-begins-170727051242154.html |title=Five killed in Venezuela as opposition strike begins}}</ref>
[[File:2017 Venezuelan Constitutional Assembly bomb.webm|thumb|right|A bomb detonated near a Bolivarian National Police convoy on 30 July]] * '''30 July''' - The [[Venezuelan Constitutional Assembly election, 2017|2017 Venezuelan Constitutional Assembly election]] occurs amid international condemnation.<ref>{{cite news|title=La lista de los 40 países democráticos que hasta el momento desconocieron la Asamblea Constituyente de Venezuela|url=http://www.infobae.com/america/venezuela/2017/07/31/la-lista-de-los-40-paises-democraticos-que-hasta-el-momento-desconocieron-la-asamblea-constituyente-de-venezuela/|accessdate=1 August 2017|work=[[Infobae]]|date=31 July 2017|language=es-LA}}</ref> A bomb is detonated near a motorcycle convoy of the [[Bolivarian National Police]] that were responding to protest, injuring seven officers.<ref name="BellingcatIED"/><ref name="WPdp">{{cite news|last1=Faiola|first1=Anthony|title=Defying international calls, Venezuela holds contentious election|url=http://www.denverpost.com/2017/07/30/venezuela-holds-election/|accessdate=31 July 2017|work=[[The Washington Post]]|agency=[[The Denver Post]]|date=31 July 2017}}</ref><ref name="CNBCbomb">{{cite news|title=Deadly protests mar Venezuela ballot as voters snub Maduro assembly|url=https://www.cnbc.com/2017/07/30/deadly-protests-mar-venezuela-ballot-as-voters-snub-maduro-assembly.html|accessdate=31 July 2017|work=[[CNBC]]|date=30 July 2017}}</ref><ref name="WPdp"/> At least 10 people are killed in violent incidents during the election.<ref>{{cite news|title=Fiscalía reporta 121 muertes y casi 2.000 heridos en protestas|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/07/31/fiscalia-reporta-121-muertes-y-casi-2-000-heridos-en-protestas/|accessdate=1 August 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=31 July 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> * '''31 July''' -The U.S. Treasury Secretary [[Steven Mnuchin]] branded the president Nicolas Maduro, a "dictator" on a par with Zimbabwe's [[Robert Mugabe]], Syria's [[Bashar al-Assad]] or North Korea's [[Kim Jong-un]], and imposed sanctions on him following Sunday's controversial vote on the constitution.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://money.cnn.com/2017/07/31/news/economy/treasury-venezuela-president-sanctions/index.html|publisher=CNN|title=U.S. slaps sanctions on Venezuelan president Maduro|date=31 July 2017}}</ref> The international community rounded on Maduro and condemned polling day violence in which up to 15 people were killed. The president Maduro hailed the vote as a "sublime" victory for the Venezuelan people, as the [[National Electoral Council of Venezuela|Electoral National Council]] (CNE) said more than eight million people had cast ballots nationwide to give the president increased powers. But the opposition dismissed that figure as fabricated, pointing to reports of empty polling stations and citing anonymous government sources as putting the figure at just under 2.5 million. The United States has already imposed sanctions on several Venezuelan individuals and organisations, but, in taking the rare step of targeting a sitting head of state by name, it signalled growing alarm at the crisis. UK Secretary of State for Foreign and Commonwealth Affairs, Boris Johnson warned that Venezuela "stands on the brink of disaster" following the contentious vote.
==August== * '''1 August''' - [[Leopoldo López]] and [[Antonio Ledezma]] under house arrest were dragged from their homes in midnight [[SEBIN]] raids and placed back into Ramo Verde Prison.<ref name="LLsebinAUG">{{cite news|title=Líderes políticos reaccionan ante traslado de Ledezma y López a Ramo Verde|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/08/01/lideres-politicos-reaccionan-ante-traslado-de-ledezma-y-lopez-a-ramo-verde/|accessdate=1 August 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=1 August 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> The U.S. Secretary of Department of State [[Rex Tillerson]] on Twitter wrote: '' "Or Maduro decides that it is unfeasible and wants to leave on his own count or we return government back to the Constitution."'' * '''2 August''' - The [[Bolivarian National Guard]] seizes the [[Palacio Federal Legislativo]] in order to install the [[2017 Constitutional Assembly of Venezuela]].<ref>{{cite news|title=GNB toma salón de Parlamento para instalación de Constituyente|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/08/02/gnb-toma-salon-de-parlamento-para-instalacion-de-constituyente/|accessdate=3 August 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=2 August 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> [[Smartmatic]], the computing company that runs [[National Electoral Council of Venezuela|CNE]]'s voting machines, stated that the results of the 2017 Constituency Assembly election were tampered with by the CNE. The Smartmatic CEO [[Antonio Mugica]] said: "We know, without a doubt, that the result of the recent elections for a National Constituent Assembly were manipulated," and added "We estimate that the difference between actual and announced participation by the authorities is at least one million votes". [[Reuters]] also reported that according to internal CNE documents leaked to the agency, only 3,720,465 votes were cast thirty minutes before polls were expected to close, though polls were open for an additional hour. The president Maduro stood by the official count of more than 8 million votes and said an additional 2 million people would have voted if they had not been blocked by opposition protesters. "That stupid guy, the president of Smartmatic, pressured to the neck by the gringos and the Britains, said there were 7.5 million [voters]", Maduro said in televised remarks. "I think there were 10 million Venezuelans who went out." The CNE principal rector [[Tibisay Lucena]] dismissed Mugica's allegations, calling it an "opinion" of a company (Smartmatic) that played only a secondary role in the election and had no access to complete data. [[Julio Borges]], the leader of the opposition-held parliament, said voter fraud was "the most serious crime that can be committed against democracy"''.'' Meanwhile, international pressure mounted on president Maduro as his country and government became increasingly isolated after [[Federica Mogherini]], the European Union's high representative for foreign affairs, said in a statement that the union would not recognise the new constituent assembly due to "concerns over its effective representativeness and legitimacy". * '''3 August''' - South American bloc [[Mercosur]] begins to trigger its democratic clause to suspend Venezuela indefinitely furthering its past temporary suspension and not allowing the country to rejoin until the crisis is resolved.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-venezuela-mercosur/mercosur-trade-bloc-to-evict-venezuela-source-idUSKBN1AJ2RI |title=Mercosur trade bloc to evict Venezuela: source}}</ref> * '''4 August''' - [[Antonio Ledezma]] was sent back home where he has been placed under house arrest and unable to express himself publicly.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://elcomercio.pe/movil/mundo/latinoamerica/venezuela-antonio-ledezma-alcalde-caracas-cumplio-dos-anos-preso-noticia-1969928|date=19 February 2017|title=Antonio Ledezma, alcalde de Caracas, cumplió dos años preso [Antonio Ledezma, mayor of Caracas, served two years in prison]}}</ref> The [[2017 Constitutional Assembly of Venezuela]] is sworn in and for its first act, dissolves the opposition-led [[National Assembly (Venezuela)|National Assembly]] which had been [[Venezuelan parliamentary election, 2015|elected into office in late-2015]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Venezuela ushers in new pro-government chamber as opposition struggles to regroup|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/the_americas/venezuela-ushers-in-new-pro-government-chamber-as-opposition-vows-rebellion/2017/08/04/9c0c71e2-7883-11e7-8c17-533c52b2f014_story.html|accessdate=4 August 2017|date=4 August 2017|work=[[The Washington Post]]}}</ref> The Constituent Assembly brings large portraits of Chávez and [[Simón Bolívar]], placing them in the [[Palacio Federal Legislativo]] to show support for the Bolivarian government.<ref>{{cite news|title=¡La guerra de los retratos! Regresan fotos de Chávez a la Asamblea Nacional #4Ago|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/08/04/la-guerra-de-los-retratos-regresan-fotos-de-chavez-a-la-asamblea-nacional-4ago/|accessdate=4 August 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=4 August 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> A pro-opposition march intended to arrive at the Palacio Federal Legislativo was blocked by Venezuelan authorities who fired tear gas and [[shotgun]]s at protesters.<ref>{{cite news|title=Fuerzas de in-seguridad del Estado impidieron que marcha llegara hasta la AN|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/08/04/fuerzas-de-in-seguridad-del-estado-impidieron-que-marcha-llegara-hasta-la-an/|accessdate=4 August 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=4 August 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> Earlier, the Holy See had asked the Venezuelan government to maintain the current Constitution and prevent or suspend the Constituent Assembly, which must be installed on the same day, and once again expresses its deep concern about the radicalization and worsening of the crisis in the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela, due to the increase in the number of deaths, injuries and detainees. * '''5 August''' - Luisa Ortega Diaz was dismissed as Prosecutor General by the newly established [[2017 Constituent Assembly of Venezuela|National Constitutional Assembly]]. National Guardsmen block entry into the Public Ministry headquarters preventing Ortega Diaz, from entering the facility.<ref>{{cite news|title=Fotos: En vez de defender la constitución la Guardia Bolivariana toma por asalto la sede de la Fiscalía|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/08/05/fotos-en-vez-de-defender-la-constitucion-la-guardia-bolivariana-toma-por-asalto-la-sede-de-la-fiscalia/|accessdate=5 August 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=5 August 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Venezuela constitutional assembly fires chief prosecutor|url=http://www.dw.com/en/venezuela-constitutional-assembly-fires-chief-prosecutor/a-39973289|publisher=Deutsche Welle|accessdate=5 August 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Venezuela's Ousted Attorney General Retreats on a Motorbike|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/08/05/world/americas/venezuela-prosecutor-ortega-fires-maduro.html|publisher=The New York Times|accessdate=5 August 2017}}</ref> [[File:2017 Venezuela Paramacay base attack.png|thumb|right|250px|A tank and soldiers detain occupants of a vehicle following the 6 August attack on Paramacay Military Base.]] [[File:2017 Paramacay Military Base attack aftermath.jpg|thumb|Venezuelan troops following the recapture of Paramacay Military Base]] * '''6 August''' - Approximately 20 individuals led by fugitive Captain Juan Caguaripano's "41st Brigade" [[Attack on Fort Paramacay|attack Paramacay Military Base]] near [[Valencia, Venezuela]] at 4:30AM VET, with a gun battle ensuing. By 8:00AM VET, about half of the attackers escaped from the base with military weapons while two attackers were killed, one seriously injured and seven were captured. Residents throughout Valencia and the state of [[Carabobo]] began to protest chanting "Freedom", though they were mostly dispersed by Venezuelan authorities. Reports of explosions heard throughout the city continued into the afternoon hours.<ref>{{cite news|title=Venezuela troops quash anti-Maduro attack on military base|url=http://www.miamiherald.com/news/nation-world/article165723422.html|accessdate=6 August 2017|work=[[The Miami Herald]]|date=6 August 2017|language=en|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170806095447/http://www.miamiherald.com/news/nation-world/article165723422.html|archivedate=6 August 2017|df=}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Venezuela arrests over 'uprising attempt'|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-latin-america-40843494|accessdate=6 August 2017|work=[[BBC News]]|date=6 August 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Casey|first1=Nicholas|title=Military Base Attacked in Venezuela as Video Calls for Rebellion|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/08/06/world/americas/venezuela-nicholas-maduro-military-base-attacked.html|accessdate=6 August 2017|work=[[The New York Times]]|date=6 August 2017}}</ref> In total, Captain Juan Caguaripano's troops stole 97 [[AK-103]] rifles and 182 magazines; 5 40mm grenade launchers and 140 [[40 mm grenade]]s; 41 bayonets and 6 pistols.<ref>{{cite news|title=Maduro sin armas|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/08/10/maduro-sin-armas/|accessdate=10 August 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=10 August 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> * '''7 August''' - [[Leopoldo Lopez]] was sent back home where he has been placed under house arrest and unable to express himself publicly. * '''8 August''' - The opposition holds a national trancazo that has a low turnout, with authorities promptly dispersing protesters and removing barricades in eastern Caracas.<ref>{{cite news|title=Manifestantes opositores realizan un Trancazo en Caracas contra la Constituyente de Maduro|url=http://www.infobae.com/america/venezuela/2017/08/08/manifestantes-opositores-realizan-un-trancazo-en-caracas-contra-la-constituyente/|accessdate=10 August 2017|work=[[Infobae]]|date=8 August 2017|language=es-LA}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Mora|first1=Fanny|title=Inició el trancazo y PNB disparó bombas lacrimógenas en Altamira|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/noticias/politica/inicio-trancazo-pnb-disparo-bombas-lacrimogenas-altamira_664859|accessdate=10 August 2017|work=[[El Universal (Caracas)|El Universal]]|date=8 August 2017|language=es}}</ref> * '''9 August''' - New sanctions are placed on Venezuela by the United States against eight individuals to deter "further democratic backsliding" in the country.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-venezuela-politics/u-s-slaps-new-sanctions-on-venezuela-fugitive-mayor-defiant-idUSKBN1AP1PO?il=0 |title=U.S. slaps new sanctions on Venezuela, fugitive mayor defiant}}</ref> * '''11 August''' - Reports emerge that judges that the opposition-led National Assembly chose to be part of a separate supreme court had begun to flee Venezuela out of fear of imprisonment, with some fleeing by boat and to the embassies of foreign governments.<ref>{{cite news|title=En bote o a pie, magistrados huyen de Venezuela para no ser encarcelados|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/08/11/en-bote-o-a-pie-magistrados-huyen-de-venezuela-para-no-ser-encarcelados/|accessdate=12 August 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=11 August 2017}}</ref> The Bolivarian government bans the departure and use of private watercraft and boats.<ref>{{cite news|title=Autoridades prohíben zarpe de embarcaciones marítimas deportivas|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/08/11/autoridades-prohiben-zarpe-de-embarcaciones-maritimas-deportivas/|accessdate=12 August 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=11 August 2017}}</ref> Venezuelan Minister of Defense, [[Vladimir Padrino López]], announces that Captain Juan Caguaripano and First Lieutenant Yefferson García Dos Ramos, two leaders of the attack on the Paramacay Military Base, were captured in Caracas.<ref>{{cite news|title=Padrino López dice que capturaron al ex-capitán Caguaripano: el "autor" del robo de armas del Fuerte Paramacay|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/08/11/padrino-lopez-dice-que-capturaron-al-ex-capitan-caguaripano-el-autor-del-robo-de-armas-del-fuerte-paramacay/|accessdate=12 August 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=11 August 2017}}</ref> The US President [[Donald Trump]] said that he is "not going to rule out a military option" to confront the autocratic government of Nicolás Maduro and the deepening crisis in Venezuela.<ref>{{cite news|title=Trump won't 'rule out a military option' in Venezuela|accessdate=12 August 2017|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/post-politics/wp/2017/08/11/trump-wont-rule-out-a-military-option-in-venezuela/|work=[[The Washington Post]]|date=11 August 2017}}</ref> Venezuela's Defense Minister [[Vladimir Padrino López]] immediately criticized Trump for his statement, calling it "an act of supreme extremism" and "an act of madness." The Venezuelan communications minister, [[Ernesto Villegas]], said Trump's words amounted to "an unprecedented threat to national sovereignty."<ref>{{cite news|title=Trump's Threat to Invade Venezuela Boosts Embattled Leader Maduro|accessdate=12 August 2017|url=http://www.slate.com/blogs/the_slatest/2017/0812/trump_s_threat_to_invade_venezuela_amounts_to_a_big_gift_for_embattled_leader.html|work=[[Slate (magazine)|Slate]]|date=12 August 2017}}</ref> President Maduro's son, [[Nicolás Maduro Guerra]], stated during the 5th [[2017 Constituent Assembly of Venezuela|Constituent Assembly of Venezuela]] session that if the United States were to attack Venezuela, "the rifles would arrive in New York, Mr. Trump, we would arrive and take the [[White House]]".<ref>{{cite news|last1=Uzcátegui|first1=Ruth|title=Nicolás Maduro Guerra sobre intervención de Trump: Llegaríamos a tomar la Casa Blanca|url=http://www.panorama.com.ve/politicayeconomia/Nicolas-Maduro-Guerra-sobre-intervencion-de-Trump-Llegariamos-a-tomar-la-Casa-Blanca-20170812-0027.html|accessdate=13 August 2017|work=[[Diario Panorama]]|date=12 August 2017|language=es}}</ref> [[Peru]]vian President [[Pedro Pablo Kuczynski]] expels Venezuela's ambassador to Peru, calling Maduro a "dictator" in protest.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-venezuela-politics-peru/peru-expels-venezuelan-ambassador-to-protest-constituent-assembly-idUSKBN1AR2B7 |title=Peru expels Venezuelan ambassador to protest constituent assembly}}</ref> * '''12 August''' - An opposition march is held with little participation, with only about 1,000 participants. Venezuelans state that they have lost interest in the protest movement due to the fear of repression and because of their anger towards the conflicted opposition, expressing their disapproval with the opposition's decision to participate in Venezuela's fraudulent electoral processes.<ref>{{cite news|title=Entre indignación, rabia, impotencia y miedo, muchos opositores han abandonado las calles|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/08/13/entre-indignacion-rabia-impotencia-y-miedo-muchos-opositores-han-abandonado-las-calles/|accessdate=14 August 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=13 August 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> * '''16 August''' - Security forces raid a prison in [[Puerto Ayacucho]], [[Amazonas (Venezuelan state)|Amazonas State]], with 37 inmates killed in what Amazonas Governor [[Liborio Guarulla]] calls a "massacre".<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-venezuela-prison/thirty-seven-inmates-killed-in-government-raid-on-venezuelan-prison-idUSKCN1AW2QE |title=Thirty-seven inmates killed in government raid on Venezuelan prison}}</ref> * '''18 August''' - The National Constituent Assembly votes unanimously to assume the powers of the opposition-led National Assembly.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-latin-america-40983115 |title=Disputed Venezuela assembly takes parliament's powers}}</ref> * '''30 August''' - On the month anniversary following the Constituent Assembly, about 200 protesters organized by neighborhood organizations gathered in eastern Caracas to protest against the government in one of the first protests since the election.<ref>{{cite news|title=Así fue el homenaje a las víctimas de la violencia este #30Ago (Fotos)|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/08/30/asi-fue-el-homenaje-a-las-victimas-de-la-violencia-este-30ago-fotos/|accessdate=31 August 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=30 August 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref>
== September == * '''19 September''' - President of the [[2017 Constituent National Assembly|Constituent National Assembly]] [[Delcy Rodríguez]] stated that during the months of protest, Venezuelan authorities acted "in strict compliance with the Constitution of the Republic and the laws" and that the government "completely shielded the performance of security agencies".<ref>{{cite news|title=Delcy Rodríguez asegura que fuerzas del orden actuaron apegadas a Ley durante protestas|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/09/19/delcy-rodriguez-asegura-que-fuerzas-del-orden-actuaron-apegadas-a-ley-durante-protestas/|accessdate=24 September 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=19 September 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> * '''23 September''' - ''Resistance'' protesters gathered in Chacao to peacefully protest, with the protest being dispersed after the march entered the Sambil mall while some demonstrators were also detained.<ref>{{cite news|title=Polichacao disolvió protesta pacífica de la Resistencia y se llevó algunos detenidos (Fotos)|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/09/23/polichacao-disolvio-protesta-pacifica-de-la-resistencia-y-se-llevo-algunos-detenidos-fotos/|accessdate=24 September 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=23 September 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> * '''25 September''' - Protesters are dispersed by the National Guard in Chacao after blocking Francisco de Miranda Avenue, with a few demonstrators being arrested.<ref>{{cite news|title=GNB reprime y detiene a manifestantes en Chacao #25S|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/09/25/gnb-reprime-y-detiene-a-manifestantes-en-chacao-25s/|accessdate=26 September 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=25 September 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref>
== October == * '''2 October''' - Sporadic protests occur in Caracas on International Nonviolence Day, with demonstrators demanding the right to peacefully protest.<ref>{{cite news|title=Caraqueños tomaron las calles en el Día Internacional de la No Violencia (FOTOS)|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/10/02/caraquenos-tomaron-las-calles-en-el-dia-internacional-de-la-no-violencia-fotos/|accessdate=3 October 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=2 October 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> * '''15 October''' - [[Venezuelan regional elections, 2017|Regional elections are held]] with "the National Electoral Council, which is subservient to the government, said President Nicolás Maduro's socialist party won 17 of 23 governorships across the country" while the opposition won 5 governorships. Sporadic protests occur in the country.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Long|first1=Gideon|title=Venezuela elections dogged by fraud claims|url=https://www.ft.com/content/6bdb4434-b227-11e7-a398-73d59db9e399|accessdate=17 October 2017|work=[[Financial Times]]|date=16 October 2017}}</ref> The MUD opposition coalition immediately prepared to organize protests calling the results fraudulent.<ref>{{cite news|title=MUD prepara acciones de calle ante resultados anunciados por el CNE|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/noticias/oposicion/mud-prepara-acciones-calle-ante-resultados-anunciados-por-cne_207998|accessdate=17 October 2017|work=[[El Nacional (Caracas)|El Nacional]]|date=16 October 2017|language=es}}</ref> * '''16 October''' - Three MUD activists are arrested in the early morning while protesting near a Regional Electoral Office in the state of Bolivar.<ref>{{cite news|title=Detuvieron a activistas de la MUD por protestar frente al CNE en Bolívar|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/noticias/oposicion/detuvieron-activistas-mud-por-protestar-frente-cne-bolivar_208028|accessdate=17 October 2017|work=[[El Nacional (Caracas)|El Nacional]]|date=16 October 2017|language=es}}</ref> Minister of Interior Justice and Peace, [[Néstor Reverol]], announces a nationwide ban of protests and gatherings until 3 November 2017.<ref>{{cite news|title=Reverol: Ley Seca vence este lunes 16, pero prohibición de manifestaciones es hasta el 3N|url=http://efectococuyo.com/politica/reverol-ley-seca-vence-este-lunes-16-pero-prohibicion-de-manifestaciones-es-hasta-el-3n|accessdate=17 October 2017|work=[[Efecto Cocuyo]]|date=16 October 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref>
== November == * '''1 November''' - Attorney General [[Tarek William Saab]] announces preliminary plans to prosecute individuals involved with organizing protests.<ref>{{cite news|title=Saab solicitará antejuicio de mérito contra quienes han "incitado a la violencia y la conspiración"|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/11/01/saab-solicitara-antejuicio-de-merito-contra-quienes-han-incitado-a-la-violencia-y-la-conspiracion/|accessdate=2 November 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=1 November 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref> * '''4 November''' - The Supreme Tribunal of Justice called for the diplomatic immunity of [[Freddy Guevara]], the vice president of the National Assembly, to be lifted, accusing him of leading protests.<ref>{{cite news|title=Venezuela high court targets key opposition leader|url=https://lasvegassun.com/news/2017/nov/04/venezuela-high-court-targets-key-opposition-leader/|accessdate=4 November 2017|work=[[Las Vegas Sun]]|date=4 November 2017|language=en}}</ref> * '''23 November''' - Oscar Pérez, who participated in the [[Caracas helicopter incident]], appeared for a third time to the public on an internet video. He sat beside a man who criticized the corruption of the Bolivarian government. As the video concluded, Pérez shared his only words, calling for renewed protests by the Venezuelan people, stating "the generals without troops are nobody".<ref>{{cite news|title="Estamos en caos": Reaparece Óscar Pérez en un mensaje contra el régimen (+Video) {{!}} El Cooperante|url=https://elcooperante.com/estamos-en-caos-reaparece-oscar-perez-en-un-mensaje-contra-el-regimen-de-maduro-video/|accessdate=25 November 2017|work=El Cooperante|date=23 November 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref>
== December == * '''2 December''' - Talks between the moderate opposition parties and the Bolivarian government stall as neither side compromises, with further talks scheduled to begin on 15 December.<ref>{{cite news|title=Venezuela political talks end without deal, new meeting planned Dec. 15|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-venezuela-politics/venezuela-political-talks-end-without-deal-new-meeting-planned-dec-15-idUSKBN1DX001|accessdate=5 December 2017|work=[[Reuters]]|date=2 December 2017}}</ref> * '''11 December''' - President Maduro announces that the three main opposition parties, [[Justice First]], [[Democratic Action (Venezuela)|Democratic Action]], and [[Popular Will]] would be banned from participating in [[Venezuelan presidential election, 2018|the 2018 presidential election]] because of their boycott of the [[Venezuelan municipal elections, 2017|2017 municipal elections]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-latin-america-42304594 |title=Venezuela opposition banned from running in 2018 election |work=[[BBC News]] |date=11 December 2017}}</ref> * '''24 December''' - The final death during the 2017 protests occurs on Christmas Eve when an 18 year old pregnant woman was caught in a protest over limited amounts of pork. She was shot and killed by a National Guardsman at the scene who was later arrested.<ref name="FINALbbc">{{cite news|title=Venezuela soldier held over queue killing|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-latin-america-42537345|accessdate=2 January 2018|work=[[BBC News]]|date=1 January 2018}}</ref> * '''25 December''' - Scattered protests and looting occurred on Christmas Day in Venezuela due to the shortages, inflation, gasoline rationing and power outages. Venezuelan military personnel were stationed at petrol stations to ration amounts purchased by drivers.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Ramirez|first1=Maria|title=Twenty-eight arrests after Venezuela looting, violence|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-venezuela-arrests/twenty-eight-arrests-after-venezuela-looting-violence-idUSKBN1EK1CL|accessdate=27 December 2017|work=[[Reuters]]|date=26 December 2017}}</ref> * '''27 December''' - Sporadic protests, with groups no larger than fifty people, continue throughout the country with Venezuelans demanding food and gasoline.<ref>{{cite news|title=Venezolanos protestan por la escasez de todo en la peor Navidad|url=https://www.lapatilla.com/site/2017/12/27/venezolanos-protestan-por-la-escasez-de-todo-en-la-peor-navidad/|accessdate=28 December 2017|work=[[La Patilla]]|date=27 December 2017|language=es-ES}}</ref>
==See also== *[[Timeline of the 2014 Venezuelan protests]] *[[Timeline of the 2015 Venezuelan protests]] *[[Timeline of the 2016 Venezuelan protests]]

{{Use dmy dates|date=November 2018}} {{other uses}} {{expand German|Tirol|date=July 2017}} {{expand Italian|Tirolo|date=July 2017}} {{Infobox country |native_name = ''Tirol'' {{ger}}
''Tirolo'' {{it}} |conventional_long_name = Tyrol |common_name = Tyrol |other_name = |motto = "''Land im Gebirge, Terra inter montes, Terra fra i monti''" (in [[German language|German]], [[Ladin language|Ladin]] and [[Italian language|Italian]])
"'' Country in the mountains ''" |image_flag = Flag of Tirol.svg |image_coat = Wappen Gefürstete Grafschaft Tirol.png |national_anthem = |official_languages = [[German Language|German]], [[Italian language|Italian]], [[Ladin language|Ladin]], [[Cimbrian language|Cimbrian]] and [[Mòcheno language|Mòcheno]] |capital = [[Tirol, South Tyrol|Tirol]] (1027–1418)
[[Merano]] (1418–1848)
[[Innsbruck]] (1848–1918)
[[Innsbruck]] (1918–today) |demonym = Tyrolese, Tyroleans |largest_city = |population_estimate = 1,813,400 |population_estimate_year = 2017 |population_density_km2 = 68 |leader_title1 = |leader_name1 = |leader_title2 = |leader_name2 = |leader_title3 = |leader_name3 = |area_km2 = 26,674 |image_map = Eurorregión Tirol-Tirol del Sur-Trentino.png |map_caption = The southern part of Tyrol is located in [[Northern Italy]] and the northern part in Western Austria |image_map2 = Tirol vor 1918.png |map_caption2 = The region consists of present-day [[Tyrol–South Tyrol–Trentino Euroregion]], including [[Cortina d'Ampezzo]], [[Fodóm]] (Buchenstein), [[Colle Santa Lucia|Col]] (Verseil), [[Valvestino]], [[Magasa, Lombardy|Magasa]] and [[Pedemonte]] |currency = [[Euro]] (€) |currency_code = EUR |cctld = }} '''Tyrol''' ({{IPAc-en|t|ɪ|ˈ|r|oʊ|l|,_|t|aɪ|-|,_|ˈ|t|aɪ|r|oʊ|l}};[http://www.dictionary.com/browse/tyrol "Tyrol"]. ''[[Random House Webster's Unabridged Dictionary]]''. historically '''the Tyrole''';{{Google books|al7PAAAAMAAJ|The Gentleman's Magazine, Volume 75 (1794)|page=160 }}{{cite web|title=PressReader.com - Zeitungen aus der ganzen Welt|trans-title=|periodical=pressreader.com|publisher=|url=https://www.pressreader.com/uk/the-jewish-chronicle/20110715/284601714290633|format=|accessdate=2017-07-19|last=|date=|year=|month=|day=|language=German|pages=|quote=}}{{Google books|N4A5AAAAcAAJ|Venice under the yoke of France and of Austria|page=PA1}} {{lang-de|Tirol}} {{IPA-de|tiˈʁoːl||De-at-Tirol.ogg}}; {{lang-it|Tirolo}}) is a historical region in the [[Alps]]; in northern [[Italy]] and western [[Austria]]. The area was to [[Habsburg Monarchy|Habsburg times]] the former [[County of Tyrol]]. The [[Treaty of Saint-Germain-en-Laye (1919)|Treaty of Saint-Germain-en-Laye]] in 1919 divided the area into two parts: * State of [[Tyrol (state)|Tyrol]]; formed by [[North Tyrol|North]] and [[East Tyrol]], it belongs to the [[Republic of Austria]] * Region of [[Trentino-South Tyrol]]; at that time still with [[Souramont]] ([[Cortina d'Ampezzo]], [[Livinallongo del Col di Lana]] and [[Colle Santa Lucia]]) and the municipalities [[Valvestino]], [[Magasa, Lombardy|Magasa]] and [[Pedemonte]], belonged to the [[Kingdom of Italy]], since 1946 the [[Italy|Italian Republic]]. With the founding of the European region [[Tyrol-South Tyrol-Trentino Euroregion|Tyrol-South Tyrol-Trentino]] the area has its own legal entity since 2011 in the form of a [[European Grouping for Territorial Cooperation]]. == Etymology == According to {{ill|Egon Kühebacher|de}}, the name ''Tyrol'' derives from a root word meaning ''terrain'' (i.e. area, ground or soil; compare {{lang-la|terra}} and [[Old Irish]]: ''tir''); first from the village of [[Tirol, South Tyrol|Tirol]], and its [[Tyrol Castle|castle]]; from which the [[County of Tyrol]] grew.{{cite book |first=Egon |last=Kühebacher |title=Die Ortsnamen Südtirols und ihre Geschichte. Die geschichtlich gewachsenen Namen der Gemeinden, Fraktionen und Weiler |language=German |publisher={{ill|Athesia (publisher)|lt=Athesia|de|Athesia}} |location=[[Bolzano]] |year=1991 |isbn=88-7014-634-0 |pages=470–471}} According to [[Karl Finsterwalder]], the name ''Tyrol'' derives from {{ill|Teriolis|de}}, a late-Roman fort and travellers' hostel in [[Zirl, Tyrol]].{{cite book |first=Karl |last=Finsterwalder |chapter=Besprechung zu C. Battisti – G. Giacomelli, I nomi locali del Burgraviato di Merano |language=German |title=Tiroler Ortsnamenkunde. Gesammelte Aufsätze und Arbeiten |volume=3 |publisher=Wagner |location=Innsbruck |year=1990 |isbn=3-7030-0279-4 |page=1127}} There seems to be no scholarly consensus. ==Geography== ===Location=== [[File:Inntal mit Pendling-2.jpg|thumb|left|[[Inn Valley]] with a view of [[Kufstein]]]] Tyrol has an area of 26,673 km2. The region consists of the State of [[Tyrol (state)|Tyrol]], the Province of [[South Tyrol]] and the [[Trentino|Province of Trento]]. In addition to the region belong the municipalities [[Cortina d'Ampezzo]], [[Livinallongo del Col di Lana]], [[Colle Santa Lucia]] and [[Pedemonte]] from the Region of [[Veneto]] and [[Valvestino]] and [[Magasa, Lombardy|Magasa]] from the Region of [[Lombardy]]. The largest cities in Tyrol are [[Innsbruck]], [[Trento]] and [[Bolzano]]. The whole region of Tyrol is located in the [[Alps]]. Tyrol is bordered to the north by the state of [[Bavaria]] and to the east by the states of [[Carinthia]] and [[Salzburg (state)|Salzburg]]. West of Tyrol lies the state of [[Vorarlberg]] and the canton of [[Grisons]]. On the southern side of Tyrol, the land is bordered by the regions of [[Veneto]] and [[Lombardy]]. Important rivers in Tyrol are the [[Adige]], [[Inn (river)|Inn]] and [[Drau]]. The region is characterized by many valleys. Some of these valleys are still difficult to reach today. The most important valleys are the [[Inn Valley]] and [[Adige Valley]]. A large part of the population lives in these two valleys and also the five largest cities of Tyrol ([[Innsbruck]], [[Bolzano]], [[Trento]], [[Merano]] and [[Rovereto]]) lie in these valleys. For centuries, the region has been known for transit trade. The most important trade route across the Alps, namely the [[Brenner Pass|Brenner Route]], traverses the whole of Tyrol and is regarded as a connecting link between the Italian and [[German speaking area|German]] speaking areas. ===Mountains=== [[File:Ortler Reschensee.JPG|right|200px|thumb|left summit: the [[Gran Zebrù]], right summit: the [[Ortler]]; seen from [[Lake Reschen]]]] As the Tyrolean region is located in the [[Alps]], the landscape is heavily influenced by the mountains. The highest mountains in Tyrol include: * the [[Ortler]] 3905 [[Metres above sea level|m a.s.l.]] * the [[Gran Zebrù]] 3851 m a.s.l. * the [[Grossglockner]]; 3798 [[Metres above the Adriatic|m AA]] * the [[Monte Cevedale]]; 3769 m a.s.l. * the [[Wildspitze]]; 3768 m AA Across Tyrol, on the border between North and South Tyrol, runs the [[main chain of the Alps]].{{cite EB1911 |wstitle=Tirol |first=William Augustus Brevoort |last=Coolidge |volume=26 |page=1010}} The main chain of the Alps geographically divides the Alps into a southern and northern half. ===Biggest municipalities=== [[File:Innsbrucker Tal panorama - panoramio.jpg|thumb|right|[[Innsbruck]]]] [[File:Panorama di trento.jpg|right|thumb|[[Trento]]]] [[File:Panoramic view of Bolzano.jpg|right|thumb|[[Bolzano]]]] [[File:Panorama Lienz.jpg|thumb|right|[[Lienz]]]] Municipalities of Tyrol with over 10,000 inhabitants: {| class="wikitable sortable zebra" |- ! Rank !! Municipality !!
